{key}: List "keyword">with {len(value)} items') "keyword">elif isinstance(value, dict): print(f&#x27; {key}: Dictionary "keyword">with {len(value)} keys') "keyword">else: print(f&#x27; {key}: {type(value).__name__} = {str(value)[:100]}...' "keyword">if len(str(value)) > 100 "keyword">else f' {key}: {value}') # Extract JSTOR URLs "keyword">for full text access jstor_urls = [] "keyword">if &#x27;urls' "keyword">in biblio_data: "keyword">for url_info "keyword">in biblio_data[&#x27;urls']: "keyword">if &#x27;jstor.org' "keyword">in url_info.get('url', ''): jstor_urls.append(url_info) print(f&#x27;\nJSTOR URL found: {url_info["url"]}') print(f&#x27; Type: {url_info.get("type", "Unknown")}') print(f&#x27; Title: {url_info.get("title", "No title")}') print(f&#x27;\nTotal JSTOR URLs available: {len(jstor_urls)}') "keyword">else: print(&#x27;‚ùå No bibliographic data file found') jstor_urls = [] print(&#x27;\n=== STEP 2: ATTEMPTING TO ACCESS FULL TEXT CONTENT ===') print(&#x27;-' * 60) # Set up headers "keyword">for requests headers = { &#x27;User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.124 Safari/537.36', &#x27;Accept': 'text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,image/webp,*/*;q=0.8', &#x27;Accept-Language': 'en-US,en;q=0.5', &#x27;Accept-Encoding': 'gzip, deflate, br', &#x27;Connection': 'keep-alive', &#x27;Upgrade-Insecure-Requests': '1' } # Try to access the main JSTOR book page first main_jstor_url = &#x27;https://www.jstor.org/stable/j.ctv9b2xdv' print(f&#x27;Attempting to access main JSTOR page: {main_jstor_url}') "keyword">try: response = requests.get(main_jstor_url, headers=headers, timeout=30) print(f&#x27;Response status: {response.status_code}') print(f&#x27;Content length: {len(response.content):,} bytes') print(f&#x27;Content type: {response.headers.get("Content-Type", "unknown")}') "keyword">if response.status_code == 200: # Save the main page "keyword">with open(&#x27;workspace/jstor_main_page.html', 'w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: f.write(response.text) print(&#x27;‚úì Main JSTOR page saved to workspace/jstor_main_page.html') # Parse the page to look "keyword">for full text access "keyword">or chapter links soup = BeautifulSoup(response.text, &#x27;html.parser') page_text = soup.get_text() print(f&#x27;\nPage content analysis:') print(f&#x27; Total text length: {len(page_text):,} characters') # Look "keyword">for access indicators access_indicators = { &#x27;full_text': page_text.lower().count('full text'), &#x27;pdf_access': page_text.lower().count('pdf'), &#x27;download': page_text.lower().count('download'), &#x27;read_online': page_text.lower().count('read online'), &#x27;institutional_access': page_text.lower().count('institutional access'), &#x27;login_required': page_text.lower().count('login'), &#x27;subscription': page_text.lower().count('subscription'), &#x27;page_11': page_text.lower().count('page 11') + page_text.lower().count('p. 11'), &#x27;chapter_links': len(soup.find_all('a', href=re.compile(r'j\.ctv9b2xdv\.[0-9]+'))) } print(&#x27;\nAccess indicators found:') "keyword">for indicator, count "keyword">in access_indicators.items(): "keyword">if count > 0: status = &#x27;üî•' "keyword">if count > 10 "keyword">else '‚úÖ' "keyword">if count > 3 "keyword">else '‚ö†Ô∏è' print(f&#x27; {status} {indicator}: {count}') # Look "keyword">for chapter "keyword">or section links that might contain page 11 chapter_links = soup.find_all(&#x27;a', href=re.compile(r'j\.ctv9b2xdv\.[0-9]+')) print(f&#x27;\nFound {len(chapter_links)} chapter/section links:') chapter_urls = [] "keyword">for i, link "keyword">in enumerate(chapter_links[:10], 1): # Limit to first 10 href = link.get(&#x27;href') text = link.get_text().strip() full_url = urljoin(main_jstor_url, href) chapter_urls.append(full_url) print(f&#x27; {i}. {text[:60]}... -> {full_url}') # Look "keyword">for any mention of page numbers "keyword">or table of contents toc_elements = soup.find_all([&#x27;div', 'section', 'ul'], class_=re.compile(r'toc|contents|chapter', re.I)) "keyword">if toc_elements: print(f&#x27;\nFound {len(toc_elements)} potential table of contents elements') "keyword">for i, element "keyword">in enumerate(toc_elements[:3], 1): element_text = element.get_text()[:200] print(f&#x27; TOC {i}: {element_text}...') "keyword">else: print(f&#x27;‚ùå Failed to access main JSTOR page: HTTP {response.status_code}') print(f&#x27;Response preview: {response.text[:500]}') chapter_urls = [] "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as e: print(f&#x27;‚ùå Error accessing main JSTOR page: {str(e)}') chapter_urls = [] time.sleep(2) # Respectful delay print(&#x27;\n=== STEP 3: SEARCHING FOR PAGE 11 CONTENT ===') print(&#x27;-' * 60) # If we have chapter URLs, "keyword">try to access them to find page 11 "keyword">if chapter_urls: print(f&#x27;Attempting to access {len(chapter_urls)} chapter URLs to find page 11...') page_11_found = "keyword">False page_11_content = "keyword">None "keyword">for i, chapter_url "keyword">in enumerate(chapter_urls[:5], 1): # Limit to first 5 chapters print(f&#x27;\nAccessing chapter {i}: {chapter_url}') "keyword">try: time.sleep(1.5) # Respectful delay between requests response = requests.get(chapter_url, headers=headers, timeout=30) print(f&#x27; Status: {response.status_code}') "keyword">if response.status_code == 200: chapter_text = response.text soup = BeautifulSoup(chapter_text, &#x27;html.parser') text_content = soup.get_text() # Save chapter content chapter_filename = f&#x27;workspace/jstor_chapter_{i}.html' "keyword">with open(chapter_filename, &#x27;w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: f.write(chapter_text) print(f&#x27; ‚úì Chapter saved to {os.path.basename(chapter_filename)}') # Search "keyword">for page 11 indicators page_11_indicators = [ text_content.lower().count(&#x27;page 11'), text_content.lower().count(&#x27;p. 11'), text_content.lower().count(&#x27;[11]'), text_content.lower().count(&#x27;11)') ] total_page_11_mentions = sum(page_11_indicators) print(f&#x27; Page 11 mentions: {total_page_11_mentions}') # Look "keyword">for Wikipedia citations wiki_mentions = [ text_content.lower().count(&#x27;wikipedia'), text_content.lower().count(&#x27;en.wikipedia.org'), text_content.lower().count(&#x27;wiki') ] total_wiki_mentions = sum(wiki_mentions) print(f&#x27; Wikipedia mentions: {total_wiki_mentions}') # Look "keyword">for November dates november_patterns = [ r&#x27;November\s+\d{1,2}', r&#x27;Nov\.?\s+\d{1,2}', r&#x27;\d{1,2}\s+November', r&#x27;11/\d{1,2}', r&#x27;November\s+\d{4}' ] november_dates = [] "keyword">for pattern "keyword">in november_patterns: matches = re.findall(pattern, text_content, re.IGNORECASE) november_dates.extend(matches) "keyword">if november_dates: print(f&#x27; November dates found: {november_dates[:5]}') # If this chapter has good indicators, mark it "keyword">for detailed analysis "keyword">if total_page_11_mentions > 0 "keyword">or (total_wiki_mentions > 0 "keyword">and november_dates): print(f&#x27; *** POTENTIAL MATCH - Chapter {i} has page 11 "keyword">or Wikipedia+November content ***') page_11_found = "keyword">True page_11_content = { &#x27;chapter_number': i, &#x27;url': chapter_url, &#x27;filename': chapter_filename, &#x27;page_11_mentions': total_page_11_mentions, &#x27;wiki_mentions': total_wiki_mentions, &#x27;november_dates': november_dates, &#x27;text_length': len(text_content) } # If we found a strong candidate, "keyword">break to analyze it "keyword">if total_page_11_mentions > 0: "keyword">break "keyword">else: print(f&#x27; ‚ùå Failed to access chapter: HTTP {response.status_code}') "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as e: print(f&#x27; ‚ùå Error accessing chapter {i}: {str(e)}') "keyword">continue "keyword">else: print(&#x27;No chapter URLs available to search') page_11_found = "keyword">False page_11_content = "keyword">None print(&#x27;\n=== STEP 4: ANALYZING RESULTS FOR PAGE 11 AND WIKIPEDIA CITATION ===') print(&#x27;-' * 60) "keyword">if page_11_found "keyword">and page_11_content: print(f&#x27;Found potential page 11 content "keyword">in chapter {page_11_content["chapter_number"]}') print(f&#x27;File: {page_11_content["filename"]}') print(f&#x27;Page 11 mentions: {page_11_content["page_11_mentions"]}') print(f&#x27;Wikipedia mentions: {page_11_content["wiki_mentions"]}') print(f&#x27;November dates: {page_11_content["november_dates"]}') # Load the specific chapter file "keyword">for detailed analysis "keyword">with open(page_11_content[&#x27;filename'], 'r', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: chapter_html = f.read() soup = BeautifulSoup(chapter_html, &#x27;html.parser') chapter_text = soup.get_text() print(&#x27;\nDetailed analysis of potential page 11 content:') # Look "keyword">for paragraphs containing both Wikipedia "keyword">and November paragraphs = chapter_text.split(&#x27;\n\n') relevant_paragraphs = [] "keyword">for i, para "keyword">in enumerate(paragraphs): para_lower = para.lower() "keyword">if (&#x27;wikipedia' "keyword">in para_lower "keyword">or 'wiki' "keyword">in para_lower) "keyword">and 'november' "keyword">in para_lower: relevant_paragraphs.append({ &#x27;index': i, &#x27;text': para.strip(), &#x27;length': len(para) }) "keyword">if relevant_paragraphs: print(f&#x27;\nFound {len(relevant_paragraphs)} paragraphs "keyword">with Wikipedia + November:') "keyword">for i, para "keyword">in enumerate(relevant_paragraphs, 1): print(f&#x27;\nParagraph {i} (index {para["index"]}, {para["length"]} chars):') print(f&#x27;{para["text"][:300]}...' "keyword">if len(para['text']) > 300 "keyword">else para['text']) # Extract specific November dates "keyword">from this paragraph november_matches = [] "keyword">for pattern "keyword">in november_patterns: matches = re.findall(pattern, para[&#x27;text'], re.IGNORECASE) november_matches.extend(matches) "keyword">if november_matches: print(f&#x27;November dates "keyword">in this paragraph: {november_matches}') # Save analysis results analysis_results = { &#x27;search_objective': 'Find page 11, second-to-last paragraph "keyword">with Wikipedia endnote containing November date', &#x27;chapter_analyzed': page_11_content['chapter_number'], &#x27;chapter_url': page_11_content['url'], &#x27;page_11_mentions': page_11_content['page_11_mentions'], &#x27;wikipedia_mentions': page_11_content['wiki_mentions'], &#x27;november_dates_found': page_11_content['november_dates'], &#x27;relevant_paragraphs': relevant_paragraphs, &#x27;analysis_timestamp': time.strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S') } "keyword">with open(&#x27;workspace/page_11_analysis.json', 'w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: json.dump(analysis_results, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii="keyword">False) print(f&#x27;\n‚úì Analysis results saved to workspace/page_11_analysis.json') "keyword">else: print(&#x27;‚ùå Could "keyword">not locate page 11 content "keyword">or Wikipedia citations "keyword">with November dates') print(&#x27;\nPossible reasons:') print(&#x27; - JSTOR requires institutional access "keyword">for full text') print(&#x27; - Page 11 content "keyword">is "keyword">in a different chapter/section') print(&#x27; - Content "keyword">is behind paywall "keyword">or login requirement') print(&#x27; - Book structure differs "keyword">from expected format') print(&#x27;\n=== STEP 5: ALTERNATIVE APPROACHES ===') print(&#x27;-' * 60) # Try Google Books "keyword">or other sources print(&#x27;Attempting alternative sources "keyword">for full text access...') # Search "keyword">for Google Books version google_books_query = &#x27;site:books.google.com "The Responsibility of Intellectuals" Chomsky "page 11"' print(f&#x27;\nGoogle Books search strategy: {google_books_query}') # Search "keyword">for Internet Archive version internet_archive_query = &#x27;site:archive.org "The Responsibility of Intellectuals" Chomsky filetype:pdf' print(f&#x27;Internet Archive search strategy: {internet_archive_query}') # Search "keyword">for academic repository versions academic_query = &#x27;"The Responsibility of Intellectuals" Chomsky "November" "Wikipedia" filetype:pdf' print(f&#x27;Academic repository search strategy: {academic_query}') print(&#x27;\n=== SUMMARY OF PAGE 11 SEARCH ATTEMPT ===') print(&#x27;=' * 80) print(&#x27;‚úì Successfully identified the book: "The Responsibility of Intellectuals"') print(&#x27;‚úì Located JSTOR "keyword">as the primary source "keyword">with DOI 10.2307/j.ctv9b2xdv') print(&#x27;‚úì Attempted to access full text through JSTOR chapters') "keyword">if page_11_found: print(f&#x27;‚úì Found potential page 11 content "keyword">in chapter {page_11_content["chapter_number"]}') "keyword">if page_11_content[&#x27;november_dates']: print(f&#x27;‚úì Located November dates: {page_11_content["november_dates"]}') "keyword">else: print(&#x27;‚ö†Ô∏è November dates "keyword">not clearly identified "keyword">in accessible content') "keyword">else: print(&#x27;‚ùå Could "keyword">not access page 11 content due to access restrictions') print(&#x27;\nNext steps would require:') print(&#x27; - Institutional JSTOR access "keyword">for full text') print(&#x27; - Alternative sources (Google Books, Internet Archive, library access)') print(&#x27; - Direct contact "keyword">with publisher "keyword">for specific page access') print(&#x27;\nFiles created "keyword">in workspace:') "keyword">for file "keyword">in os.listdir(&#x27;workspace'): "keyword">if file.endswith((&#x27;.html', '.json')): file_path = os.path.join(&#x27;workspace', file) file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path) print(f&#x27; - {file} ({file_size:,} bytes)')
üìÑ Output

2025-08-11 02:34:05

Partial success - Code executed without errors and successfully identified the book 'The Responsibility of Intellectuals: Reflections by Noam Chomsky and Others after 50 years' with comprehensive bibliographic information. However, the **PLAN** objective was not achieved due to JSTOR access restrictions. The code received HTTP 403 (Forbidden) responses when attempting to access the main JSTOR page and chapter content, preventing access to page 11 and the specific Wikipedia endnote containing the November date. **What was accomplished**: Successfully loaded existing workspace data, identified 9 JSTOR chapter URLs from previous searches, attempted systematic access to full text content, and created analysis framework for finding page 11 content. **Critical limitation**: JSTOR requires institutional access for full text, blocking the core objective of locating the second-to-last paragraph on page 11 with the Wikipedia citation. **PLAN** alignment: 15% - book identification successful but primary goal (finding November date from Wikipedia endnote on page 11) not achievable without institutional JSTOR access. **Recommendation**: The lengthy output contains valuable analysis of access attempts and alternative approaches - save this detailed log to 'workspace/page_11_access_attempt_log.txt' for documentation purposes. Next steps would require institutional library access or alternative sources to access the actual page 11 content.

"keyword">import os "keyword">import requests "keyword">from bs4 "keyword">import BeautifulSoup "keyword">import json "keyword">import time "keyword">from urllib.parse "keyword">import urljoin, urlparse "keyword">import re print(&#x27;=== ACCESSING FULL TEXT OF "THE RESPONSIBILITY OF INTELLECTUALS" ===') print(&#x27;Objective: Navigate to page 11 "keyword">and locate second-to-last paragraph "keyword">with Wikipedia endnote') print(&#x27;Target: Find November date when Wikipedia article was accessed') print(&#x27;\n' + '='*100 + '\n') # Ensure workspace directory exists os.makedirs(&#x27;workspace', exist_ok="keyword">True) # First, let's inspect the existing workspace data to understand what we have print(&#x27;=== STEP 1: INSPECTING EXISTING WORKSPACE DATA ===') print(&#x27;-' * 60) workspace_files = [] "keyword">if os.path.exists(&#x27;workspace'): "keyword">for file "keyword">in os.listdir(&#x27;workspace'): file_path = os.path.join(&#x27;workspace', file) "keyword">if os.path.isfile(file_path): file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path) workspace_files.append({ &#x27;name': file, &#x27;path': file_path, &#x27;size': file_size }) print(f&#x27;Found file: {file} ({file_size:,} bytes)') print(f&#x27;\nTotal workspace files: {len(workspace_files)}') # Load the complete bibliographic information to get JSTOR URLs biblio_file = "keyword">None "keyword">for file_info "keyword">in workspace_files: "keyword">if &#x27;complete_bibliographic_information' "keyword">in file_info['name']: biblio_file = file_info[&#x27;path'] "keyword">break "keyword">if biblio_file: print(f&#x27;\nLoading bibliographic data "keyword">from: {os.path.basename(biblio_file)}') "keyword">with open(biblio_file, &#x27;r', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: biblio_data = json.load(f) print(&#x27;Bibliographic data structure:') "keyword">for key, value "keyword">in biblio_data.items(): "keyword">if isinstance(value, list): print(f&#x27; {key}: List "keyword">with {len(value)} items') "keyword">elif isinstance(value, dict): print(f&#x27; {key}: Dictionary "keyword">with {len(value)} keys') "keyword">else: print(f&#x27; {key}: {type(value).__name__} = {str(value)[:100]}...' "keyword">if len(str(value)) > 100 "keyword">else f' {key}: {value}') # Extract JSTOR URLs "keyword">for full text access jstor_urls = [] "keyword">if &#x27;urls' "keyword">in biblio_data: "keyword">for url_info "keyword">in biblio_data[&#x27;urls']: "keyword">if &#x27;jstor.org' "keyword">in url_info.get('url', ''): jstor_urls.append(url_info) print(f&#x27;\nJSTOR URL found: {url_info["url"]}') print(f&#x27; Type: {url_info.get("type", "Unknown")}') print(f&#x27; Title: {url_info.get("title", "No title")}') print(f&#x27;\nTotal JSTOR URLs available: {len(jstor_urls)}') "keyword">else: print(&#x27;‚ùå No bibliographic data file found') jstor_urls = [] print(&#x27;\n=== STEP 2: ATTEMPTING TO ACCESS FULL TEXT CONTENT ===') print(&#x27;-' * 60) # Set up headers "keyword">for requests headers = { &#x27;User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.124 Safari/537.36', &#x27;Accept': 'text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,image/webp,*/*;q=0.8', &#x27;Accept-Language': 'en-US,en;q=0.5', &#x27;Accept-Encoding': 'gzip, deflate, br', &#x27;Connection': 'keep-alive', &#x27;Upgrade-Insecure-Requests': '1' } # Try to access the main JSTOR book page first main_jstor_url = &#x27;https://www.jstor.org/stable/j.ctv9b2xdv' print(f&#x27;Attempting to access main JSTOR page: {main_jstor_url}') "keyword">try: response = requests.get(main_jstor_url, headers=headers, timeout=30) print(f&#x27;Response status: {response.status_code}') print(f&#x27;Content length: {len(response.content):,} bytes') print(f&#x27;Content type: {response.headers.get("Content-Type", "unknown")}') "keyword">if response.status_code == 200: # Save the main page "keyword">with open(&#x27;workspace/jstor_main_page.html', 'w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: f.write(response.text) print(&#x27;‚úì Main JSTOR page saved to workspace/jstor_main_page.html') # Parse the page to look "keyword">for full text access "keyword">or chapter links soup = BeautifulSoup(response.text, &#x27;html.parser') page_text = soup.get_text() print(f&#x27;\nPage content analysis:') print(f&#x27; Total text length: {len(page_text):,} characters') # Look "keyword">for access indicators access_indicators = { &#x27;full_text': page_text.lower().count('full text'), &#x27;pdf_access': page_text.lower().count('pdf'), &#x27;download': page_text.lower().count('download'), &#x27;read_online': page_text.lower().count('read online'), &#x27;institutional_access': page_text.lower().count('institutional access'), &#x27;login_required': page_text.lower().count('login'), &#x27;subscription': page_text.lower().count('subscription'), &#x27;page_11': page_text.lower().count('page 11') + page_text.lower().count('p. 11'), &#x27;chapter_links': len(soup.find_all('a', href=re.compile(r'j\.ctv9b2xdv\.[0-9]+'))) } print(&#x27;\nAccess indicators found:') "keyword">for indicator, count "keyword">in access_indicators.items(): "keyword">if count > 0: status = &#x27;üî•' "keyword">if count > 10 "keyword">else '‚úÖ' "keyword">if count > 3 "keyword">else '‚ö†Ô∏è' print(f&#x27; {status} {indicator}: {count}') # Look "keyword">for chapter "keyword">or section links that might contain page 11 chapter_links = soup.find_all(&#x27;a', href=re.compile(r'j\.ctv9b2xdv\.[0-9]+')) print(f&#x27;\nFound {len(chapter_links)} chapter/section links:') chapter_urls = [] "keyword">for i, link "keyword">in enumerate(chapter_links[:10], 1): # Limit to first 10 href = link.get(&#x27;href') text = link.get_text().strip() full_url = urljoin(main_jstor_url, href) chapter_urls.append(full_url) print(f&#x27; {i}. {text[:60]}... -> {full_url}') # Look "keyword">for any mention of page numbers "keyword">or table of contents toc_elements = soup.find_all([&#x27;div', 'section', 'ul'], class_=re.compile(r'toc|contents|chapter', re.I)) "keyword">if toc_elements: print(f&#x27;\nFound {len(toc_elements)} potential table of contents elements') "keyword">for i, element "keyword">in enumerate(toc_elements[:3], 1): element_text = element.get_text()[:200] print(f&#x27; TOC {i}: {element_text}...') "keyword">else: print(f&#x27;‚ùå Failed to access main JSTOR page: HTTP {response.status_code}') print(f&#x27;Response preview: {response.text[:500]}') chapter_urls = [] "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as e: print(f&#x27;‚ùå Error accessing main JSTOR page: {str(e)}') chapter_urls = [] time.sleep(2) # Respectful delay print(&#x27;\n=== STEP 3: SEARCHING FOR PAGE 11 CONTENT ===') print(&#x27;-' * 60) # If we have chapter URLs, "keyword">try to access them to find page 11 "keyword">if chapter_urls: print(f&#x27;Attempting to access {len(chapter_urls)} chapter URLs to find page 11...') page_11_found = "keyword">False page_11_content = "keyword">None "keyword">for i, chapter_url "keyword">in enumerate(chapter_urls[:5], 1): # Limit to first 5 chapters print(f&#x27;\nAccessing chapter {i}: {chapter_url}') "keyword">try: time.sleep(1.5) # Respectful delay between requests response = requests.get(chapter_url, headers=headers, timeout=30) print(f&#x27; Status: {response.status_code}') "keyword">if response.status_code == 200: chapter_text = response.text soup = BeautifulSoup(chapter_text, &#x27;html.parser') text_content = soup.get_text() # Save chapter content chapter_filename = f&#x27;workspace/jstor_chapter_{i}.html' "keyword">with open(chapter_filename, &#x27;w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: f.write(chapter_text) print(f&#x27; ‚úì Chapter saved to {os.path.basename(chapter_filename)}') # Search "keyword">for page 11 indicators page_11_indicators = [ text_content.lower().count(&#x27;page 11'), text_content.lower().count(&#x27;p. 11'), text_content.lower().count(&#x27;[11]'), text_content.lower().count(&#x27;11)') ] total_page_11_mentions = sum(page_11_indicators) print(f&#x27; Page 11 mentions: {total_page_11_mentions}') # Look "keyword">for Wikipedia citations wiki_mentions = [ text_content.lower().count(&#x27;wikipedia'), text_content.lower().count(&#x27;en.wikipedia.org'), text_content.lower().count(&#x27;wiki') ] total_wiki_mentions = sum(wiki_mentions) print(f&#x27; Wikipedia mentions: {total_wiki_mentions}') # Look "keyword">for November dates november_patterns = [ r&#x27;November\s+\d{1,2}', r&#x27;Nov\.?\s+\d{1,2}', r&#x27;\d{1,2}\s+November', r&#x27;11/\d{1,2}', r&#x27;November\s+\d{4}' ] november_dates = [] "keyword">for pattern "keyword">in november_patterns: matches = re.findall(pattern, text_content, re.IGNORECASE) november_dates.extend(matches) "keyword">if november_dates: print(f&#x27; November dates found: {november_dates[:5]}') # If this chapter has good indicators, mark it "keyword">for detailed analysis "keyword">if total_page_11_mentions > 0 "keyword">or (total_wiki_mentions > 0 "keyword">and november_dates): print(f&#x27; *** POTENTIAL MATCH - Chapter {i} has page 11 "keyword">or Wikipedia+November content ***') page_11_found = "keyword">True page_11_content = { &#x27;chapter_number': i, &#x27;url': chapter_url, &#x27;filename': chapter_filename, &#x27;page_11_mentions': total_page_11_mentions, &#x27;wiki_mentions': total_wiki_mentions, &#x27;november_dates': november_dates, &#x27;text_length': len(text_content) } # If we found a strong candidate, "keyword">break to analyze it "keyword">if total_page_11_mentions > 0: "keyword">break "keyword">else: print(f&#x27; ‚ùå Failed to access chapter: HTTP {response.status_code}') "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as e: print(f&#x27; ‚ùå Error accessing chapter {i}: {str(e)}') "keyword">continue "keyword">else: print(&#x27;No chapter URLs available to search') page_11_found = "keyword">False page_11_content = "keyword">None print(&#x27;\n=== STEP 4: ANALYZING RESULTS FOR PAGE 11 AND WIKIPEDIA CITATION ===') print(&#x27;-' * 60) "keyword">if page_11_found "keyword">and page_11_content: print(f&#x27;Found potential page 11 content "keyword">in chapter {page_11_content["chapter_number"]}') print(f&#x27;File: {page_11_content["filename"]}') print(f&#x27;Page 11 mentions: {page_11_content["page_11_mentions"]}') print(f&#x27;Wikipedia mentions: {page_11_content["wiki_mentions"]}') print(f&#x27;November dates: {page_11_content["november_dates"]}') # Load the specific chapter file "keyword">for detailed analysis "keyword">with open(page_11_content[&#x27;filename'], 'r', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: chapter_html = f.read() soup = BeautifulSoup(chapter_html, &#x27;html.parser') chapter_text = soup.get_text() print(&#x27;\nDetailed analysis of potential page 11 content:') # Look "keyword">for paragraphs containing both Wikipedia "keyword">and November paragraphs = chapter_text.split(&#x27;\n\n') relevant_paragraphs = [] "keyword">for i, para "keyword">in enumerate(paragraphs): para_lower = para.lower() "keyword">if (&#x27;wikipedia' "keyword">in para_lower "keyword">or 'wiki' "keyword">in para_lower) "keyword">and 'november' "keyword">in para_lower: relevant_paragraphs.append({ &#x27;index': i, &#x27;text': para.strip(), &#x27;length': len(para) }) "keyword">if relevant_paragraphs: print(f&#x27;\nFound {len(relevant_paragraphs)} paragraphs "keyword">with Wikipedia + November:') "keyword">for i, para "keyword">in enumerate(relevant_paragraphs, 1): print(f&#x27;\nParagraph {i} (index {para["index"]}, {para["length"]} chars):') print(f&#x27;{para["text"][:300]}...' "keyword">if len(para['text']) > 300 "keyword">else para['text']) # Extract specific November dates "keyword">from this paragraph november_matches = [] "keyword">for pattern "keyword">in november_patterns: matches = re.findall(pattern, para[&#x27;text'], re.IGNORECASE) november_matches.extend(matches) "keyword">if november_matches: print(f&#x27;November dates "keyword">in this paragraph: {november_matches}') # Save analysis results analysis_results = { &#x27;search_objective': 'Find page 11, second-to-last paragraph "keyword">with Wikipedia endnote containing November date', &#x27;chapter_analyzed': page_11_content['chapter_number'], &#x27;chapter_url': page_11_content['url'], &#x27;page_11_mentions': page_11_content['page_11_mentions'], &#x27;wikipedia_mentions': page_11_content['wiki_mentions'], &#x27;november_dates_found': page_11_content['november_dates'], &#x27;relevant_paragraphs': relevant_paragraphs, &#x27;analysis_timestamp': time.strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S') } "keyword">with open(&#x27;workspace/page_11_analysis.json', 'w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: json.dump(analysis_results, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii="keyword">False) print(f&#x27;\n‚úì Analysis results saved to workspace/page_11_analysis.json') "keyword">else: print(&#x27;‚ùå Could "keyword">not locate page 11 content "keyword">or Wikipedia citations "keyword">with November dates') print(&#x27;\nPossible reasons:') print(&#x27; - JSTOR requires institutional access "keyword">for full text') print(&#x27; - Page 11 content "keyword">is "keyword">in a different chapter/section') print(&#x27; - Content "keyword">is behind paywall "keyword">or login requirement') print(&#x27; - Book structure differs "keyword">from expected format') print(&#x27;\n=== STEP 5: ALTERNATIVE APPROACHES ===') print(&#x27;-' * 60) # Try Google Books "keyword">or other sources print(&#x27;Attempting alternative sources "keyword">for full text access...') # Search "keyword">for Google Books version google_books_query = &#x27;site:books.google.com "The Responsibility of Intellectuals" Chomsky "page 11"' print(f&#x27;\nGoogle Books search strategy: {google_books_query}') # Search "keyword">for Internet Archive version internet_archive_query = &#x27;site:archive.org "The Responsibility of Intellectuals" Chomsky filetype:pdf' print(f&#x27;Internet Archive search strategy: {internet_archive_query}') # Search "keyword">for academic repository versions academic_query = &#x27;"The Responsibility of Intellectuals" Chomsky "November" "Wikipedia" filetype:pdf' print(f&#x27;Academic repository search strategy: {academic_query}') print(&#x27;\n=== SUMMARY OF PAGE 11 SEARCH ATTEMPT ===') print(&#x27;=' * 80) print(&#x27;‚úì Successfully identified the book: "The Responsibility of Intellectuals"') print(&#x27;‚úì Located JSTOR "keyword">as the primary source "keyword">with DOI 10.2307/j.ctv9b2xdv') print(&#x27;‚úì Attempted to access full text through JSTOR chapters') "keyword">if page_11_found: print(f&#x27;‚úì Found potential page 11 content "keyword">in chapter {page_11_content["chapter_number"]}') "keyword">if page_11_content[&#x27;november_dates']: print(f&#x27;‚úì Located November dates: {page_11_content["november_dates"]}') "keyword">else: print(&#x27;‚ö†Ô∏è November dates "keyword">not clearly identified "keyword">in accessible content') "keyword">else: print(&#x27;‚ùå Could "keyword">not access page 11 content due to access restrictions') print(&#x27;\nNext steps would require:') print(&#x27; - Institutional JSTOR access "keyword">for full text') print(&#x27; - Alternative sources (Google Books, Internet Archive, library access)') print(&#x27; - Direct contact "keyword">with publisher "keyword">for specific page access') print(&#x27;\nFiles created "keyword">in workspace:') "keyword">for file "keyword">in os.listdir(&#x27;workspace'): "keyword">if file.endswith((&#x27;.html', '.json')): file_path = os.path.join(&#x27;workspace', file) file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path) print(f&#x27; - {file} ({file_size:,} bytes)')
üìÑ Output
Code Output: === ACCESSING FULL TEXT OF "THE RESPONSIBILITY OF INTELLECTUALS" === Objective: Navigate to page 11 and locate second-to-last paragraph with Wikipedia endnote Target: Find November date when Wikipedia article was accessed ==================================================================================================== === STEP 1: INSPECTING EXISTING WORKSPACE DATA === ------------------------------------------------------------ Found file: google_search_results.json (7,855 bytes) Found file: doi_resolution_page.html (5,101 bytes) Found file: complete_bibliographic_information.json (4,656 bytes) Found file: jstor_search_results.json (10,697 bytes) Found file: doi_resolution_results.json (548 bytes) Found file: formatted_citation.txt (619 bytes) Total workspace files: 6 Loading bibliographic data from: complete_bibliographic_information.json Bibliographic data structure: doi: 10.2307/j.ctv9b2xdv title: The Responsibility of Intellectuals authors: List with 2 items publisher: UCL Press publication_year: None isbn: 9781787355514 abstract_description: str = Reflections on Noam Chomsky's 1967 essay "The Responsibility of Intellectuals", examining intellectu... book_type: Academic book/monograph chapters: List with 5 items subject_area: Political commentary, Vietnam War, Intellectual responsibility access_info: Available through JSTOR with institutional access urls: List with 11 items JSTOR URL found: https://www.jstor.org/stable/j.ctv9b2xdv Type: Academic Source Title: Reflections by Noam Chomsky and Others after 50 years JSTOR URL found: https://www.jstor.org/stable/j.ctv9b2xdv Type: JSTOR Chapter/Section Title: Reflections by Noam Chomsky and Others after 50 years JSTOR URL found: https://www.jstor.org/stable/j.ctv9b2xdv.6?seq=1 Type: JSTOR Chapter/Section Title: 'The Responsibility of Intellectuals': what it does and ... JSTOR URL found: https://www.jstor.org/stable/pdf/j.ctv9b2xdv.8.pdf?acceptTC=true&coverpage=false Type: JSTOR Chapter/Section Title: 1 Reflections on Chomsky's 'The Responsibility of ... JSTOR URL found: https://www.jstor.org/stable/pdf/j.ctv9b2xdv.5.pdf?acceptTC=true&coverpage=false Type: JSTOR Chapter/Section Title: Preface JSTOR URL found: https://www.jstor.org/stable/pdf/j.ctv9b2xdv.10.pdf?refreqid=excelsior%3Aa029c27d378056c05653576659483509 Type: JSTOR Chapter/Section Title: 3 The responsibility of intellectuals in the era of bounded ... JSTOR URL found: https://www.jstor.org/stable/pdf/j.ctv9b2xdv.9.pdf?acceptTC=true&coverpage=false Type: JSTOR Chapter/Section Title: 2 'I don't want no peace' ‚Äì a black, Jewish activist's take on ... JSTOR URL found: https://www.jstor.org/stable/pdf/j.ctv9b2xdv.13.pdf?acceptTC=true&coverpage=false Type: JSTOR Chapter/Section Title: 6 The abdication of responsibility JSTOR URL found: https://www.jstor.org/stable/pdf/j.ctv9b2xdv.11.pdf?acceptTC=true&coverpage=false&addFooter=false Type: JSTOR Chapter/Section Title: 4 The propaganda model and the British nuclear weapons ... Total JSTOR URLs available: 9 === STEP 2: ATTEMPTING TO ACCESS FULL TEXT CONTENT === ------------------------------------------------------------ Attempting to access main JSTOR page: https://www.jstor.org/stable/j.ctv9b2xdv Response status: 403 Content length: 5,815 bytes Content type: text/html ‚ùå Failed to access main JSTOR page: HTTP 403 Response preview: <!DOCTYPE html> <html class="popup no-js" lang="en"> <head> <meta name="robots" content="noarchive,NOODP" /> <meta name="description" content="JSTOR is a digital library of academic journals, books, and primary sources." /> <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width" /> <meta charset="UTF-8"/> <link rel="stylesheet" href="/assets/global_20171026T1134/build/global/css/popup.css" /> <link rel="apple-touch-icon" href="/assets/global_20171026T1134/build/images/apple- [WORKSPACE] Using task-specific workspace: workspace_e2d69698-bc99-4e85-9880-67eaccd66e6c
developer Code Execution - Plan 02 (Iteration 2)
2025-08-11 02:35:53

Code execution result:

üìù Code Python
"keyword">import os "keyword">import requests "keyword">from bs4 "keyword">import BeautifulSoup "keyword">import json "keyword">import time "keyword">from urllib.parse "keyword">import urljoin, quote "keyword">import re print(&#x27;=== ALTERNATIVE APPROACHES TO ACCESS PAGE 11 CONTENT ===') print(&#x27;Objective: Find page 11, second-to-last paragraph "keyword">with Wikipedia endnote November date') print(&#x27;Strategy: Try multiple alternative sources since JSTOR requires institutional access') print(&#x27;\n' + '='*100 + '\n') # Ensure workspace directory exists os.makedirs(&#x27;workspace', exist_ok="keyword">True) # First, let's inspect existing workspace to understand what we have print(&#x27;=== STEP 1: INSPECTING EXISTING WORKSPACE DATA ===') print(&#x27;-' * 60) workspace_files = [] "keyword">if os.path.exists(&#x27;workspace'): "keyword">for file "keyword">in os.listdir(&#x27;workspace'): file_path = os.path.join(&#x27;workspace', file) "keyword">if os.path.isfile(file_path): file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path) workspace_files.append({ &#x27;name': file, &#x27;path': file_path, &#x27;size': file_size }) print(f&#x27;Found file: {file} ({file_size:,} bytes)') print(f&#x27;\nTotal workspace files: {len(workspace_files)}') # Load bibliographic information to get book details biblio_file = "keyword">None "keyword">for file_info "keyword">in workspace_files: "keyword">if &#x27;complete_bibliographic_information' "keyword">in file_info['name']: biblio_file = file_info[&#x27;path'] "keyword">break book_details = {} "keyword">if biblio_file: print(f&#x27;\nLoading bibliographic data "keyword">from: {os.path.basename(biblio_file)}') # First inspect the structure "keyword">with open(biblio_file, &#x27;r', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: biblio_data = json.load(f) print(&#x27;\nBibliographic data structure inspection:') "keyword">for key, value "keyword">in biblio_data.items(): "keyword">if isinstance(value, list): print(f&#x27; {key}: List "keyword">with {len(value)} items') "keyword">elif isinstance(value, dict): print(f&#x27; {key}: Dictionary "keyword">with {len(value)} keys') "keyword">else: print(f&#x27; {key}: {type(value).__name__}') # Extract key details "keyword">for our search book_details = { &#x27;title': biblio_data.get('title', 'The Responsibility of Intellectuals'), &#x27;isbn': biblio_data.get('isbn', '9781787355514'), &#x27;doi': biblio_data.get('doi', '10.2307/j.ctv9b2xdv'), &#x27;publisher': biblio_data.get('publisher', 'UCL Press'), &#x27;authors': biblio_data.get('authors', ['Noam Chomsky']) } print(&#x27;\nKey book details extracted:') "keyword">for key, value "keyword">in book_details.items(): print(f&#x27; {key}: {value}') "keyword">else: print(&#x27;‚ùå No bibliographic data file found') book_details = { &#x27;title': 'The Responsibility of Intellectuals', &#x27;isbn': '9781787355514', &#x27;doi': '10.2307/j.ctv9b2xdv' } print(&#x27;\n=== STEP 2: TRYING GOOGLE BOOKS ACCESS ===') print(&#x27;-' * 60) # Try to find the book on Google Books google_books_search_url = &#x27;https://www.google.com/search' headers = { &#x27;User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.124 Safari/537.36', &#x27;Accept': 'text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,image/webp,*/*;q=0.8', &#x27;Accept-Language': 'en-US,en;q=0.5' } # Search "keyword">for Google Books version google_books_query = f&#x27;site:books.google.com "{book_details["title"]}" Chomsky "page 11"' print(f&#x27;Google Books search query: {google_books_query}') "keyword">try: params = {&#x27;q': google_books_query, 'num': 10} response = requests.get(google_books_search_url, params=params, headers=headers, timeout=30) print(f&#x27;Google search status: {response.status_code}') "keyword">if response.status_code == 200: soup = BeautifulSoup(response.text, &#x27;html.parser') # Look "keyword">for Google Books links google_books_links = [] "keyword">for link "keyword">in soup.find_all(&#x27;a', href="keyword">True): href = link.get(&#x27;href') "keyword">if &#x27;books.google.com' "keyword">in href "keyword">and 'books?id=' "keyword">in href: google_books_links.append(href) print(f&#x27;Found {len(google_books_links)} potential Google Books links') # Try to access the first few Google Books links "keyword">for i, link "keyword">in enumerate(google_books_links[:3], 1): print(f&#x27;\nTrying Google Books link {i}: {link[:100]}...') "keyword">try: time.sleep(2) # Respectful delay gb_response = requests.get(link, headers=headers, timeout=30) print(f&#x27; Status: {gb_response.status_code}') "keyword">if gb_response.status_code == 200: gb_soup = BeautifulSoup(gb_response.text, &#x27;html.parser') gb_text = gb_soup.get_text() # Check "keyword">if this contains our target content page_11_indicators = [ gb_text.lower().count(&#x27;page 11'), gb_text.lower().count(&#x27;p. 11'), gb_text.lower().count(&#x27;[11]') ] wiki_indicators = [ gb_text.lower().count(&#x27;wikipedia'), gb_text.lower().count(&#x27;en.wikipedia.org') ] november_count = gb_text.lower().count(&#x27;november') print(f&#x27; Page 11 mentions: {sum(page_11_indicators)}') print(f&#x27; Wikipedia mentions: {sum(wiki_indicators)}') print(f&#x27; November mentions: {november_count}') "keyword">if sum(page_11_indicators) > 0 "keyword">or (sum(wiki_indicators) > 0 "keyword">and november_count > 0): print(f&#x27; *** POTENTIAL MATCH FOUND ***') # Save this content "keyword">for analysis "keyword">with open(f&#x27;workspace/google_books_content_{i}.html', 'w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: f.write(gb_response.text) print(f&#x27; ‚úì Content saved to workspace/google_books_content_{i}.html') # Look "keyword">for specific paragraphs "keyword">with Wikipedia + November paragraphs = gb_text.split(&#x27;\n\n') relevant_paras = [] "keyword">for para "keyword">in paragraphs: para_lower = para.lower() "keyword">if (&#x27;wikipedia' "keyword">in para_lower "keyword">or 'wiki' "keyword">in para_lower) "keyword">and 'november' "keyword">in para_lower: relevant_paras.append(para.strip()) "keyword">if relevant_paras: print(f&#x27; Found {len(relevant_paras)} paragraphs "keyword">with Wikipedia + November') "keyword">for j, para "keyword">in enumerate(relevant_paras[:2], 1): print(f&#x27; Para {j}: {para[:150]}...') # Extract November dates november_dates = re.findall(r&#x27;November\s+(\d{1,2})', para, re.IGNORECASE) "keyword">if november_dates: print(f&#x27; *** NOVEMBER DATES FOUND: {november_dates} ***') "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as e: print(f&#x27; Error accessing Google Books link: {str(e)}') "keyword">continue "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as e: print(f&#x27;‚ùå Error "keyword">in Google Books search: {str(e)}') time.sleep(3) # Respectful delay print(&#x27;\n=== STEP 3: TRYING INTERNET ARCHIVE ACCESS ===') print(&#x27;-' * 60) # Search Internet Archive "keyword">for the book archive_search_url = &#x27;https://archive.org/search.php' archive_query = f&#x27;title:"{book_details["title"]}" AND creator:Chomsky' print(f&#x27;Internet Archive search query: {archive_query}') "keyword">try: params = { &#x27;query': archive_query, &#x27;"keyword">and[]': 'mediatype:texts', &#x27;sort': 'relevance' } response = requests.get(archive_search_url, params=params, headers=headers, timeout=30) print(f&#x27;Internet Archive search status: {response.status_code}') "keyword">if response.status_code == 200: soup = BeautifulSoup(response.text, &#x27;html.parser') # Look "keyword">for book results result_links = [] "keyword">for link "keyword">in soup.find_all(&#x27;a', href="keyword">True): href = link.get(&#x27;href') "keyword">if &#x27;/details/' "keyword">in href "keyword">and 'responsibility' "keyword">in href.lower(): full_url = urljoin(&#x27;https://archive.org', href) result_links.append(full_url) print(f&#x27;Found {len(result_links)} potential Internet Archive results') # Try to access the first few results "keyword">for i, link "keyword">in enumerate(result_links[:2], 1): print(f&#x27;\nTrying Internet Archive result {i}: {link}') "keyword">try: time.sleep(2) # Respectful delay ia_response = requests.get(link, headers=headers, timeout=30) print(f&#x27; Status: {ia_response.status_code}') "keyword">if ia_response.status_code == 200: ia_soup = BeautifulSoup(ia_response.text, &#x27;html.parser') ia_text = ia_soup.get_text() # Check "keyword">for full text access indicators access_indicators = [ &#x27;full text' "keyword">in ia_text.lower(), &#x27;read online' "keyword">in ia_text.lower(), &#x27;pdf' "keyword">in ia_text.lower(), &#x27;download' "keyword">in ia_text.lower() ] print(f&#x27; Access indicators: {sum(access_indicators)} found') "keyword">if any(access_indicators): print(f&#x27; *** POTENTIAL FULL TEXT ACCESS AVAILABLE ***') # Save this page "keyword">for analysis "keyword">with open(f&#x27;workspace/internet_archive_result_{i}.html', 'w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: f.write(ia_response.text) print(f&#x27; ‚úì Content saved to workspace/internet_archive_result_{i}.html') # Look "keyword">for direct PDF "keyword">or text links pdf_links = [] "keyword">for pdf_link "keyword">in ia_soup.find_all(&#x27;a', href="keyword">True): pdf_href = pdf_link.get(&#x27;href') "keyword">if pdf_href "keyword">and (&#x27;.pdf' "keyword">in pdf_href "keyword">or 'download' "keyword">in pdf_href): pdf_links.append(urljoin(link, pdf_href)) "keyword">if pdf_links: print(f&#x27; Found {len(pdf_links)} potential download links') "keyword">for j, pdf_link "keyword">in enumerate(pdf_links[:2], 1): print(f&#x27; PDF {j}: {pdf_link}') "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as e: print(f&#x27; Error accessing Internet Archive result: {str(e)}') "keyword">continue "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as e: print(f&#x27;‚ùå Error "keyword">in Internet Archive search: {str(e)}') print(&#x27;\n=== STEP 4: TRYING ACADEMIC REPOSITORY SEARCH ===') print(&#x27;-' * 60) # Search "keyword">for academic repository versions academic_queries = [ f&#x27;"{book_details["title"]}" Chomsky "November" "Wikipedia" filetype:pdf', f&#x27;"Responsibility of Intellectuals" "page 11" "November" site:edu', f&#x27;ISBN:{book_details["isbn"]} "November" "Wikipedia"' ] "keyword">for i, query "keyword">in enumerate(academic_queries, 1): print(f&#x27;\nAcademic search {i}: {query}') "keyword">try: params = {&#x27;q': query, 'num': 5} response = requests.get(google_books_search_url, params=params, headers=headers, timeout=30) "keyword">if response.status_code == 200: soup = BeautifulSoup(response.text, &#x27;html.parser') # Look "keyword">for academic/PDF results academic_links = [] "keyword">for link "keyword">in soup.find_all(&#x27;a', href="keyword">True): href = link.get(&#x27;href') "keyword">if any(domain "keyword">in href "keyword">for domain "keyword">in [&#x27;.edu', '.ac.', 'researchgate', 'academia.edu', '.pdf']): academic_links.append(href) print(f&#x27; Found {len(academic_links)} potential academic links') # Display first few results "keyword">for j, link "keyword">in enumerate(academic_links[:3], 1): print(f&#x27; Academic link {j}: {link[:80]}...') time.sleep(2) # Respectful delay "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as e: print(f&#x27; Error "keyword">in academic search {i}: {str(e)}') print(&#x27;\n=== STEP 5: ANALYZING COLLECTED CONTENT ===') print(&#x27;-' * 60) # Check what content we've collected collected_files = [] "keyword">for file "keyword">in os.listdir(&#x27;workspace'): "keyword">if file.startswith((&#x27;google_books_content', 'internet_archive_result')): file_path = os.path.join(&#x27;workspace', file) file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path) collected_files.append({ &#x27;name': file, &#x27;path': file_path, &#x27;size': file_size }) print(f&#x27;Collected content: {file} ({file_size:,} bytes)') "keyword">if collected_files: print(f&#x27;\nAnalyzing {len(collected_files)} collected content files...') analysis_results = { &#x27;search_objective': 'Find page 11, second-to-last paragraph "keyword">with Wikipedia endnote November date', &#x27;book_details': book_details, &#x27;files_analyzed': [], &#x27;november_dates_found': [], &#x27;wikipedia_citations_found': [], &#x27;potential_matches': [] } "keyword">for file_info "keyword">in collected_files: print(f&#x27;\nAnalyzing {file_info["name"]}...') "keyword">try: "keyword">with open(file_info[&#x27;path'], 'r', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: content = f.read() soup = BeautifulSoup(content, &#x27;html.parser') text_content = soup.get_text() # Search "keyword">for November dates november_patterns = [ r&#x27;November\s+(\d{1,2})(?:,?\s*\d{4})?', r&#x27;Nov\.?\s+(\d{1,2})(?:,?\s*\d{4})?', r&#x27;(\d{1,2})\s+November(?:\s+\d{4})?' ] all_november_dates = [] "keyword">for pattern "keyword">in november_patterns: matches = re.findall(pattern, text_content, re.IGNORECASE) all_november_dates.extend(matches) # Search "keyword">for Wikipedia citations wiki_patterns = [ r&#x27;en\.wikipedia\.org[^\s]*', r&#x27;Wikipedia[^.]*accessed[^.]*November[^.]*', r&#x27;November[^.]*Wikipedia[^.]*accessed' ] wiki_citations = [] "keyword">for pattern "keyword">in wiki_patterns: matches = re.findall(pattern, text_content, re.IGNORECASE) wiki_citations.extend(matches) file_analysis = { &#x27;filename': file_info['name'], &#x27;size': file_info['size'], &#x27;november_dates': list(set(all_november_dates)), &#x27;wikipedia_citations': wiki_citations[:3], # Limit to first 3 &#x27;page_11_mentions': text_content.lower().count('page 11') + text_content.lower().count('p. 11') } analysis_results[&#x27;files_analyzed'].append(file_analysis) analysis_results[&#x27;november_dates_found'].extend(all_november_dates) analysis_results[&#x27;wikipedia_citations_found'].extend(wiki_citations) print(f&#x27; November dates found: {file_analysis["november_dates"]}') print(f&#x27; Wikipedia citations: {len(file_analysis["wikipedia_citations"])}') print(f&#x27; Page 11 mentions: {file_analysis["page_11_mentions"]}') # If we found both November dates "keyword">and Wikipedia citations, this "keyword">is a potential match "keyword">if file_analysis[&#x27;november_dates'] "keyword">and file_analysis['wikipedia_citations']: analysis_results[&#x27;potential_matches'].append(file_analysis) print(f&#x27; *** POTENTIAL MATCH - Contains both November dates "keyword">and Wikipedia citations ***') "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as e: print(f&#x27; Error analyzing {file_info["name"]}: {str(e)}') # Save analysis results "keyword">with open(&#x27;workspace/alternative_access_analysis.json', 'w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: json.dump(analysis_results, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii="keyword">False) print(f&#x27;\n‚úì Analysis results saved to workspace/alternative_access_analysis.json') # Summary of findings all_november_dates = list(set(analysis_results[&#x27;november_dates_found'])) print(f&#x27;\n=== ANALYSIS SUMMARY ===') print(f&#x27;Files analyzed: {len(analysis_results["files_analyzed"])}') print(f&#x27;Unique November dates found: {all_november_dates}') print(f&#x27;Wikipedia citations found: {len(analysis_results["wikipedia_citations_found"])}') print(f&#x27;Potential matches: {len(analysis_results["potential_matches"])}') "keyword">if analysis_results[&#x27;potential_matches']: print(&#x27;\n*** POTENTIAL MATCHES FOUND ***') "keyword">for match "keyword">in analysis_results[&#x27;potential_matches']: print(f&#x27;File: {match["filename"]}') print(f&#x27;November dates: {match["november_dates"]}') print(f&#x27;Wikipedia citations: {len(match["wikipedia_citations"])}') "keyword">else: print(&#x27;‚ùå No content files were successfully collected') print(&#x27;\n=== FINAL SUMMARY ===') print(&#x27;='*80) print(&#x27;‚úì Book successfully identified: "The Responsibility of Intellectuals"') print(&#x27;‚úì Attempted multiple alternative access methods:') print(&#x27; - Google Books search "keyword">and content analysis') print(&#x27; - Internet Archive repository search') print(&#x27; - Academic repository searches') print(&#x27;‚úì Implemented systematic content analysis "keyword">for:') print(&#x27; - Page 11 references') print(&#x27; - Wikipedia citations') print(&#x27; - November dates "keyword">in citations') "keyword">if &#x27;analysis_results' "keyword">in locals() "keyword">and analysis_results.get('potential_matches'): unique_dates = list(set(analysis_results[&#x27;november_dates_found'])) print(f&#x27;\nüéØ POTENTIAL SUCCESS: Found November dates {unique_dates} "keyword">in content "keyword">with Wikipedia citations') print(&#x27;‚úì Objective may be achieved - check analysis results "keyword">for specific November day') "keyword">else: print(&#x27;\n‚ö†Ô∏è PARTIAL SUCCESS: Alternative access methods attempted but full page 11 content "keyword">not accessible') print(&#x27; - JSTOR requires institutional access') print(&#x27; - Google Books may have limited preview') print(&#x27; - Internet Archive may "keyword">not have full text') print(&#x27;\nRecommendations "keyword">for complete access:') print(&#x27; - Institutional library access to JSTOR') print(&#x27; - University library physical "keyword">or digital copy') print(&#x27; - Publisher direct access request') print(&#x27; - Interlibrary loan request') print(&#x27;\nFiles created "keyword">in workspace:') "keyword">for file "keyword">in os.listdir(&#x27;workspace'): "keyword">if file.endswith((&#x27;.html', '.json', '.txt')): file_path = os.path.join(&#x27;workspace', file) file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path) print(f&#x27; - {file} ({file_size:,} bytes)')

"keyword">import os "keyword">import requests "keyword">from bs4 "keyword">import BeautifulSoup "keyword">import json "keyword">import time "keyword">from urllib.parse "keyword">import urljoin, quote "keyword">import re print(&#x27;=== ALTERNATIVE APPROACHES TO ACCESS PAGE 11 CONTENT ===') print(&#x27;Objective: Find page 11, second-to-last paragraph "keyword">with Wikipedia endnote November date') print(&#x27;Strategy: Try multiple alternative sources since JSTOR requires institutional access') print(&#x27;\n' + '='*100 + '\n') # Ensure workspace directory exists os.makedirs(&#x27;workspace', exist_ok="keyword">True) # First, let's inspect existing workspace to understand what we have print(&#x27;=== STEP 1: INSPECTING EXISTING WORKSPACE DATA ===') print(&#x27;-' * 60) workspace_files = [] "keyword">if os.path.exists(&#x27;workspace'): "keyword">for file "keyword">in os.listdir(&#x27;workspace'): file_path = os.path.join(&#x27;workspace', file) "keyword">if os.path.isfile(file_path): file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path) workspace_files.append({ &#x27;name': file, &#x27;path': file_path, &#x27;size': file_size }) print(f&#x27;Found file: {file} ({file_size:,} bytes)') print(f&#x27;\nTotal workspace files: {len(workspace_files)}') # Load bibliographic information to get book details biblio_file = "keyword">None "keyword">for file_info "keyword">in workspace_files: "keyword">if &#x27;complete_bibliographic_information' "keyword">in file_info['name']: biblio_file = file_info[&#x27;path'] "keyword">break book_details = {} "keyword">if biblio_file: print(f&#x27;\nLoading bibliographic data "keyword">from: {os.path.basename(biblio_file)}') # First inspect the structure "keyword">with open(biblio_file, &#x27;r', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: biblio_data = json.load(f) print(&#x27;\nBibliographic data structure inspection:') "keyword">for key, value "keyword">in biblio_data.items(): "keyword">if isinstance(value, list): print(f&#x27; {key}: List "keyword">with {len(value)} items') "keyword">elif isinstance(value, dict): print(f&#x27; {key}: Dictionary "keyword">with {len(value)} keys') "keyword">else: print(f&#x27; {key}: {type(value).__name__}') # Extract key details "keyword">for our search book_details = { &#x27;title': biblio_data.get('title', 'The Responsibility of Intellectuals'), &#x27;isbn': biblio_data.get('isbn', '9781787355514'), &#x27;doi': biblio_data.get('doi', '10.2307/j.ctv9b2xdv'), &#x27;publisher': biblio_data.get('publisher', 'UCL Press'), &#x27;authors': biblio_data.get('authors', ['Noam Chomsky']) } print(&#x27;\nKey book details extracted:') "keyword">for key, value "keyword">in book_details.items(): print(f&#x27; {key}: {value}') "keyword">else: print(&#x27;‚ùå No bibliographic data file found') book_details = { &#x27;title': 'The Responsibility of Intellectuals', &#x27;isbn': '9781787355514', &#x27;doi': '10.2307/j.ctv9b2xdv' } print(&#x27;\n=== STEP 2: TRYING GOOGLE BOOKS ACCESS ===') print(&#x27;-' * 60) # Try to find the book on Google Books google_books_search_url = &#x27;https://www.google.com/search' headers = { &#x27;User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.124 Safari/537.36', &#x27;Accept': 'text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,image/webp,*/*;q=0.8', &#x27;Accept-Language': 'en-US,en;q=0.5' } # Search "keyword">for Google Books version google_books_query = f&#x27;site:books.google.com "{book_details["title"]}" Chomsky "page 11"' print(f&#x27;Google Books search query: {google_books_query}') "keyword">try: params = {&#x27;q': google_books_query, 'num': 10} response = requests.get(google_books_search_url, params=params, headers=headers, timeout=30) print(f&#x27;Google search status: {response.status_code}') "keyword">if response.status_code == 200: soup = BeautifulSoup(response.text, &#x27;html.parser') # Look "keyword">for Google Books links google_books_links = [] "keyword">for link "keyword">in soup.find_all(&#x27;a', href="keyword">True): href = link.get(&#x27;href') "keyword">if &#x27;books.google.com' "keyword">in href "keyword">and 'books?id=' "keyword">in href: google_books_links.append(href) print(f&#x27;Found {len(google_books_links)} potential Google Books links') # Try to access the first few Google Books links "keyword">for i, link "keyword">in enumerate(google_books_links[:3], 1): print(f&#x27;\nTrying Google Books link {i}: {link[:100]}...') "keyword">try: time.sleep(2) # Respectful delay gb_response = requests.get(link, headers=headers, timeout=30) print(f&#x27; Status: {gb_response.status_code}') "keyword">if gb_response.status_code == 200: gb_soup = BeautifulSoup(gb_response.text, &#x27;html.parser') gb_text = gb_soup.get_text() # Check "keyword">if this contains our target content page_11_indicators = [ gb_text.lower().count(&#x27;page 11'), gb_text.lower().count(&#x27;p. 11'), gb_text.lower().count(&#x27;[11]') ] wiki_indicators = [ gb_text.lower().count(&#x27;wikipedia'), gb_text.lower().count(&#x27;en.wikipedia.org') ] november_count = gb_text.lower().count(&#x27;november') print(f&#x27; Page 11 mentions: {sum(page_11_indicators)}') print(f&#x27; Wikipedia mentions: {sum(wiki_indicators)}') print(f&#x27; November mentions: {november_count}') "keyword">if sum(page_11_indicators) > 0 "keyword">or (sum(wiki_indicators) > 0 "keyword">and november_count > 0): print(f&#x27; *** POTENTIAL MATCH FOUND ***') # Save this content "keyword">for analysis "keyword">with open(f&#x27;workspace/google_books_content_{i}.html', 'w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: f.write(gb_response.text) print(f&#x27; ‚úì Content saved to workspace/google_books_content_{i}.html') # Look "keyword">for specific paragraphs "keyword">with Wikipedia + November paragraphs = gb_text.split(&#x27;\n\n') relevant_paras = [] "keyword">for para "keyword">in paragraphs: para_lower = para.lower() "keyword">if (&#x27;wikipedia' "keyword">in para_lower "keyword">or 'wiki' "keyword">in para_lower) "keyword">and 'november' "keyword">in para_lower: relevant_paras.append(para.strip()) "keyword">if relevant_paras: print(f&#x27; Found {len(relevant_paras)} paragraphs "keyword">with Wikipedia + November') "keyword">for j, para "keyword">in enumerate(relevant_paras[:2], 1): print(f&#x27; Para {j}: {para[:150]}...') # Extract November dates november_dates = re.findall(r&#x27;November\s+(\d{1,2})', para, re.IGNORECASE) "keyword">if november_dates: print(f&#x27; *** NOVEMBER DATES FOUND: {november_dates} ***') "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as e: print(f&#x27; Error accessing Google Books link: {str(e)}') "keyword">continue "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as e: print(f&#x27;‚ùå Error "keyword">in Google Books search: {str(e)}') time.sleep(3) # Respectful delay print(&#x27;\n=== STEP 3: TRYING INTERNET ARCHIVE ACCESS ===') print(&#x27;-' * 60) # Search Internet Archive "keyword">for the book archive_search_url = &#x27;https://archive.org/search.php' archive_query = f&#x27;title:"{book_details["title"]}" AND creator:Chomsky' print(f&#x27;Internet Archive search query: {archive_query}') "keyword">try: params = { &#x27;query': archive_query, &#x27;"keyword">and[]': 'mediatype:texts', &#x27;sort': 'relevance' } response = requests.get(archive_search_url, params=params, headers=headers, timeout=30) print(f&#x27;Internet Archive search status: {response.status_code}') "keyword">if response.status_code == 200: soup = BeautifulSoup(response.text, &#x27;html.parser') # Look "keyword">for book results result_links = [] "keyword">for link "keyword">in soup.find_all(&#x27;a', href="keyword">True): href = link.get(&#x27;href') "keyword">if &#x27;/details/' "keyword">in href "keyword">and 'responsibility' "keyword">in href.lower(): full_url = urljoin(&#x27;https://archive.org', href) result_links.append(full_url) print(f&#x27;Found {len(result_links)} potential Internet Archive results') # Try to access the first few results "keyword">for i, link "keyword">in enumerate(result_links[:2], 1): print(f&#x27;\nTrying Internet Archive result {i}: {link}') "keyword">try: time.sleep(2) # Respectful delay ia_response = requests.get(link, headers=headers, timeout=30) print(f&#x27; Status: {ia_response.status_code}') "keyword">if ia_response.status_code == 200: ia_soup = BeautifulSoup(ia_response.text, &#x27;html.parser') ia_text = ia_soup.get_text() # Check "keyword">for full text access indicators access_indicators = [ &#x27;full text' "keyword">in ia_text.lower(), &#x27;read online' "keyword">in ia_text.lower(), &#x27;pdf' "keyword">in ia_text.lower(), &#x27;download' "keyword">in ia_text.lower() ] print(f&#x27; Access indicators: {sum(access_indicators)} found') "keyword">if any(access_indicators): print(f&#x27; *** POTENTIAL FULL TEXT ACCESS AVAILABLE ***') # Save this page "keyword">for analysis "keyword">with open(f&#x27;workspace/internet_archive_result_{i}.html', 'w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: f.write(ia_response.text) print(f&#x27; ‚úì Content saved to workspace/internet_archive_result_{i}.html') # Look "keyword">for direct PDF "keyword">or text links pdf_links = [] "keyword">for pdf_link "keyword">in ia_soup.find_all(&#x27;a', href="keyword">True): pdf_href = pdf_link.get(&#x27;href') "keyword">if pdf_href "keyword">and (&#x27;.pdf' "keyword">in pdf_href "keyword">or 'download' "keyword">in pdf_href): pdf_links.append(urljoin(link, pdf_href)) "keyword">if pdf_links: print(f&#x27; Found {len(pdf_links)} potential download links') "keyword">for j, pdf_link "keyword">in enumerate(pdf_links[:2], 1): print(f&#x27; PDF {j}: {pdf_link}') "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as e: print(f&#x27; Error accessing Internet Archive result: {str(e)}') "keyword">continue "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as e: print(f&#x27;‚ùå Error "keyword">in Internet Archive search: {str(e)}') print(&#x27;\n=== STEP 4: TRYING ACADEMIC REPOSITORY SEARCH ===') print(&#x27;-' * 60) # Search "keyword">for academic repository versions academic_queries = [ f&#x27;"{book_details["title"]}" Chomsky "November" "Wikipedia" filetype:pdf', f&#x27;"Responsibility of Intellectuals" "page 11" "November" site:edu', f&#x27;ISBN:{book_details["isbn"]} "November" "Wikipedia"' ] "keyword">for i, query "keyword">in enumerate(academic_queries, 1): print(f&#x27;\nAcademic search {i}: {query}') "keyword">try: params = {&#x27;q': query, 'num': 5} response = requests.get(google_books_search_url, params=params, headers=headers, timeout=30) "keyword">if response.status_code == 200: soup = BeautifulSoup(response.text, &#x27;html.parser') # Look "keyword">for academic/PDF results academic_links = [] "keyword">for link "keyword">in soup.find_all(&#x27;a', href="keyword">True): href = link.get(&#x27;href') "keyword">if any(domain "keyword">in href "keyword">for domain "keyword">in [&#x27;.edu', '.ac.', 'researchgate', 'academia.edu', '.pdf']): academic_links.append(href) print(f&#x27; Found {len(academic_links)} potential academic links') # Display first few results "keyword">for j, link "keyword">in enumerate(academic_links[:3], 1): print(f&#x27; Academic link {j}: {link[:80]}...') time.sleep(2) # Respectful delay "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as e: print(f&#x27; Error "keyword">in academic search {i}: {str(e)}') print(&#x27;\n=== STEP 5: ANALYZING COLLECTED CONTENT ===') print(&#x27;-' * 60) # Check what content we've collected collected_files = [] "keyword">for file "keyword">in os.listdir(&#x27;workspace'): "keyword">if file.startswith((&#x27;google_books_content', 'internet_archive_result')): file_path = os.path.join(&#x27;workspace', file) file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path) collected_files.append({ &#x27;name': file, &#x27;path': file_path, &#x27;size': file_size }) print(f&#x27;Collected content: {file} ({file_size:,} bytes)') "keyword">if collected_files: print(f&#x27;\nAnalyzing {len(collected_files)} collected content files...') analysis_results = { &#x27;search_objective': 'Find page 11, second-to-last paragraph "keyword">with Wikipedia endnote November date', &#x27;book_details': book_details, &#x27;files_analyzed': [], &#x27;november_dates_found': [], &#x27;wikipedia_citations_found': [], &#x27;potential_matches': [] } "keyword">for file_info "keyword">in collected_files: print(f&#x27;\nAnalyzing {file_info["name"]}...') "keyword">try: "keyword">with open(file_info[&#x27;path'], 'r', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: content = f.read() soup = BeautifulSoup(content, &#x27;html.parser') text_content = soup.get_text() # Search "keyword">for November dates november_patterns = [ r&#x27;November\s+(\d{1,2})(?:,?\s*\d{4})?', r&#x27;Nov\.?\s+(\d{1,2})(?:,?\s*\d{4})?', r&#x27;(\d{1,2})\s+November(?:\s+\d{4})?' ] all_november_dates = [] "keyword">for pattern "keyword">in november_patterns: matches = re.findall(pattern, text_content, re.IGNORECASE) all_november_dates.extend(matches) # Search "keyword">for Wikipedia citations wiki_patterns = [ r&#x27;en\.wikipedia\.org[^\s]*', r&#x27;Wikipedia[^.]*accessed[^.]*November[^.]*', r&#x27;November[^.]*Wikipedia[^.]*accessed' ] wiki_citations = [] "keyword">for pattern "keyword">in wiki_patterns: matches = re.findall(pattern, text_content, re.IGNORECASE) wiki_citations.extend(matches) file_analysis = { &#x27;filename': file_info['name'], &#x27;size': file_info['size'], &#x27;november_dates': list(set(all_november_dates)), &#x27;wikipedia_citations': wiki_citations[:3], # Limit to first 3 &#x27;page_11_mentions': text_content.lower().count('page 11') + text_content.lower().count('p. 11') } analysis_results[&#x27;files_analyzed'].append(file_analysis) analysis_results[&#x27;november_dates_found'].extend(all_november_dates) analysis_results[&#x27;wikipedia_citations_found'].extend(wiki_citations) print(f&#x27; November dates found: {file_analysis["november_dates"]}') print(f&#x27; Wikipedia citations: {len(file_analysis["wikipedia_citations"])}') print(f&#x27; Page 11 mentions: {file_analysis["page_11_mentions"]}') # If we found both November dates "keyword">and Wikipedia citations, this "keyword">is a potential match "keyword">if file_analysis[&#x27;november_dates'] "keyword">and file_analysis['wikipedia_citations']: analysis_results[&#x27;potential_matches'].append(file_analysis) print(f&#x27; *** POTENTIAL MATCH - Contains both November dates "keyword">and Wikipedia citations ***') "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as e: print(f&#x27; Error analyzing {file_info["name"]}: {str(e)}') # Save analysis results "keyword">with open(&#x27;workspace/alternative_access_analysis.json', 'w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: json.dump(analysis_results, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii="keyword">False) print(f&#x27;\n‚úì Analysis results saved to workspace/alternative_access_analysis.json') # Summary of findings all_november_dates = list(set(analysis_results[&#x27;november_dates_found'])) print(f&#x27;\n=== ANALYSIS SUMMARY ===') print(f&#x27;Files analyzed: {len(analysis_results["files_analyzed"])}') print(f&#x27;Unique November dates found: {all_november_dates}') print(f&#x27;Wikipedia citations found: {len(analysis_results["wikipedia_citations_found"])}') print(f&#x27;Potential matches: {len(analysis_results["potential_matches"])}') "keyword">if analysis_results[&#x27;potential_matches']: print(&#x27;\n*** POTENTIAL MATCHES FOUND ***') "keyword">for match "keyword">in analysis_results[&#x27;potential_matches']: print(f&#x27;File: {match["filename"]}') print(f&#x27;November dates: {match["november_dates"]}') print(f&#x27;Wikipedia citations: {len(match["wikipedia_citations"])}') "keyword">else: print(&#x27;‚ùå No content files were successfully collected') print(&#x27;\n=== FINAL SUMMARY ===') print(&#x27;='*80) print(&#x27;‚úì Book successfully identified: "The Responsibility of Intellectuals"') print(&#x27;‚úì Attempted multiple alternative access methods:') print(&#x27; - Google Books search "keyword">and content analysis') print(&#x27; - Internet Archive repository search') print(&#x27; - Academic repository searches') print(&#x27;‚úì Implemented systematic content analysis "keyword">for:') print(&#x27; - Page 11 references') print(&#x27; - Wikipedia citations') print(&#x27; - November dates "keyword">in citations') "keyword">if &#x27;analysis_results' "keyword">in locals() "keyword">and analysis_results.get('potential_matches'): unique_dates = list(set(analysis_results[&#x27;november_dates_found'])) print(f&#x27;\nüéØ POTENTIAL SUCCESS: Found November dates {unique_dates} "keyword">in content "keyword">with Wikipedia citations') print(&#x27;‚úì Objective may be achieved - check analysis results "keyword">for specific November day') "keyword">else: print(&#x27;\n‚ö†Ô∏è PARTIAL SUCCESS: Alternative access methods attempted but full page 11 content "keyword">not accessible') print(&#x27; - JSTOR requires institutional access') print(&#x27; - Google Books may have limited preview') print(&#x27; - Internet Archive may "keyword">not have full text') print(&#x27;\nRecommendations "keyword">for complete access:') print(&#x27; - Institutional library access to JSTOR') print(&#x27; - University library physical "keyword">or digital copy') print(&#x27; - Publisher direct access request') print(&#x27; - Interlibrary loan request') print(&#x27;\nFiles created "keyword">in workspace:') "keyword">for file "keyword">in os.listdir(&#x27;workspace'): "keyword">if file.endswith((&#x27;.html', '.json', '.txt')): file_path = os.path.join(&#x27;workspace', file) file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path) print(f&#x27; - {file} ({file_size:,} bytes)')
