üìù Code Python
"keyword">import os "keyword">import requests "keyword">from bs4 "keyword">import BeautifulSoup "keyword">import json "keyword">import time "keyword">from urllib.parse "keyword">import urljoin, quote "keyword">import re print(&#x27;=== COMPREHENSIVE SEARCH FOR WIKIPEDIA CITATION WITH NOVEMBER DATE ===') print(&#x27;Objective: Find the specific November date "keyword">from Wikipedia endnote on page 11') print(&#x27;Strategy: Use web scraping "keyword">and academic search APIs to find accessible content') print(&#x27;\n' + '='*100 + '\n') # Ensure workspace directory exists os.makedirs(&#x27;workspace', exist_ok="keyword">True) # First, inspect existing workspace to understand what we have print(&#x27;=== STEP 1: INSPECTING EXISTING WORKSPACE DATA ===') print(&#x27;-' * 60) workspace_files = [] "keyword">if os.path.exists(&#x27;workspace'): "keyword">for file "keyword">in os.listdir(&#x27;workspace'): file_path = os.path.join(&#x27;workspace', file) "keyword">if os.path.isfile(file_path): file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path) workspace_files.append({ &#x27;name': file, &#x27;path': file_path, &#x27;size': file_size }) print(f&#x27;Found file: {file} ({file_size:,} bytes)') print(f&#x27;\nTotal workspace files: {len(workspace_files)}') # Load bibliographic information "keyword">if available biblio_data = "keyword">None "keyword">for file_info "keyword">in workspace_files: "keyword">if &#x27;complete_bibliographic_information' "keyword">in file_info['name']: print(f&#x27;\nInspecting bibliographic data structure "keyword">from: {file_info["name"]}') # First inspect the structure before loading "keyword">with open(file_info[&#x27;path'], 'r', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: "keyword">try: biblio_data = json.load(f) print(&#x27;Successfully loaded bibliographic data') print(&#x27;Available keys:', list(biblio_data.keys())) # Safely extract book details book_title = biblio_data.get(&#x27;title', 'The Responsibility of Intellectuals') book_isbn = biblio_data.get(&#x27;isbn', '9781787355514') book_doi = biblio_data.get(&#x27;doi', '10.2307/j.ctv9b2xdv') print(f&#x27;Book title: {book_title}') print(f&#x27;ISBN: {book_isbn}') print(f&#x27;DOI: {book_doi}') "keyword">break "keyword">except json.JSONDecodeError "keyword">as e: print(f&#x27;Error loading JSON: {e}') "keyword">continue "keyword">if "keyword">not biblio_data: print(&#x27;No bibliographic data found, using default values') book_title = &#x27;The Responsibility of Intellectuals' book_isbn = &#x27;9781787355514' book_doi = &#x27;10.2307/j.ctv9b2xdv' print(&#x27;\n=== STEP 2: SEARCHING FOR OPEN ACCESS VERSIONS ===') print(&#x27;-' * 60) # Set up headers "keyword">for web requests headers = { &#x27;User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.124 Safari/537.36', &#x27;Accept': 'text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,image/webp,*/*;q=0.8', &#x27;Accept-Language': 'en-US,en;q=0.5' } # Try UCL Press direct access (since it's the publisher) print(&#x27;Attempting UCL Press direct access...') ucl_press_search_url = &#x27;https://www.uclpress.co.uk' "keyword">try: # Search UCL Press "keyword">for the book response = requests.get(ucl_press_search_url, headers=headers, timeout=30) print(f&#x27;UCL Press main page status: {response.status_code}') "keyword">if response.status_code == 200: soup = BeautifulSoup(response.text, &#x27;html.parser') # Look "keyword">for search functionality "keyword">or book catalog search_forms = soup.find_all(&#x27;form') search_inputs = soup.find_all(&#x27;input', {'type': 'search'}) print(f&#x27;Found {len(search_forms)} forms "keyword">and {len(search_inputs)} search inputs') # Look "keyword">for direct links to our book book_links = [] "keyword">for link "keyword">in soup.find_all(&#x27;a', href="keyword">True): href = link.get(&#x27;href') link_text = link.get_text().lower() "keyword">if &#x27;responsibility' "keyword">in link_text "keyword">or 'intellectuals' "keyword">in link_text "keyword">or 'chomsky' "keyword">in link_text: book_links.append({ &#x27;url': urljoin(ucl_press_search_url, href), &#x27;text': link.get_text().strip() }) "keyword">if book_links: print(f&#x27;Found {len(book_links)} potential book links on UCL Press:') "keyword">for i, link_info "keyword">in enumerate(book_links[:3], 1): print(f&#x27; {i}. {link_info["text"]} -> {link_info["url"]}') "keyword">else: print(&#x27;No direct book links found on UCL Press main page') "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as e: print(f&#x27;Error accessing UCL Press: {str(e)}') time.sleep(2) # Respectful delay print(&#x27;\n=== STEP 3: SEARCHING ACADEMIC DATABASES ===') print(&#x27;-' * 60) # Try ResearchGate "keyword">for academic papers "keyword">or book chapters print(&#x27;Searching ResearchGate "keyword">for related content...') "keyword">try: # Search ResearchGate rg_search_url = &#x27;https://www.researchgate.net/search' rg_params = { &#x27;q': f'"{book_title}" Chomsky "November" "Wikipedia"' } response = requests.get(rg_search_url, params=rg_params, headers=headers, timeout=30) print(f&#x27;ResearchGate search status: {response.status_code}') "keyword">if response.status_code == 200: soup = BeautifulSoup(response.text, &#x27;html.parser') # Look "keyword">for research papers "keyword">or publications publication_links = [] "keyword">for link "keyword">in soup.find_all(&#x27;a', href="keyword">True): href = link.get(&#x27;href') "keyword">if &#x27;/publication/' "keyword">in href "keyword">and ('responsibility' "keyword">in href.lower() "keyword">or 'chomsky' "keyword">in href.lower()): publication_links.append(urljoin(&#x27;https://www.researchgate.net', href)) print(f&#x27;Found {len(publication_links)} potential publications on ResearchGate') # Try to access first few publications "keyword">for i, pub_url "keyword">in enumerate(publication_links[:2], 1): print(f&#x27;\nAccessing ResearchGate publication {i}: {pub_url}') "keyword">try: time.sleep(2) # Respectful delay pub_response = requests.get(pub_url, headers=headers, timeout=30) print(f&#x27; Status: {pub_response.status_code}') "keyword">if pub_response.status_code == 200: pub_soup = BeautifulSoup(pub_response.text, &#x27;html.parser') pub_text = pub_soup.get_text() # Check "keyword">for our target content november_count = pub_text.lower().count(&#x27;november') wiki_count = pub_text.lower().count(&#x27;wikipedia') page_11_count = pub_text.lower().count(&#x27;page 11') + pub_text.lower().count('p. 11') print(f&#x27; November mentions: {november_count}') print(f&#x27; Wikipedia mentions: {wiki_count}') print(f&#x27; Page 11 mentions: {page_11_count}') "keyword">if november_count > 0 "keyword">and wiki_count > 0: print(f&#x27; *** POTENTIAL MATCH - Saving content ***') "keyword">with open(f&#x27;workspace/researchgate_publication_{i}.html', 'w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: f.write(pub_response.text) print(f&#x27; ‚úì Content saved to workspace/researchgate_publication_{i}.html') # Extract November dates november_dates = re.findall(r&#x27;November\s+(\d{1,2})', pub_text, re.IGNORECASE) "keyword">if november_dates: print(f&#x27; *** NOVEMBER DATES FOUND: {november_dates} ***') "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as e: print(f&#x27; Error accessing publication: {str(e)}') "keyword">continue "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as e: print(f&#x27;Error searching ResearchGate: {str(e)}') time.sleep(2) # Respectful delay print(&#x27;\n=== STEP 4: SEARCHING ACADEMIA.EDU ===') print(&#x27;-' * 60) # Try Academia.edu "keyword">for academic papers print(&#x27;Searching Academia.edu "keyword">for related content...') "keyword">try: academia_search_url = &#x27;https://www.academia.edu/search' academia_params = { &#x27;q': f'"Responsibility of Intellectuals" Chomsky "November" "Wikipedia"' } response = requests.get(academia_search_url, params=academia_params, headers=headers, timeout=30) print(f&#x27;Academia.edu search status: {response.status_code}') "keyword">if response.status_code == 200: soup = BeautifulSoup(response.text, &#x27;html.parser') # Look "keyword">for academic papers paper_links = [] "keyword">for link "keyword">in soup.find_all(&#x27;a', href="keyword">True): href = link.get(&#x27;href') "keyword">if &#x27;/academia-' "keyword">in href "keyword">or 'responsibility' "keyword">in href.lower() "keyword">or 'chomsky' "keyword">in href.lower(): "keyword">if href.startswith(&#x27;/'): href = &#x27;https://www.academia.edu' + href paper_links.append(href) print(f&#x27;Found {len(paper_links)} potential papers on Academia.edu') # Sample first few papers "keyword">for i, paper_url "keyword">in enumerate(paper_links[:2], 1): print(f&#x27; Paper {i}: {paper_url[:80]}...') "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as e: print(f&#x27;Error searching Academia.edu: {str(e)}') print(&#x27;\n=== STEP 5: TRYING SEMANTIC SCHOLAR API ===') print(&#x27;-' * 60) # Use Semantic Scholar API to find academic papers print(&#x27;Searching Semantic Scholar "keyword">for related papers...') "keyword">try: semantic_scholar_url = &#x27;https://api.semanticscholar.org/graph/v1/paper/search' # Search "keyword">for papers related to our book ss_params = { &#x27;query': f'"Responsibility of Intellectuals" Chomsky "November" "Wikipedia"', &#x27;limit': 10, &#x27;fields': 'title,abstract,url,authors,year,venue' } response = requests.get(semantic_scholar_url, params=ss_params, headers=headers, timeout=30) print(f&#x27;Semantic Scholar API status: {response.status_code}') "keyword">if response.status_code == 200: ss_data = response.json() "keyword">if &#x27;data' "keyword">in ss_data "keyword">and ss_data['data']: papers = ss_data[&#x27;data'] print(f&#x27;Found {len(papers)} papers on Semantic Scholar') relevant_papers = [] "keyword">for i, paper "keyword">in enumerate(papers, 1): title = paper.get(&#x27;title', 'No title') abstract = paper.get(&#x27;abstract', 'No abstract') url = paper.get(&#x27;url', 'No URL') year = paper.get(&#x27;year', 'No year') print(f&#x27;\nPaper {i}:') print(f&#x27; Title: {title}') print(f&#x27; Year: {year}') print(f&#x27; URL: {url}') # Check "keyword">if abstract contains our target terms "keyword">if abstract: abstract_lower = abstract.lower() november_in_abstract = &#x27;november' "keyword">in abstract_lower wiki_in_abstract = &#x27;wikipedia' "keyword">in abstract_lower "keyword">or 'wiki' "keyword">in abstract_lower print(f&#x27; November "keyword">in abstract: {november_in_abstract}') print(f&#x27; Wikipedia "keyword">in abstract: {wiki_in_abstract}') "keyword">if november_in_abstract "keyword">and wiki_in_abstract: print(f&#x27; *** HIGHLY RELEVANT PAPER ***') relevant_papers.append(paper) # Extract November dates "keyword">from abstract november_dates = re.findall(r&#x27;November\s+(\d{1,2})', abstract, re.IGNORECASE) "keyword">if november_dates: print(f&#x27; *** NOVEMBER DATES IN ABSTRACT: {november_dates} ***') print(f&#x27; Abstract preview: {abstract[:150]}...') "keyword">if relevant_papers: print(f&#x27;\nFound {len(relevant_papers)} highly relevant papers') # Save relevant papers data "keyword">with open(&#x27;workspace/semantic_scholar_relevant_papers.json', 'w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: json.dump(relevant_papers, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii="keyword">False) print(&#x27;‚úì Relevant papers saved to workspace/semantic_scholar_relevant_papers.json') "keyword">else: print(&#x27;No papers found on Semantic Scholar') "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as e: print(f&#x27;Error searching Semantic Scholar: {str(e)}') print(&#x27;\n=== STEP 6: SEARCHING ARXIV FOR PREPRINTS ===') print(&#x27;-' * 60) # Search arXiv "keyword">for preprints "keyword">or related papers print(&#x27;Searching arXiv "keyword">for related preprints...') "keyword">try: arxiv_search_url = &#x27;http://export.arxiv.org/api/query' # Search arXiv arxiv_params = { &#x27;search_query': 'all:"Responsibility of Intellectuals" AND all:Chomsky', &#x27;start': 0, &#x27;max_results': 10 } response = requests.get(arxiv_search_url, params=arxiv_params, headers=headers, timeout=30) print(f&#x27;arXiv search status: {response.status_code}') "keyword">if response.status_code == 200: # Parse XML response soup = BeautifulSoup(response.text, &#x27;xml') entries = soup.find_all(&#x27;entry') print(f&#x27;Found {len(entries)} entries on arXiv') "keyword">for i, entry "keyword">in enumerate(entries, 1): title_elem = entry.find(&#x27;title') summary_elem = entry.find(&#x27;summary') "keyword">if title_elem "keyword">and summary_elem: title = title_elem.get_text().strip() summary = summary_elem.get_text().strip() print(f&#x27;\narXiv Entry {i}:') print(f&#x27; Title: {title}') print(f&#x27; Summary preview: {summary[:200]}...') # Check "keyword">for November "keyword">and Wikipedia "keyword">in summary summary_lower = summary.lower() "keyword">if &#x27;november' "keyword">in summary_lower "keyword">and ('wikipedia' "keyword">in summary_lower "keyword">or 'wiki' "keyword">in summary_lower): print(f&#x27; *** POTENTIAL MATCH - Contains November "keyword">and Wikipedia ***') # Extract November dates november_dates = re.findall(r&#x27;November\s+(\d{1,2})', summary, re.IGNORECASE) "keyword">if november_dates: print(f&#x27; *** NOVEMBER DATES FOUND: {november_dates} ***') "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as e: print(f&#x27;Error searching arXiv: {str(e)}') print(&#x27;\n=== STEP 7: ANALYZING ALL COLLECTED DATA ===') print(&#x27;-' * 60) # Check what content we've successfully collected collected_files = [] "keyword">for file "keyword">in os.listdir(&#x27;workspace'): "keyword">if file.endswith(&#x27;.html') "keyword">and ('researchgate' "keyword">in file "keyword">or 'publication' "keyword">in file "keyword">or 'content' "keyword">in file): file_path = os.path.join(&#x27;workspace', file) file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path) collected_files.append({ &#x27;name': file, &#x27;path': file_path, &#x27;size': file_size }) print(f&#x27;Collected content file: {file} ({file_size:,} bytes)') # Also check "keyword">for JSON files "keyword">with paper data "keyword">for file "keyword">in os.listdir(&#x27;workspace'): "keyword">if file.endswith(&#x27;.json') "keyword">and ('semantic_scholar' "keyword">in file "keyword">or 'papers' "keyword">in file): file_path = os.path.join(&#x27;workspace', file) file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path) collected_files.append({ &#x27;name': file, &#x27;path': file_path, &#x27;size': file_size }) print(f&#x27;Collected data file: {file} ({file_size:,} bytes)') "keyword">if collected_files: print(f&#x27;\nAnalyzing {len(collected_files)} collected files "keyword">for November dates...') all_november_dates = [] all_wikipedia_citations = [] "keyword">for file_info "keyword">in collected_files: print(f&#x27;\nAnalyzing {file_info["name"]}...') "keyword">try: "keyword">with open(file_info[&#x27;path'], 'r', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: "keyword">if file_info[&#x27;name'].endswith('.json'): # Handle JSON data data = json.load(f) content_text = json.dumps(data, indent=2) "keyword">else: # Handle HTML content content = f.read() soup = BeautifulSoup(content, &#x27;html.parser') content_text = soup.get_text() # Search "keyword">for November dates "keyword">with various patterns november_patterns = [ r&#x27;November\s+(\d{1,2})(?:,?\s*\d{4})?', r&#x27;Nov\.?\s+(\d{1,2})(?:,?\s*\d{4})?', r&#x27;(\d{1,2})\s+November(?:\s+\d{4})?', r&#x27;accessed.*November\s+(\d{1,2})', r&#x27;November\s+(\d{1,2}).*accessed' ] file_november_dates = [] "keyword">for pattern "keyword">in november_patterns: matches = re.findall(pattern, content_text, re.IGNORECASE) file_november_dates.extend(matches) # Search "keyword">for Wikipedia citations wiki_patterns = [ r&#x27;en\.wikipedia\.org[^\s]*', r&#x27;Wikipedia[^.]*accessed[^.]*November[^.]*', r&#x27;November[^.]*Wikipedia[^.]*accessed', r&#x27;"[^"]*Wikipedia[^"]*"[^.]*November[^.]*\d+' ] file_wiki_citations = [] "keyword">for pattern "keyword">in wiki_patterns: matches = re.findall(pattern, content_text, re.IGNORECASE) file_wiki_citations.extend(matches) # Remove duplicates file_november_dates = list(set(file_november_dates)) file_wiki_citations = list(set(file_wiki_citations)) print(f&#x27; November dates found: {file_november_dates}') print(f&#x27; Wikipedia citations found: {len(file_wiki_citations)}') "keyword">if file_november_dates: all_november_dates.extend(file_november_dates) print(f&#x27; *** NOVEMBER DATES FOUND: {file_november_dates} ***') "keyword">if file_wiki_citations: all_wikipedia_citations.extend(file_wiki_citations) print(f&#x27; *** WIKIPEDIA CITATIONS FOUND ***') "keyword">for citation "keyword">in file_wiki_citations[:2]: # Show first 2 print(f&#x27; {citation[:100]}...') # Look "keyword">for specific combinations "keyword">if file_november_dates "keyword">and file_wiki_citations: print(f&#x27; üéØ JACKPOT: File contains both November dates "keyword">and Wikipedia citations!') "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as e: print(f&#x27; Error analyzing {file_info["name"]}: {str(e)}') # Remove duplicates "keyword">from all findings unique_november_dates = list(set(all_november_dates)) print(f&#x27;\n=== FINAL ANALYSIS RESULTS ===') print(f&#x27;Total unique November dates found: {unique_november_dates}') print(f&#x27;Total Wikipedia citations found: {len(all_wikipedia_citations)}') "keyword">if unique_november_dates: print(f&#x27;\nüéØ SUCCESS: Found November dates "keyword">in accessible content!') print(f&#x27;November dates discovered: {unique_november_dates}') # Save final results final_results = { &#x27;objective': 'Find November date "keyword">from Wikipedia endnote on page 11', &#x27;book_details': { &#x27;title': book_title, &#x27;isbn': book_isbn, &#x27;doi': book_doi }, &#x27;search_methods_used': [ &#x27;UCL Press direct search', &#x27;ResearchGate academic papers', &#x27;Academia.edu papers', &#x27;Semantic Scholar API', &#x27;arXiv preprints' ], &#x27;november_dates_found': unique_november_dates, &#x27;wikipedia_citations_found': len(all_wikipedia_citations), &#x27;files_analyzed': len(collected_files), &#x27;success': len(unique_november_dates) > 0 } "keyword">with open(&#x27;workspace/final_november_date_results.json', 'w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: json.dump(final_results, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii="keyword">False) print(&#x27;‚úì Final results saved to workspace/final_november_date_results.json') # Determine the most likely answer "keyword">if unique_november_dates: # Convert to integers "keyword">for analysis date_numbers = [] "keyword">for date_str "keyword">in unique_november_dates: "keyword">try: date_numbers.append(int(date_str)) "keyword">except ValueError: "keyword">continue "keyword">if date_numbers: most_common_date = max(set(date_numbers), key=date_numbers.count) print(f&#x27;\nüéØ MOST LIKELY ANSWER: November {most_common_date}') print(f&#x27;This date appeared "keyword">in the accessible content related to the book.') "keyword">else: print(&#x27;‚ùå No content files were successfully collected "keyword">for analysis') print(&#x27;\n=== COMPREHENSIVE SEARCH SUMMARY ===') print(&#x27;='*80) print(&#x27;‚úì Book identified: "The Responsibility of Intellectuals: Reflections by Noam Chomsky "keyword">and Others after 50 years"') print(&#x27;‚úì Multiple academic databases searched:') print(&#x27; - UCL Press (publisher direct)') print(&#x27; - ResearchGate (academic papers)') print(&#x27; - Academia.edu (academic papers)') print(&#x27; - Semantic Scholar API (research papers)') print(&#x27; - arXiv (preprints)') print(&#x27;‚úì Systematic analysis of all accessible content') print(&#x27;‚úì Pattern matching "keyword">for November dates "keyword">and Wikipedia citations') "keyword">if &#x27;unique_november_dates' "keyword">in locals() "keyword">and unique_november_dates: print(f&#x27;\nüéØ OBJECTIVE ACHIEVED: November dates found: {unique_november_dates}') print(&#x27;‚úì Successfully located Wikipedia citation dates "keyword">from accessible content') "keyword">else: print(&#x27;\n‚ö†Ô∏è OBJECTIVE NOT FULLY ACHIEVED: Direct page 11 access still requires:') print(&#x27; - Institutional JSTOR access') print(&#x27; - University library access') print(&#x27; - Publisher direct access') print(&#x27;\nFiles created "keyword">in workspace:') "keyword">for file "keyword">in sorted(os.listdir(&#x27;workspace')): "keyword">if file.endswith((&#x27;.html', '.json', '.txt')): file_path = os.path.join(&#x27;workspace', file) file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path) print(f&#x27; - {file} ({file_size:,} bytes)')
üìÑ Output
Code Output: === COMPREHENSIVE SEARCH FOR WIKIPEDIA CITATION WITH NOVEMBER DATE === Objective: Find the specific November date from Wikipedia endnote on page 11 Strategy: Use web scraping and academic search APIs to find accessible content ==================================================================================================== === STEP 1: INSPECTING EXISTING WORKSPACE DATA === ------------------------------------------------------------ Found file: google_search_results.json (7,855 bytes) Found file: doi_resolution_page.html (5,101 bytes) Found file: complete_bibliographic_information.json (4,656 bytes) Found file: jstor_search_results.json (10,697 bytes) Found file: doi_resolution_results.json (548 bytes) Found file: formatted_citation.txt (619 bytes) Total workspace files: 6 Inspecting bibliographic data structure from: complete_bibliographic_information.json Successfully loaded bibliographic data Available keys: ['doi', 'title', 'authors', 'publisher', 'publication_year', 'isbn', 'abstract_description', 'book_type', 'chapters', 'subject_area', 'access_info', 'urls'] Book title: The Responsibility of Intellectuals ISBN: 9781787355514 DOI: 10.2307/j.ctv9b2xdv === STEP 2: SEARCHING FOR OPEN ACCESS VERSIONS === ------------------------------------------------------------ Attempting UCL Press direct access... UCL Press main page status: 200 Found 1 forms and 0 search inputs No direct book links found on UCL Press main page === STEP 3: SEARCHING ACADEMIC DATABASES === ------------------------------------------------------------ Searching ResearchGate for related content... ResearchGate search status: 403 [WORKSPACE] Using task-specific workspace: workspace_e2d69698-bc99-4e85-9880-67eaccd66e6c
tester Code Testing
2025-08-11 02:37:48

Execution failed - Code ran without errors but failed to achieve the **PLAN** objective due to systematic access restrictions across all attempted sources. The comprehensive search approach was well-designed and executed multiple alternative methods including web scraping of academic databases (ResearchGate returned HTTP 403, Academia.edu searches, Semantic Scholar API, arXiv), but encountered access barriers at every major source. **What was accomplished**: Successfully loaded existing bibliographic data, attempted UCL Press direct access, searched ResearchGate (blocked), Academia.edu, Semantic Scholar API, and arXiv with systematic analysis for November dates and Wikipedia citations. The code implemented proper rate limiting, content analysis frameworks, and saved partial results. **Critical limitation**: The book 'The Responsibility of Intellectuals: Reflections by Noam Chomsky and Others after 50 years' with DOI 10.2307/j.ctv9b2xdv requires institutional JSTOR access for page 11 content, and all alternative sources either blocked access or contained no relevant content with the specific Wikipedia endnote. **PLAN** alignment: 15% - comprehensive search methodology implemented but core objective (finding specific November date from Wikipedia citation on page 11, second-to-last paragraph) remains unachievable without institutional access. **Recommendation**: Save the extensive search log to 'workspace/comprehensive_search_attempt_log.txt' for documentation. The **PLAN** fundamentally requires institutional library access, university JSTOR subscription, or direct publisher contact to access the actual page 11 text needed to locate the Wikipedia endnote with the November date.

üìù Code Python
"keyword">import os "keyword">import requests "keyword">from bs4 "keyword">import BeautifulSoup "keyword">import json "keyword">import time "keyword">from urllib.parse "keyword">import urljoin, quote "keyword">import re print(&#x27;=== COMPREHENSIVE SEARCH FOR WIKIPEDIA CITATION WITH NOVEMBER DATE ===') print(&#x27;Objective: Find the specific November date "keyword">from Wikipedia endnote on page 11') print(&#x27;Strategy: Use web scraping "keyword">and academic search APIs to find accessible content') print(&#x27;\n' + '='*100 + '\n') # Ensure workspace directory exists os.makedirs(&#x27;workspace', exist_ok="keyword">True) # First, inspect existing workspace to understand what we have print(&#x27;=== STEP 1: INSPECTING EXISTING WORKSPACE DATA ===') print(&#x27;-' * 60) workspace_files = [] "keyword">if os.path.exists(&#x27;workspace'): "keyword">for file "keyword">in os.listdir(&#x27;workspace'): file_path = os.path.join(&#x27;workspace', file) "keyword">if os.path.isfile(file_path): file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path) workspace_files.append({ &#x27;name': file, &#x27;path': file_path, &#x27;size': file_size }) print(f&#x27;Found file: {file} ({file_size:,} bytes)') print(f&#x27;\nTotal workspace files: {len(workspace_files)}') # Load bibliographic information "keyword">if available biblio_data = "keyword">None "keyword">for file_info "keyword">in workspace_files: "keyword">if &#x27;complete_bibliographic_information' "keyword">in file_info['name']: print(f&#x27;\nInspecting bibliographic data structure "keyword">from: {file_info["name"]}') # First inspect the structure before loading "keyword">with open(file_info[&#x27;path'], 'r', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: "keyword">try: biblio_data = json.load(f) print(&#x27;Successfully loaded bibliographic data') print(&#x27;Available keys:', list(biblio_data.keys())) # Safely extract book details book_title = biblio_data.get(&#x27;title', 'The Responsibility of Intellectuals') book_isbn = biblio_data.get(&#x27;isbn', '9781787355514') book_doi = biblio_data.get(&#x27;doi', '10.2307/j.ctv9b2xdv') print(f&#x27;Book title: {book_title}') print(f&#x27;ISBN: {book_isbn}') print(f&#x27;DOI: {book_doi}') "keyword">break "keyword">except json.JSONDecodeError "keyword">as e: print(f&#x27;Error loading JSON: {e}') "keyword">continue "keyword">if "keyword">not biblio_data: print(&#x27;No bibliographic data found, using default values') book_title = &#x27;The Responsibility of Intellectuals' book_isbn = &#x27;9781787355514' book_doi = &#x27;10.2307/j.ctv9b2xdv' print(&#x27;\n=== STEP 2: SEARCHING FOR OPEN ACCESS VERSIONS ===') print(&#x27;-' * 60) # Set up headers "keyword">for web requests headers = { &#x27;User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.124 Safari/537.36', &#x27;Accept': 'text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,image/webp,*/*;q=0.8', &#x27;Accept-Language': 'en-US,en;q=0.5' } # Try UCL Press direct access (since it's the publisher) print(&#x27;Attempting UCL Press direct access...') ucl_press_search_url = &#x27;https://www.uclpress.co.uk' "keyword">try: # Search UCL Press "keyword">for the book response = requests.get(ucl_press_search_url, headers=headers, timeout=30) print(f&#x27;UCL Press main page status: {response.status_code}') "keyword">if response.status_code == 200: soup = BeautifulSoup(response.text, &#x27;html.parser') # Look "keyword">for search functionality "keyword">or book catalog search_forms = soup.find_all(&#x27;form') search_inputs = soup.find_all(&#x27;input', {'type': 'search'}) print(f&#x27;Found {len(search_forms)} forms "keyword">and {len(search_inputs)} search inputs') # Look "keyword">for direct links to our book book_links = [] "keyword">for link "keyword">in soup.find_all(&#x27;a', href="keyword">True): href = link.get(&#x27;href') link_text = link.get_text().lower() "keyword">if &#x27;responsibility' "keyword">in link_text "keyword">or 'intellectuals' "keyword">in link_text "keyword">or 'chomsky' "keyword">in link_text: book_links.append({ &#x27;url': urljoin(ucl_press_search_url, href), &#x27;text': link.get_text().strip() }) "keyword">if book_links: print(f&#x27;Found {len(book_links)} potential book links on UCL Press:') "keyword">for i, link_info "keyword">in enumerate(book_links[:3], 1): print(f&#x27; {i}. {link_info["text"]} -> {link_info["url"]}') "keyword">else: print(&#x27;No direct book links found on UCL Press main page') "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as e: print(f&#x27;Error accessing UCL Press: {str(e)}') time.sleep(2) # Respectful delay print(&#x27;\n=== STEP 3: SEARCHING ACADEMIC DATABASES ===') print(&#x27;-' * 60) # Try ResearchGate "keyword">for academic papers "keyword">or book chapters print(&#x27;Searching ResearchGate "keyword">for related content...') "keyword">try: # Search ResearchGate rg_search_url = &#x27;https://www.researchgate.net/search' rg_params = { &#x27;q': f'"{book_title}" Chomsky "November" "Wikipedia"' } response = requests.get(rg_search_url, params=rg_params, headers=headers, timeout=30) print(f&#x27;ResearchGate search status: {response.status_code}') "keyword">if response.status_code == 200: soup = BeautifulSoup(response.text, &#x27;html.parser') # Look "keyword">for research papers "keyword">or publications publication_links = [] "keyword">for link "keyword">in soup.find_all(&#x27;a', href="keyword">True): href = link.get(&#x27;href') "keyword">if &#x27;/publication/' "keyword">in href "keyword">and ('responsibility' "keyword">in href.lower() "keyword">or 'chomsky' "keyword">in href.lower()): publication_links.append(urljoin(&#x27;https://www.researchgate.net', href)) print(f&#x27;Found {len(publication_links)} potential publications on ResearchGate') # Try to access first few publications "keyword">for i, pub_url "keyword">in enumerate(publication_links[:2], 1): print(f&#x27;\nAccessing ResearchGate publication {i}: {pub_url}') "keyword">try: time.sleep(2) # Respectful delay pub_response = requests.get(pub_url, headers=headers, timeout=30) print(f&#x27; Status: {pub_response.status_code}') "keyword">if pub_response.status_code == 200: pub_soup = BeautifulSoup(pub_response.text, &#x27;html.parser') pub_text = pub_soup.get_text() # Check "keyword">for our target content november_count = pub_text.lower().count(&#x27;november') wiki_count = pub_text.lower().count(&#x27;wikipedia') page_11_count = pub_text.lower().count(&#x27;page 11') + pub_text.lower().count('p. 11') print(f&#x27; November mentions: {november_count}') print(f&#x27; Wikipedia mentions: {wiki_count}') print(f&#x27; Page 11 mentions: {page_11_count}') "keyword">if november_count > 0 "keyword">and wiki_count > 0: print(f&#x27; *** POTENTIAL MATCH - Saving content ***') "keyword">with open(f&#x27;workspace/researchgate_publication_{i}.html', 'w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: f.write(pub_response.text) print(f&#x27; ‚úì Content saved to workspace/researchgate_publication_{i}.html') # Extract November dates november_dates = re.findall(r&#x27;November\s+(\d{1,2})', pub_text, re.IGNORECASE) "keyword">if november_dates: print(f&#x27; *** NOVEMBER DATES FOUND: {november_dates} ***') "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as e: print(f&#x27; Error accessing publication: {str(e)}') "keyword">continue "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as e: print(f&#x27;Error searching ResearchGate: {str(e)}') time.sleep(2) # Respectful delay print(&#x27;\n=== STEP 4: SEARCHING ACADEMIA.EDU ===') print(&#x27;-' * 60) # Try Academia.edu "keyword">for academic papers print(&#x27;Searching Academia.edu "keyword">for related content...') "keyword">try: academia_search_url = &#x27;https://www.academia.edu/search' academia_params = { &#x27;q': f'"Responsibility of Intellectuals" Chomsky "November" "Wikipedia"' } response = requests.get(academia_search_url, params=academia_params, headers=headers, timeout=30) print(f&#x27;Academia.edu search status: {response.status_code}') "keyword">if response.status_code == 200: soup = BeautifulSoup(response.text, &#x27;html.parser') # Look "keyword">for academic papers paper_links = [] "keyword">for link "keyword">in soup.find_all(&#x27;a', href="keyword">True): href = link.get(&#x27;href') "keyword">if &#x27;/academia-' "keyword">in href "keyword">or 'responsibility' "keyword">in href.lower() "keyword">or 'chomsky' "keyword">in href.lower(): "keyword">if href.startswith(&#x27;/'): href = &#x27;https://www.academia.edu' + href paper_links.append(href) print(f&#x27;Found {len(paper_links)} potential papers on Academia.edu') # Sample first few papers "keyword">for i, paper_url "keyword">in enumerate(paper_links[:2], 1): print(f&#x27; Paper {i}: {paper_url[:80]}...') "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as e: print(f&#x27;Error searching Academia.edu: {str(e)}') print(&#x27;\n=== STEP 5: TRYING SEMANTIC SCHOLAR API ===') print(&#x27;-' * 60) # Use Semantic Scholar API to find academic papers print(&#x27;Searching Semantic Scholar "keyword">for related papers...') "keyword">try: semantic_scholar_url = &#x27;https://api.semanticscholar.org/graph/v1/paper/search' # Search "keyword">for papers related to our book ss_params = { &#x27;query': f'"Responsibility of Intellectuals" Chomsky "November" "Wikipedia"', &#x27;limit': 10, &#x27;fields': 'title,abstract,url,authors,year,venue' } response = requests.get(semantic_scholar_url, params=ss_params, headers=headers, timeout=30) print(f&#x27;Semantic Scholar API status: {response.status_code}') "keyword">if response.status_code == 200: ss_data = response.json() "keyword">if &#x27;data' "keyword">in ss_data "keyword">and ss_data['data']: papers = ss_data[&#x27;data'] print(f&#x27;Found {len(papers)} papers on Semantic Scholar') relevant_papers = [] "keyword">for i, paper "keyword">in enumerate(papers, 1): title = paper.get(&#x27;title', 'No title') abstract = paper.get(&#x27;abstract', 'No abstract') url = paper.get(&#x27;url', 'No URL') year = paper.get(&#x27;year', 'No year') print(f&#x27;\nPaper {i}:') print(f&#x27; Title: {title}') print(f&#x27; Year: {year}') print(f&#x27; URL: {url}') # Check "keyword">if abstract contains our target terms "keyword">if abstract: abstract_lower = abstract.lower() november_in_abstract = &#x27;november' "keyword">in abstract_lower wiki_in_abstract = &#x27;wikipedia' "keyword">in abstract_lower "keyword">or 'wiki' "keyword">in abstract_lower print(f&#x27; November "keyword">in abstract: {november_in_abstract}') print(f&#x27; Wikipedia "keyword">in abstract: {wiki_in_abstract}') "keyword">if november_in_abstract "keyword">and wiki_in_abstract: print(f&#x27; *** HIGHLY RELEVANT PAPER ***') relevant_papers.append(paper) # Extract November dates "keyword">from abstract november_dates = re.findall(r&#x27;November\s+(\d{1,2})', abstract, re.IGNORECASE) "keyword">if november_dates: print(f&#x27; *** NOVEMBER DATES IN ABSTRACT: {november_dates} ***') print(f&#x27; Abstract preview: {abstract[:150]}...') "keyword">if relevant_papers: print(f&#x27;\nFound {len(relevant_papers)} highly relevant papers') # Save relevant papers data "keyword">with open(&#x27;workspace/semantic_scholar_relevant_papers.json', 'w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: json.dump(relevant_papers, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii="keyword">False) print(&#x27;‚úì Relevant papers saved to workspace/semantic_scholar_relevant_papers.json') "keyword">else: print(&#x27;No papers found on Semantic Scholar') "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as e: print(f&#x27;Error searching Semantic Scholar: {str(e)}') print(&#x27;\n=== STEP 6: SEARCHING ARXIV FOR PREPRINTS ===') print(&#x27;-' * 60) # Search arXiv "keyword">for preprints "keyword">or related papers print(&#x27;Searching arXiv "keyword">for related preprints...') "keyword">try: arxiv_search_url = &#x27;http://export.arxiv.org/api/query' # Search arXiv arxiv_params = { &#x27;search_query': 'all:"Responsibility of Intellectuals" AND all:Chomsky', &#x27;start': 0, &#x27;max_results': 10 } response = requests.get(arxiv_search_url, params=arxiv_params, headers=headers, timeout=30) print(f&#x27;arXiv search status: {response.status_code}') "keyword">if response.status_code == 200: # Parse XML response soup = BeautifulSoup(response.text, &#x27;xml') entries = soup.find_all(&#x27;entry') print(f&#x27;Found {len(entries)} entries on arXiv') "keyword">for i, entry "keyword">in enumerate(entries, 1): title_elem = entry.find(&#x27;title') summary_elem = entry.find(&#x27;summary') "keyword">if title_elem "keyword">and summary_elem: title = title_elem.get_text().strip() summary = summary_elem.get_text().strip() print(f&#x27;\narXiv Entry {i}:') print(f&#x27; Title: {title}') print(f&#x27; Summary preview: {summary[:200]}...') # Check "keyword">for November "keyword">and Wikipedia "keyword">in summary summary_lower = summary.lower() "keyword">if &#x27;november' "keyword">in summary_lower "keyword">and ('wikipedia' "keyword">in summary_lower "keyword">or 'wiki' "keyword">in summary_lower): print(f&#x27; *** POTENTIAL MATCH - Contains November "keyword">and Wikipedia ***') # Extract November dates november_dates = re.findall(r&#x27;November\s+(\d{1,2})', summary, re.IGNORECASE) "keyword">if november_dates: print(f&#x27; *** NOVEMBER DATES FOUND: {november_dates} ***') "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as e: print(f&#x27;Error searching arXiv: {str(e)}') print(&#x27;\n=== STEP 7: ANALYZING ALL COLLECTED DATA ===') print(&#x27;-' * 60) # Check what content we've successfully collected collected_files = [] "keyword">for file "keyword">in os.listdir(&#x27;workspace'): "keyword">if file.endswith(&#x27;.html') "keyword">and ('researchgate' "keyword">in file "keyword">or 'publication' "keyword">in file "keyword">or 'content' "keyword">in file): file_path = os.path.join(&#x27;workspace', file) file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path) collected_files.append({ &#x27;name': file, &#x27;path': file_path, &#x27;size': file_size }) print(f&#x27;Collected content file: {file} ({file_size:,} bytes)') # Also check "keyword">for JSON files "keyword">with paper data "keyword">for file "keyword">in os.listdir(&#x27;workspace'): "keyword">if file.endswith(&#x27;.json') "keyword">and ('semantic_scholar' "keyword">in file "keyword">or 'papers' "keyword">in file): file_path = os.path.join(&#x27;workspace', file) file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path) collected_files.append({ &#x27;name': file, &#x27;path': file_path, &#x27;size': file_size }) print(f&#x27;Collected data file: {file} ({file_size:,} bytes)') "keyword">if collected_files: print(f&#x27;\nAnalyzing {len(collected_files)} collected files "keyword">for November dates...') all_november_dates = [] all_wikipedia_citations = [] "keyword">for file_info "keyword">in collected_files: print(f&#x27;\nAnalyzing {file_info["name"]}...') "keyword">try: "keyword">with open(file_info[&#x27;path'], 'r', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: "keyword">if file_info[&#x27;name'].endswith('.json'): # Handle JSON data data = json.load(f) content_text = json.dumps(data, indent=2) "keyword">else: # Handle HTML content content = f.read() soup = BeautifulSoup(content, &#x27;html.parser') content_text = soup.get_text() # Search "keyword">for November dates "keyword">with various patterns november_patterns = [ r&#x27;November\s+(\d{1,2})(?:,?\s*\d{4})?', r&#x27;Nov\.?\s+(\d{1,2})(?:,?\s*\d{4})?', r&#x27;(\d{1,2})\s+November(?:\s+\d{4})?', r&#x27;accessed.*November\s+(\d{1,2})', r&#x27;November\s+(\d{1,2}).*accessed' ] file_november_dates = [] "keyword">for pattern "keyword">in november_patterns: matches = re.findall(pattern, content_text, re.IGNORECASE) file_november_dates.extend(matches) # Search "keyword">for Wikipedia citations wiki_patterns = [ r&#x27;en\.wikipedia\.org[^\s]*', r&#x27;Wikipedia[^.]*accessed[^.]*November[^.]*', r&#x27;November[^.]*Wikipedia[^.]*accessed', r&#x27;"[^"]*Wikipedia[^"]*"[^.]*November[^.]*\d+' ] file_wiki_citations = [] "keyword">for pattern "keyword">in wiki_patterns: matches = re.findall(pattern, content_text, re.IGNORECASE) file_wiki_citations.extend(matches) # Remove duplicates file_november_dates = list(set(file_november_dates)) file_wiki_citations = list(set(file_wiki_citations)) print(f&#x27; November dates found: {file_november_dates}') print(f&#x27; Wikipedia citations found: {len(file_wiki_citations)}') "keyword">if file_november_dates: all_november_dates.extend(file_november_dates) print(f&#x27; *** NOVEMBER DATES FOUND: {file_november_dates} ***') "keyword">if file_wiki_citations: all_wikipedia_citations.extend(file_wiki_citations) print(f&#x27; *** WIKIPEDIA CITATIONS FOUND ***') "keyword">for citation "keyword">in file_wiki_citations[:2]: # Show first 2 print(f&#x27; {citation[:100]}...') # Look "keyword">for specific combinations "keyword">if file_november_dates "keyword">and file_wiki_citations: print(f&#x27; üéØ JACKPOT: File contains both November dates "keyword">and Wikipedia citations!') "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as e: print(f&#x27; Error analyzing {file_info["name"]}: {str(e)}') # Remove duplicates "keyword">from all findings unique_november_dates = list(set(all_november_dates)) print(f&#x27;\n=== FINAL ANALYSIS RESULTS ===') print(f&#x27;Total unique November dates found: {unique_november_dates}') print(f&#x27;Total Wikipedia citations found: {len(all_wikipedia_citations)}') "keyword">if unique_november_dates: print(f&#x27;\nüéØ SUCCESS: Found November dates "keyword">in accessible content!') print(f&#x27;November dates discovered: {unique_november_dates}') # Save final results final_results = { &#x27;objective': 'Find November date "keyword">from Wikipedia endnote on page 11', &#x27;book_details': { &#x27;title': book_title, &#x27;isbn': book_isbn, &#x27;doi': book_doi }, &#x27;search_methods_used': [ &#x27;UCL Press direct search', &#x27;ResearchGate academic papers', &#x27;Academia.edu papers', &#x27;Semantic Scholar API', &#x27;arXiv preprints' ], &#x27;november_dates_found': unique_november_dates, &#x27;wikipedia_citations_found': len(all_wikipedia_citations), &#x27;files_analyzed': len(collected_files), &#x27;success': len(unique_november_dates) > 0 } "keyword">with open(&#x27;workspace/final_november_date_results.json', 'w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: json.dump(final_results, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii="keyword">False) print(&#x27;‚úì Final results saved to workspace/final_november_date_results.json') # Determine the most likely answer "keyword">if unique_november_dates: # Convert to integers "keyword">for analysis date_numbers = [] "keyword">for date_str "keyword">in unique_november_dates: "keyword">try: date_numbers.append(int(date_str)) "keyword">except ValueError: "keyword">continue "keyword">if date_numbers: most_common_date = max(set(date_numbers), key=date_numbers.count) print(f&#x27;\nüéØ MOST LIKELY ANSWER: November {most_common_date}') print(f&#x27;This date appeared "keyword">in the accessible content related to the book.') "keyword">else: print(&#x27;‚ùå No content files were successfully collected "keyword">for analysis') print(&#x27;\n=== COMPREHENSIVE SEARCH SUMMARY ===') print(&#x27;='*80) print(&#x27;‚úì Book identified: "The Responsibility of Intellectuals: Reflections by Noam Chomsky "keyword">and Others after 50 years"') print(&#x27;‚úì Multiple academic databases searched:') print(&#x27; - UCL Press (publisher direct)') print(&#x27; - ResearchGate (academic papers)') print(&#x27; - Academia.edu (academic papers)') print(&#x27; - Semantic Scholar API (research papers)') print(&#x27; - arXiv (preprints)') print(&#x27;‚úì Systematic analysis of all accessible content') print(&#x27;‚úì Pattern matching "keyword">for November dates "keyword">and Wikipedia citations') "keyword">if &#x27;unique_november_dates' "keyword">in locals() "keyword">and unique_november_dates: print(f&#x27;\nüéØ OBJECTIVE ACHIEVED: November dates found: {unique_november_dates}') print(&#x27;‚úì Successfully located Wikipedia citation dates "keyword">from accessible content') "keyword">else: print(&#x27;\n‚ö†Ô∏è OBJECTIVE NOT FULLY ACHIEVED: Direct page 11 access still requires:') print(&#x27; - Institutional JSTOR access') print(&#x27; - University library access') print(&#x27; - Publisher direct access') print(&#x27;\nFiles created "keyword">in workspace:') "keyword">for file "keyword">in sorted(os.listdir(&#x27;workspace')): "keyword">if file.endswith((&#x27;.html', '.json', '.txt')): file_path = os.path.join(&#x27;workspace', file) file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path) print(f&#x27; - {file} ({file_size:,} bytes)')
üìÑ Output
Code Output: === COMPREHENSIVE SEARCH FOR WIKIPEDIA CITATION WITH NOVEMBER DATE === Objective: Find the specific November date from Wikipedia endnote on page 11 Strategy: Use web scraping and academic search APIs to find accessible content ==================================================================================================== === STEP 1: INSPECTING EXISTING WORKSPACE DATA === ------------------------------------------------------------ Found file: google_search_results.json (7,855 bytes) Found file: doi_resolution_page.html (5,101 bytes) Found file: complete_bibliographic_information.json (4,656 bytes) Found file: jstor_search_results.json (10,697 bytes) Found file: doi_resolution_results.json (548 bytes) Found file: formatted_citation.txt (619 bytes) Total workspace files: 6 Inspecting bibliographic data structure from: complete_bibliographic_information.json Successfully loaded bibliographic data Available keys: ['doi', 'title', 'authors', 'publisher', 'publication_year', 'isbn', 'abstract_description', 'book_type', 'chapters', 'subject_area', 'access_info', 'urls'] Book title: The Responsibility of Intellectuals ISBN: 9781787355514 DOI: 10.2307/j.ctv9b2xdv === STEP 2: SEARCHING FOR OPEN ACCESS VERSIONS === ------------------------------------------------------------ Attempting UCL Press direct access... UCL Press main page status: 200 Found 1 forms and 0 search inputs No direct book links found on UCL Press main page === STEP 3: SEARCHING ACADEMIC DATABASES === ------------------------------------------------------------ Searching ResearchGate for related content... ResearchGate search status: 403 [WORKSPACE] Using task-specific workspace: workspace_e2d69698-bc99-4e85-9880-67eaccd66e6c
developer Code Execution - Plan 02 (Iteration 4)
2025-08-11 02:40:16

Code execution result:

üìù Code Python
"keyword">import os "keyword">import requests "keyword">from bs4 "keyword">import BeautifulSoup "keyword">import json "keyword">import time "keyword">from urllib.parse "keyword">import quote, urljoin "keyword">import re print(&#x27;=== TARGETED SEARCH FOR PAGE 11 WIKIPEDIA CITATION NOVEMBER DATE ===') print(&#x27;Strategy: Search "keyword">for specific mentions of the book content, reviews, "keyword">and citations') print(&#x27;Focus: Find references to page 11 content "keyword">and Wikipedia endnotes "keyword">with November dates') print(&#x27;\n' + '='*100 + '\n') # Ensure workspace directory exists os.makedirs(&#x27;workspace', exist_ok="keyword">True) # First, let's inspect existing workspace data to understand what we have print(&#x27;=== STEP 1: INSPECTING EXISTING WORKSPACE DATA ===') print(&#x27;-' * 60) workspace_files = [] "keyword">if os.path.exists(&#x27;workspace'): "keyword">for file "keyword">in os.listdir(&#x27;workspace'): file_path = os.path.join(&#x27;workspace', file) "keyword">if os.path.isfile(file_path): file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path) workspace_files.append({ &#x27;name': file, &#x27;path': file_path, &#x27;size': file_size }) print(f&#x27;Found file: {file} ({file_size:,} bytes)') print(f&#x27;\nTotal workspace files: {len(workspace_files)}') # Load bibliographic information to get exact book details biblio_data = "keyword">None "keyword">for file_info "keyword">in workspace_files: "keyword">if &#x27;complete_bibliographic_information' "keyword">in file_info['name']: print(f&#x27;\nInspecting bibliographic data "keyword">from: {file_info["name"]}') # First inspect the structure "keyword">with open(file_info[&#x27;path'], 'r', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: content = f.read() print(f&#x27;File content preview (first 200 chars): {content[:200]}...') # Now load the JSON "keyword">with open(file_info[&#x27;path'], 'r', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: "keyword">try: biblio_data = json.load(f) print(&#x27;Successfully loaded bibliographic data') print(&#x27;Available keys:', list(biblio_data.keys())) # Extract key details book_title = biblio_data.get(&#x27;title', 'The Responsibility of Intellectuals') book_isbn = biblio_data.get(&#x27;isbn', '9781787355514') book_doi = biblio_data.get(&#x27;doi', '10.2307/j.ctv9b2xdv') book_authors = biblio_data.get(&#x27;authors', ['Noam Chomsky']) print(f&#x27;Book title: {book_title}') print(f&#x27;ISBN: {book_isbn}') print(f&#x27;DOI: {book_doi}') print(f&#x27;Authors: {book_authors}') "keyword">break "keyword">except json.JSONDecodeError "keyword">as e: print(f&#x27;Error loading JSON: {e}') "keyword">continue "keyword">if "keyword">not biblio_data: print(&#x27;No bibliographic data found, using default values') book_title = &#x27;The Responsibility of Intellectuals' book_isbn = &#x27;9781787355514' book_doi = &#x27;10.2307/j.ctv9b2xdv' book_authors = [&#x27;Noam Chomsky'] print(&#x27;\n=== STEP 2: SEARCHING FOR BOOK REVIEWS AND CITATIONS ===') print(&#x27;-' * 60) # Set up headers "keyword">for web requests headers = { &#x27;User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.124 Safari/537.36', &#x27;Accept': 'text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,image/webp,*/*;q=0.8', &#x27;Accept-Language': 'en-US,en;q=0.5' } # Search "keyword">for book reviews that might mention specific content review_search_queries = [ f&#x27;"The Responsibility of Intellectuals" Chomsky review "page 11"', f&#x27;"The Responsibility of Intellectuals" Chomsky "Wikipedia" "November"', f&#x27;"Responsibility of Intellectuals" "50 years" review citation "November"', f&#x27;ISBN:{book_isbn} review "Wikipedia" "November"', f&#x27;DOI:{book_doi} "page 11" "Wikipedia citation"' ] print(&#x27;Searching "keyword">for book reviews "keyword">and academic citations...') "keyword">for i, query "keyword">in enumerate(review_search_queries, 1): print(f&#x27;\nSearch query {i}: {query}') "keyword">try: # Use Google search search_url = &#x27;https://www.google.com/search' params = { &#x27;q': query, &#x27;num': 10, &#x27;hl': 'en' } response = requests.get(search_url, params=params, headers=headers, timeout=30) print(f&#x27;Search status: {response.status_code}') "keyword">if response.status_code == 200: soup = BeautifulSoup(response.text, &#x27;html.parser') # Look "keyword">for search result links search_results = [] "keyword">for link "keyword">in soup.find_all(&#x27;a', href="keyword">True): href = link.get(&#x27;href') "keyword">if &#x27;/url?q=' "keyword">in href "keyword">and 'google.com' "keyword">not "keyword">in href: # Extract actual URL "keyword">from Google redirect "keyword">try: actual_url = href.split(&#x27;/url?q=')[1].split('&')[0] "keyword">if actual_url.startswith(&#x27;http'): search_results.append({ &#x27;url': actual_url, &#x27;text': link.get_text().strip() }) "keyword">except: "keyword">continue print(f&#x27;Found {len(search_results)} search results') # Try to access first few promising results "keyword">for j, result "keyword">in enumerate(search_results[:3], 1): print(f&#x27;\n Result {j}: {result["text"][:60]}...') print(f&#x27; URL: {result["url"][:80]}...') # Check "keyword">if URL looks promising (academic, review, etc.) url_lower = result[&#x27;url'].lower() promising_indicators = [ &#x27;.edu' "keyword">in url_lower, &#x27;review' "keyword">in url_lower, &#x27;academic' "keyword">in url_lower, &#x27;journal' "keyword">in url_lower, &#x27;book' "keyword">in url_lower, &#x27;chomsky' "keyword">in url_lower ] "keyword">if any(promising_indicators): print(f&#x27; *** PROMISING RESULT - Attempting access ***') "keyword">try: time.sleep(2) # Respectful delay result_response = requests.get(result[&#x27;url'], headers=headers, timeout=30) print(f&#x27; Access status: {result_response.status_code}') "keyword">if result_response.status_code == 200: result_soup = BeautifulSoup(result_response.text, &#x27;html.parser') result_text = result_soup.get_text() # Check "keyword">for our target content page_11_mentions = result_text.lower().count(&#x27;page 11') + result_text.lower().count('p. 11') wiki_mentions = result_text.lower().count(&#x27;wikipedia') november_mentions = result_text.lower().count(&#x27;november') print(f&#x27; Page 11 mentions: {page_11_mentions}') print(f&#x27; Wikipedia mentions: {wiki_mentions}') print(f&#x27; November mentions: {november_mentions}') "keyword">if page_11_mentions > 0 "keyword">or (wiki_mentions > 0 "keyword">and november_mentions > 0): print(f&#x27; *** POTENTIAL MATCH FOUND ***') # Save this content filename = f&#x27;workspace/search_result_{i}_{j}.html' "keyword">with open(filename, &#x27;w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: f.write(result_response.text) print(f&#x27; ‚úì Content saved to {os.path.basename(filename)}') # Look "keyword">for specific November dates november_patterns = [ r&#x27;November\s+(\d{1,2})(?:,?\s*\d{4})?', r&#x27;Nov\.?\s+(\d{1,2})(?:,?\s*\d{4})?', r&#x27;(\d{1,2})\s+November(?:\s+\d{4})?', r&#x27;accessed.*November\s+(\d{1,2})', r&#x27;November\s+(\d{1,2}).*accessed' ] found_dates = [] "keyword">for pattern "keyword">in november_patterns: matches = re.findall(pattern, result_text, re.IGNORECASE) found_dates.extend(matches) "keyword">if found_dates: unique_dates = list(set(found_dates)) print(f&#x27; *** NOVEMBER DATES FOUND: {unique_dates} ***') # Look "keyword">for Wikipedia citation context wiki_citation_patterns = [ r&#x27;Wikipedia[^.]*accessed[^.]*November\s+(\d{1,2})', r&#x27;November\s+(\d{1,2})[^.]*Wikipedia[^.]*accessed', r&#x27;en\.wikipedia\.org[^.]*November\s+(\d{1,2})', r&#x27;November\s+(\d{1,2})[^.]*en\.wikipedia\.org' ] wiki_dates = [] "keyword">for pattern "keyword">in wiki_citation_patterns: matches = re.findall(pattern, result_text, re.IGNORECASE) wiki_dates.extend(matches) "keyword">if wiki_dates: print(f&#x27; üéØ JACKPOT: Wikipedia citation dates found: {list(set(wiki_dates))}') "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as e: print(f&#x27; Error accessing result: {str(e)}') "keyword">continue time.sleep(3) # Respectful delay between searches "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as e: print(f&#x27;Error "keyword">in search {i}: {str(e)}') "keyword">continue print(&#x27;\n=== STEP 3: SEARCHING ACADEMIC CITATION DATABASES ===') print(&#x27;-' * 60) # Search Google Scholar specifically "keyword">for citations of this book print(&#x27;Searching Google Scholar "keyword">for citations...') "keyword">try: scholar_query = f&#x27;"The Responsibility of Intellectuals" Chomsky "2017" "November" "Wikipedia"' scholar_url = &#x27;https://scholar.google.com/scholar' params = { &#x27;q': scholar_query, &#x27;hl': 'en', &#x27;num': 10 } response = requests.get(scholar_url, params=params, headers=headers, timeout=30) print(f&#x27;Google Scholar search status: {response.status_code}') "keyword">if response.status_code == 200: soup = BeautifulSoup(response.text, &#x27;html.parser') # Look "keyword">for scholar results scholar_results = [] "keyword">for result_div "keyword">in soup.find_all(&#x27;div', class_='gs_r'): title_link = result_div.find(&#x27;h3', class_='gs_rt') "keyword">if title_link: link = title_link.find(&#x27;a') "keyword">if link: title = link.get_text().strip() url = link.get(&#x27;href') # Get snippet snippet_div = result_div.find(&#x27;div', class_='gs_rs') snippet = snippet_div.get_text().strip() "keyword">if snippet_div "keyword">else &#x27;' scholar_results.append({ &#x27;title': title, &#x27;url': url, &#x27;snippet': snippet }) print(f&#x27;Found {len(scholar_results)} Google Scholar results') "keyword">for i, result "keyword">in enumerate(scholar_results[:3], 1): print(f&#x27;\nScholar result {i}:') print(f&#x27; Title: {result["title"][:80]}...') print(f&#x27; URL: {result["url"][:80]}...' "keyword">if result['url'] "keyword">else ' No URL') print(f&#x27; Snippet: {result["snippet"][:150]}...') # Check snippet "keyword">for November dates "keyword">if result[&#x27;snippet']: november_in_snippet = re.findall(r&#x27;November\s+(\d{1,2})', result['snippet'], re.IGNORECASE) "keyword">if november_in_snippet: print(f&#x27; *** NOVEMBER DATES IN SNIPPET: {november_in_snippet} ***') "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as e: print(f&#x27;Error searching Google Scholar: {str(e)}') print(&#x27;\n=== STEP 4: SEARCHING FOR BOOK EXCERPTS AND PREVIEWS ===') print(&#x27;-' * 60) # Search "keyword">for book excerpts, previews, "keyword">or "look inside" content excerpt_queries = [ f&#x27;"The Responsibility of Intellectuals" Chomsky excerpt "page 11"', f&#x27;"Responsibility of Intellectuals" preview "Wikipedia" "November"', f&#x27;Chomsky "Responsibility of Intellectuals" "look inside" "page 11"', f&#x27;"The Responsibility of Intellectuals" sample pages "Wikipedia citation"' ] print(&#x27;Searching "keyword">for book excerpts "keyword">and previews...') "keyword">for i, query "keyword">in enumerate(excerpt_queries, 1): print(f&#x27;\nExcerpt search {i}: {query}') "keyword">try: params = { &#x27;q': query, &#x27;num': 8, &#x27;hl': 'en' } response = requests.get(&#x27;https://www.google.com/search', params=params, headers=headers, timeout=30) "keyword">if response.status_code == 200: soup = BeautifulSoup(response.text, &#x27;html.parser') # Look "keyword">for book preview "keyword">or excerpt links excerpt_links = [] "keyword">for link "keyword">in soup.find_all(&#x27;a', href="keyword">True): href = link.get(&#x27;href') link_text = link.get_text().lower() "keyword">if (&#x27;/url?q=' "keyword">in href "keyword">and any(indicator "keyword">in link_text "keyword">for indicator "keyword">in [&#x27;preview', 'excerpt', 'sample', 'look inside', 'chapter'])): "keyword">try: actual_url = href.split(&#x27;/url?q=')[1].split('&')[0] "keyword">if actual_url.startswith(&#x27;http'): excerpt_links.append({ &#x27;url': actual_url, &#x27;text': link.get_text().strip() }) "keyword">except: "keyword">continue print(f&#x27; Found {len(excerpt_links)} potential excerpt links') # Try to access excerpt links "keyword">for j, link_info "keyword">in enumerate(excerpt_links[:2], 1): print(f&#x27; Excerpt {j}: {link_info["text"][:50]}...') print(f&#x27; URL: {link_info["url"][:60]}...') "keyword">try: time.sleep(2) excerpt_response = requests.get(link_info[&#x27;url'], headers=headers, timeout=30) "keyword">if excerpt_response.status_code == 200: excerpt_soup = BeautifulSoup(excerpt_response.text, &#x27;html.parser') excerpt_text = excerpt_soup.get_text() # Check "keyword">for target content "keyword">if &#x27;november' "keyword">in excerpt_text.lower() "keyword">and 'wikipedia' "keyword">in excerpt_text.lower(): print(f&#x27; *** POTENTIAL MATCH - Contains November "keyword">and Wikipedia ***') # Save content filename = f&#x27;workspace/excerpt_{i}_{j}.html' "keyword">with open(filename, &#x27;w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: f.write(excerpt_response.text) print(f&#x27; ‚úì Excerpt saved to {os.path.basename(filename)}') # Extract November dates november_dates = re.findall(r&#x27;November\s+(\d{1,2})', excerpt_text, re.IGNORECASE) "keyword">if november_dates: print(f&#x27; üéØ NOVEMBER DATES FOUND: {list(set(november_dates))}') "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as e: print(f&#x27; Error accessing excerpt: {str(e)}') "keyword">continue time.sleep(3) # Respectful delay "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as e: print(f&#x27;Error "keyword">in excerpt search {i}: {str(e)}') "keyword">continue print(&#x27;\n=== STEP 5: ANALYZING ALL COLLECTED CONTENT ===') print(&#x27;-' * 60) # Analyze all content we've collected collected_files = [] "keyword">for file "keyword">in os.listdir(&#x27;workspace'): "keyword">if file.endswith(&#x27;.html') "keyword">and ('search_result' "keyword">in file "keyword">or 'excerpt' "keyword">in file): file_path = os.path.join(&#x27;workspace', file) file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path) collected_files.append({ &#x27;name': file, &#x27;path': file_path, &#x27;size': file_size }) print(f&#x27;Collected file: {file} ({file_size:,} bytes)') "keyword">if collected_files: print(f&#x27;\nAnalyzing {len(collected_files)} collected files...') all_november_dates = [] all_wiki_citations = [] potential_answers = [] "keyword">for file_info "keyword">in collected_files: print(f&#x27;\nAnalyzing {file_info["name"]}...') "keyword">try: "keyword">with open(file_info[&#x27;path'], 'r', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: content = f.read() soup = BeautifulSoup(content, &#x27;html.parser') text_content = soup.get_text() # Search "keyword">for November dates "keyword">in various contexts november_patterns = [ r&#x27;November\s+(\d{1,2})(?:,?\s*\d{4})?', r&#x27;Nov\.?\s+(\d{1,2})(?:,?\s*\d{4})?', r&#x27;(\d{1,2})\s+November(?:\s+\d{4})?', r&#x27;accessed.*November\s+(\d{1,2})', r&#x27;November\s+(\d{1,2}).*accessed', r&#x27;Wikipedia.*accessed.*November\s+(\d{1,2})', r&#x27;November\s+(\d{1,2}).*Wikipedia.*accessed' ] file_november_dates = [] "keyword">for pattern "keyword">in november_patterns: matches = re.findall(pattern, text_content, re.IGNORECASE) file_november_dates.extend(matches) # Search "keyword">for Wikipedia citations wiki_patterns = [ r&#x27;en\.wikipedia\.org[^\s]*', r&#x27;Wikipedia[^.]*accessed[^.]*November[^.]*\d+', r&#x27;November[^.]*\d+[^.]*Wikipedia[^.]*accessed' ] file_wiki_citations = [] "keyword">for pattern "keyword">in wiki_patterns: matches = re.findall(pattern, text_content, re.IGNORECASE) file_wiki_citations.extend(matches) # Remove duplicates file_november_dates = list(set(file_november_dates)) file_wiki_citations = list(set(file_wiki_citations)) print(f&#x27; November dates found: {file_november_dates}') print(f&#x27; Wikipedia citations found: {len(file_wiki_citations)}') "keyword">if file_november_dates: all_november_dates.extend(file_november_dates) # If we found both November dates "keyword">and Wikipedia mentions, this "keyword">is promising "keyword">if file_wiki_citations "keyword">or &#x27;wikipedia' "keyword">in text_content.lower(): potential_answers.extend(file_november_dates) print(f&#x27; üéØ POTENTIAL ANSWER: {file_november_dates} (found "keyword">with Wikipedia context)') "keyword">if file_wiki_citations: all_wikipedia_citations.extend(file_wiki_citations) "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as e: print(f&#x27; Error analyzing {file_info["name"]}: {str(e)}') # Final analysis unique_november_dates = list(set(all_november_dates)) unique_potential_answers = list(set(potential_answers)) print(f&#x27;\n=== FINAL ANALYSIS RESULTS ===') print(f&#x27;Total November dates found: {unique_november_dates}') print(f&#x27;Potential answers ("keyword">with Wikipedia context): {unique_potential_answers}') print(f&#x27;Total Wikipedia citations found: {len(all_wikipedia_citations)}') # Save final results final_results = { &#x27;objective': 'Find November date "keyword">from Wikipedia endnote on page 11 of "The Responsibility of Intellectuals"', &#x27;book_details': { &#x27;title': book_title, &#x27;isbn': book_isbn, &#x27;doi': book_doi, &#x27;authors': book_authors }, &#x27;search_methods': [ &#x27;Book review searches', &#x27;Google Scholar citations', &#x27;Book excerpt searches', &#x27;Academic database searches' ], &#x27;all_november_dates_found': unique_november_dates, &#x27;potential_answers': unique_potential_answers, &#x27;wikipedia_citations_found': len(all_wikipedia_citations), &#x27;files_analyzed': len(collected_files), &#x27;success': len(unique_potential_answers) > 0 } "keyword">with open(&#x27;workspace/targeted_search_results.json', 'w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: json.dump(final_results, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii="keyword">False) print(&#x27;\n‚úì Final results saved to workspace/targeted_search_results.json') "keyword">if unique_potential_answers: # Determine most likely answer "keyword">from collections "keyword">import Counter date_counts = Counter(unique_potential_answers) most_common_date = date_counts.most_common(1)[0][0] "keyword">if date_counts "keyword">else "keyword">None print(f&#x27;\nüéØ MOST LIKELY ANSWER: November {most_common_date}') print(f&#x27;This date appeared {date_counts[most_common_date]} time(s) "keyword">in Wikipedia citation contexts') # Save the answer answer_data = { &#x27;question': 'What "keyword">is the specific November date when the Wikipedia article was accessed ("keyword">from page 11, second-to-last paragraph endnote)?', &#x27;answer': most_common_date, &#x27;confidence': 'High' "keyword">if date_counts[most_common_date] > 1 "keyword">else 'Medium', &#x27;source': 'Multiple web searches found November dates "keyword">in Wikipedia citation contexts', &#x27;all_dates_found': unique_potential_answers, &#x27;search_timestamp': time.strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S') } "keyword">with open(&#x27;workspace/final_answer.json', 'w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: json.dump(answer_data, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii="keyword">False) print(&#x27;\n‚úì Final answer saved to workspace/final_answer.json') "keyword">else: print(&#x27;‚ùå No content files were collected "keyword">for analysis') years"') print(&#x27;‚úì Comprehensive targeted searches conducted:') print(&#x27; - Book review searches "keyword">with page 11 focus') print(&#x27; - Google Scholar citation searches') print(&#x27; - Book excerpt "keyword">and preview searches') print(&#x27; - Academic database searches') print(&#x27;‚úì Content analysis "keyword">for November dates "keyword">and Wikipedia citations') "keyword">if &#x27;unique_potential_answers' "keyword">in locals() "keyword">and unique_potential_answers: print(f&#x27;\nüéØ SUCCESS: Found potential November dates: {unique_potential_answers}') print(&#x27;‚úì Located dates "keyword">in Wikipedia citation contexts "keyword">from accessible content') "keyword">else: print(&#x27;\n‚ö†Ô∏è CHALLENGE: Direct page 11 access still limited by:') file) file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path) print(f&#x27; - {file} ({file_size:,} bytes)')

üìù Code Python
