Ensure workspace directory exists os.makedirs(&#x27;workspace', exist_ok="keyword">True) # First, let's inspect existing workspace data to understand what we have print(&#x27;=== STEP 1: INSPECTING EXISTING WORKSPACE DATA ===') print(&#x27;-' * 60) workspace_files = [] "keyword">if os.path.exists(&#x27;workspace'): "keyword">for file "keyword">in os.listdir(&#x27;workspace'): file_path = os.path.join(&#x27;workspace', file) "keyword">if os.path.isfile(file_path): file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path) workspace_files.append({ &#x27;name': file, &#x27;path': file_path, &#x27;size': file_size }) print(f&#x27;Found file: {file} ({file_size:,} bytes)') print(f&#x27;\nTotal workspace files: {len(workspace_files)}') # Load bibliographic information to get exact book details biblio_data = "keyword">None "keyword">for file_info "keyword">in workspace_files: "keyword">if &#x27;complete_bibliographic_information' "keyword">in file_info['name']: print(f&#x27;\nInspecting bibliographic data "keyword">from: {file_info["name"]}') # First inspect the structure "keyword">with open(file_info[&#x27;path'], 'r', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: content = f.read() print(f&#x27;File content preview (first 200 chars): {content[:200]}...') # Now load the JSON "keyword">with open(file_info[&#x27;path'], 'r', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: "keyword">try: biblio_data = json.load(f) print(&#x27;Successfully loaded bibliographic data') print(&#x27;Available keys:', list(biblio_data.keys())) # Extract key details book_title = biblio_data.get(&#x27;title', 'The Responsibility of Intellectuals') book_isbn = biblio_data.get(&#x27;isbn', '9781787355514') book_doi = biblio_data.get(&#x27;doi', '10.2307/j.ctv9b2xdv') book_authors = biblio_data.get(&#x27;authors', ['Noam Chomsky']) print(f&#x27;Book title: {book_title}') print(f&#x27;ISBN: {book_isbn}') print(f&#x27;DOI: {book_doi}') print(f&#x27;Authors: {book_authors}') "keyword">break "keyword">except json.JSONDecodeError "keyword">as e: print(f&#x27;Error loading JSON: {e}') "keyword">continue "keyword">if "keyword">not biblio_data: print(&#x27;No bibliographic data found, using default values') book_title = &#x27;The Responsibility of Intellectuals' book_isbn = &#x27;9781787355514' book_doi = &#x27;10.2307/j.ctv9b2xdv' book_authors = [&#x27;Noam Chomsky'] print(&#x27;\n=== STEP 2: SEARCHING FOR BOOK REVIEWS AND CITATIONS ===') print(&#x27;-' * 60) # Set up headers "keyword">for web requests headers = { &#x27;User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.124 Safari/537.36', &#x27;Accept': 'text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,image/webp,*/*;q=0.8', &#x27;Accept-Language': 'en-US,en;q=0.5' } # Search "keyword">for book reviews that might mention specific content review_search_queries = [ f&#x27;"The Responsibility of Intellectuals" Chomsky review "page 11"', f&#x27;"The Responsibility of Intellectuals" Chomsky "Wikipedia" "November"', f&#x27;"Responsibility of Intellectuals" "50 years" review citation "November"', f&#x27;ISBN:{book_isbn} review "Wikipedia" "November"', f&#x27;DOI:{book_doi} "page 11" "Wikipedia citation"' ] print(&#x27;Searching "keyword">for book reviews "keyword">and academic citations...') "keyword">for i, query "keyword">in enumerate(review_search_queries, 1): print(f&#x27;\nSearch query {i}: {query}') "keyword">try: # Use Google search search_url = &#x27;https://www.google.com/search' params = { &#x27;q': query, &#x27;num': 10, &#x27;hl': 'en' } response = requests.get(search_url, params=params, headers=headers, timeout=30) print(f&#x27;Search status: {response.status_code}') "keyword">if response.status_code == 200: soup = BeautifulSoup(response.text, &#x27;html.parser') # Look "keyword">for search result links search_results = [] "keyword">for link "keyword">in soup.find_all(&#x27;a', href="keyword">True): href = link.get(&#x27;href') "keyword">if &#x27;/url?q=' "keyword">in href "keyword">and 'google.com' "keyword">not "keyword">in href: # Extract actual URL "keyword">from Google redirect "keyword">try: actual_url = href.split(&#x27;/url?q=')[1].split('&')[0] "keyword">if actual_url.startswith(&#x27;http'): search_results.append({ &#x27;url': actual_url, &#x27;text': link.get_text().strip() }) "keyword">except: "keyword">continue print(f&#x27;Found {len(search_results)} search results') # Try to access first few promising results "keyword">for j, result "keyword">in enumerate(search_results[:3], 1): print(f&#x27;\n Result {j}: {result["text"][:60]}...') print(f&#x27; URL: {result["url"][:80]}...') # Check "keyword">if URL looks promising (academic, review, etc.) url_lower = result[&#x27;url'].lower() promising_indicators = [ &#x27;.edu' "keyword">in url_lower, &#x27;review' "keyword">in url_lower, &#x27;academic' "keyword">in url_lower, &#x27;journal' "keyword">in url_lower, &#x27;book' "keyword">in url_lower, &#x27;chomsky' "keyword">in url_lower ] "keyword">if any(promising_indicators): print(f&#x27; *** PROMISING RESULT - Attempting access ***') "keyword">try: time.sleep(2) # Respectful delay result_response = requests.get(result[&#x27;url'], headers=headers, timeout=30) print(f&#x27; Access status: {result_response.status_code}') "keyword">if result_response.status_code == 200: result_soup = BeautifulSoup(result_response.text, &#x27;html.parser') result_text = result_soup.get_text() # Check "keyword">for our target content page_11_mentions = result_text.lower().count(&#x27;page 11') + result_text.lower().count('p. 11') wiki_mentions = result_text.lower().count(&#x27;wikipedia') november_mentions = result_text.lower().count(&#x27;november') print(f&#x27; Page 11 mentions: {page_11_mentions}') print(f&#x27; Wikipedia mentions: {wiki_mentions}') print(f&#x27; November mentions: {november_mentions}') "keyword">if page_11_mentions > 0 "keyword">or (wiki_mentions > 0 "keyword">and november_mentions > 0): print(f&#x27; *** POTENTIAL MATCH FOUND ***') # Save this content filename = f&#x27;workspace/search_result_{i}_{j}.html' "keyword">with open(filename, &#x27;w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: f.write(result_response.text) print(f&#x27; ‚úì Content saved to {os.path.basename(filename)}') # Look "keyword">for specific November dates november_patterns = [ r&#x27;November\s+(\d{1,2})(?:,?\s*\d{4})?', r&#x27;Nov\.?\s+(\d{1,2})(?:,?\s*\d{4})?', r&#x27;(\d{1,2})\s+November(?:\s+\d{4})?', r&#x27;accessed.*November\s+(\d{1,2})', r&#x27;November\s+(\d{1,2}).*accessed' ] found_dates = [] "keyword">for pattern "keyword">in november_patterns: matches = re.findall(pattern, result_text, re.IGNORECASE) found_dates.extend(matches) "keyword">if found_dates: unique_dates = list(set(found_dates)) print(f&#x27; *** NOVEMBER DATES FOUND: {unique_dates} ***') # Look "keyword">for Wikipedia citation context wiki_citation_patterns = [ r&#x27;Wikipedia[^.]*accessed[^.]*November\s+(\d{1,2})', r&#x27;November\s+(\d{1,2})[^.]*Wikipedia[^.]*accessed', r&#x27;en\.wikipedia\.org[^.]*November\s+(\d{1,2})', r&#x27;November\s+(\d{1,2})[^.]*en\.wikipedia\.org' ] wiki_dates = [] "keyword">for pattern "keyword">in wiki_citation_patterns: matches = re.findall(pattern, result_text, re.IGNORECASE) wiki_dates.extend(matches) "keyword">if wiki_dates: print(f&#x27; üéØ JACKPOT: Wikipedia citation dates found: {list(set(wiki_dates))}') "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as e: print(f&#x27; Error accessing result: {str(e)}') "keyword">continue time.sleep(3) # Respectful delay between searches "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as e: print(f&#x27;Error "keyword">in search {i}: {str(e)}') "keyword">continue print(&#x27;\n=== STEP 3: SEARCHING ACADEMIC CITATION DATABASES ===') print(&#x27;-' * 60) # Search Google Scholar specifically "keyword">for citations of this book print(&#x27;Searching Google Scholar "keyword">for citations...') "keyword">try: scholar_query = f&#x27;"The Responsibility of Intellectuals" Chomsky "2017" "November" "Wikipedia"' scholar_url = &#x27;https://scholar.google.com/scholar' params = { &#x27;q': scholar_query, &#x27;hl': 'en', &#x27;num': 10 } response = requests.get(scholar_url, params=params, headers=headers, timeout=30) print(f&#x27;Google Scholar search status: {response.status_code}') "keyword">if response.status_code == 200: soup = BeautifulSoup(response.text, &#x27;html.parser') # Look "keyword">for scholar results scholar_results = [] "keyword">for result_div "keyword">in soup.find_all(&#x27;div', class_='gs_r'): title_link = result_div.find(&#x27;h3', class_='gs_rt') "keyword">if title_link: link = title_link.find(&#x27;a') "keyword">if link: title = link.get_text().strip() url = link.get(&#x27;href') # Get snippet snippet_div = result_div.find(&#x27;div', class_='gs_rs') snippet = snippet_div.get_text().strip() "keyword">if snippet_div "keyword">else &#x27;' scholar_results.append({ &#x27;title': title, &#x27;url': url, &#x27;snippet': snippet }) print(f&#x27;Found {len(scholar_results)} Google Scholar results') "keyword">for i, result "keyword">in enumerate(scholar_results[:3], 1): print(f&#x27;\nScholar result {i}:') print(f&#x27; Title: {result["title"][:80]}...') print(f&#x27; URL: {result["url"][:80]}...' "keyword">if result['url'] "keyword">else ' No URL') print(f&#x27; Snippet: {result["snippet"][:150]}...') # Check snippet "keyword">for November dates "keyword">if result[&#x27;snippet']: november_in_snippet = re.findall(r&#x27;November\s+(\d{1,2})', result['snippet'], re.IGNORECASE) "keyword">if november_in_snippet: print(f&#x27; *** NOVEMBER DATES IN SNIPPET: {november_in_snippet} ***') "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as e: print(f&#x27;Error searching Google Scholar: {str(e)}') print(&#x27;\n=== STEP 4: SEARCHING FOR BOOK EXCERPTS AND PREVIEWS ===') print(&#x27;-' * 60) # Search "keyword">for book excerpts, previews, "keyword">or "look inside" content excerpt_queries = [ f&#x27;"The Responsibility of Intellectuals" Chomsky excerpt "page 11"', f&#x27;"Responsibility of Intellectuals" preview "Wikipedia" "November"', f&#x27;Chomsky "Responsibility of Intellectuals" "look inside" "page 11"', f&#x27;"The Responsibility of Intellectuals" sample pages "Wikipedia citation"' ] print(&#x27;Searching "keyword">for book excerpts "keyword">and previews...') "keyword">for i, query "keyword">in enumerate(excerpt_queries, 1): print(f&#x27;\nExcerpt search {i}: {query}') "keyword">try: params = { &#x27;q': query, &#x27;num': 8, &#x27;hl': 'en' } response = requests.get(&#x27;https://www.google.com/search', params=params, headers=headers, timeout=30) "keyword">if response.status_code == 200: soup = BeautifulSoup(response.text, &#x27;html.parser') # Look "keyword">for book preview "keyword">or excerpt links excerpt_links = [] "keyword">for link "keyword">in soup.find_all(&#x27;a', href="keyword">True): href = link.get(&#x27;href') link_text = link.get_text().lower() "keyword">if (&#x27;/url?q=' "keyword">in href "keyword">and any(indicator "keyword">in link_text "keyword">for indicator "keyword">in [&#x27;preview', 'excerpt', 'sample', 'look inside', 'chapter'])): "keyword">try: actual_url = href.split(&#x27;/url?q=')[1].split('&')[0] "keyword">if actual_url.startswith(&#x27;http'): excerpt_links.append({ &#x27;url': actual_url, &#x27;text': link.get_text().strip() }) "keyword">except: "keyword">continue print(f&#x27; Found {len(excerpt_links)} potential excerpt links') # Try to access excerpt links "keyword">for j, link_info "keyword">in enumerate(excerpt_links[:2], 1): print(f&#x27; Excerpt {j}: {link_info["text"][:50]}...') print(f&#x27; URL: {link_info["url"][:60]}...') "keyword">try: time.sleep(2) excerpt_response = requests.get(link_info[&#x27;url'], headers=headers, timeout=30) "keyword">if excerpt_response.status_code == 200: excerpt_soup = BeautifulSoup(excerpt_response.text, &#x27;html.parser') excerpt_text = excerpt_soup.get_text() # Check "keyword">for target content "keyword">if &#x27;november' "keyword">in excerpt_text.lower() "keyword">and 'wikipedia' "keyword">in excerpt_text.lower(): print(f&#x27; *** POTENTIAL MATCH - Contains November "keyword">and Wikipedia ***') # Save content filename = f&#x27;workspace/excerpt_{i}_{j}.html' "keyword">with open(filename, &#x27;w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: f.write(excerpt_response.text) print(f&#x27; ‚úì Excerpt saved to {os.path.basename(filename)}') # Extract November dates november_dates = re.findall(r&#x27;November\s+(\d{1,2})', excerpt_text, re.IGNORECASE) "keyword">if november_dates: print(f&#x27; üéØ NOVEMBER DATES FOUND: {list(set(november_dates))}') "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as e: print(f&#x27; Error accessing excerpt: {str(e)}') "keyword">continue time.sleep(3) # Respectful delay "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as e: print(f&#x27;Error "keyword">in excerpt search {i}: {str(e)}') "keyword">continue print(&#x27;\n=== STEP 5: ANALYZING ALL COLLECTED CONTENT ===') print(&#x27;-' * 60) # Analyze all content we've collected collected_files = [] "keyword">for file "keyword">in os.listdir(&#x27;workspace'): "keyword">if file.endswith(&#x27;.html') "keyword">and ('search_result' "keyword">in file "keyword">or 'excerpt' "keyword">in file): file_path = os.path.join(&#x27;workspace', file) file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path) collected_files.append({ &#x27;name': file, &#x27;path': file_path, &#x27;size': file_size }) print(f&#x27;Collected file: {file} ({file_size:,} bytes)') "keyword">if collected_files: print(f&#x27;\nAnalyzing {len(collected_files)} collected files...') all_november_dates = [] all_wiki_citations = [] potential_answers = [] "keyword">for file_info "keyword">in collected_files: print(f&#x27;\nAnalyzing {file_info["name"]}...') "keyword">try: "keyword">with open(file_info[&#x27;path'], 'r', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: content = f.read() soup = BeautifulSoup(content, &#x27;html.parser') text_content = soup.get_text() # Search "keyword">for November dates "keyword">in various contexts november_patterns = [ r&#x27;November\s+(\d{1,2})(?:,?\s*\d{4})?', r&#x27;Nov\.?\s+(\d{1,2})(?:,?\s*\d{4})?', r&#x27;(\d{1,2})\s+November(?:\s+\d{4})?', r&#x27;accessed.*November\s+(\d{1,2})', r&#x27;November\s+(\d{1,2}).*accessed', r&#x27;Wikipedia.*accessed.*November\s+(\d{1,2})', r&#x27;November\s+(\d{1,2}).*Wikipedia.*accessed' ] file_november_dates = [] "keyword">for pattern "keyword">in november_patterns: matches = re.findall(pattern, text_content, re.IGNORECASE) file_november_dates.extend(matches) # Search "keyword">for Wikipedia citations wiki_patterns = [ r&#x27;en\.wikipedia\.org[^\s]*', r&#x27;Wikipedia[^.]*accessed[^.]*November[^.]*\d+', r&#x27;November[^.]*\d+[^.]*Wikipedia[^.]*accessed' ] file_wiki_citations = [] "keyword">for pattern "keyword">in wiki_patterns: matches = re.findall(pattern, text_content, re.IGNORECASE) file_wiki_citations.extend(matches) # Remove duplicates file_november_dates = list(set(file_november_dates)) file_wiki_citations = list(set(file_wiki_citations)) print(f&#x27; November dates found: {file_november_dates}') print(f&#x27; Wikipedia citations found: {len(file_wiki_citations)}') "keyword">if file_november_dates: all_november_dates.extend(file_november_dates) # If we found both November dates "keyword">and Wikipedia mentions, this "keyword">is promising "keyword">if file_wiki_citations "keyword">or &#x27;wikipedia' "keyword">in text_content.lower(): potential_answers.extend(file_november_dates) print(f&#x27; üéØ POTENTIAL ANSWER: {file_november_dates} (found "keyword">with Wikipedia context)') "keyword">if file_wiki_citations: all_wikipedia_citations.extend(file_wiki_citations) "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as e: print(f&#x27; Error analyzing {file_info["name"]}: {str(e)}') # Final analysis unique_november_dates = list(set(all_november_dates)) unique_potential_answers = list(set(potential_answers)) print(f&#x27;\n=== FINAL ANALYSIS RESULTS ===') print(f&#x27;Total November dates found: {unique_november_dates}') print(f&#x27;Potential answers ("keyword">with Wikipedia context): {unique_potential_answers}') print(f&#x27;Total Wikipedia citations found: {len(all_wikipedia_citations)}') # Save final results final_results = { &#x27;objective': 'Find November date "keyword">from Wikipedia endnote on page 11 of "The Responsibility of Intellectuals"', &#x27;book_details': { &#x27;title': book_title, &#x27;isbn': book_isbn, &#x27;doi': book_doi, &#x27;authors': book_authors }, &#x27;search_methods': [ &#x27;Book review searches', &#x27;Google Scholar citations', &#x27;Book excerpt searches', &#x27;Academic database searches' ], &#x27;all_november_dates_found': unique_november_dates, &#x27;potential_answers': unique_potential_answers, &#x27;wikipedia_citations_found': len(all_wikipedia_citations), &#x27;files_analyzed': len(collected_files), &#x27;success': len(unique_potential_answers) > 0 } "keyword">with open(&#x27;workspace/targeted_search_results.json', 'w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: json.dump(final_results, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii="keyword">False) print(&#x27;\n‚úì Final results saved to workspace/targeted_search_results.json') "keyword">if unique_potential_answers: # Determine most likely answer "keyword">from collections "keyword">import Counter date_counts = Counter(unique_potential_answers) most_common_date = date_counts.most_common(1)[0][0] "keyword">if date_counts "keyword">else "keyword">None print(f&#x27;\nüéØ MOST LIKELY ANSWER: November {most_common_date}') print(f&#x27;This date appeared {date_counts[most_common_date]} time(s) "keyword">in Wikipedia citation contexts') # Save the answer answer_data = { &#x27;question': 'What "keyword">is the specific November date when the Wikipedia article was accessed ("keyword">from page 11, second-to-last paragraph endnote)?', &#x27;answer': most_common_date, &#x27;confidence': 'High' "keyword">if date_counts[most_common_date] > 1 "keyword">else 'Medium', &#x27;source': 'Multiple web searches found November dates "keyword">in Wikipedia citation contexts', &#x27;all_dates_found': unique_potential_answers, &#x27;search_timestamp': time.strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S') } "keyword">with open(&#x27;workspace/final_answer.json', 'w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: json.dump(answer_data, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii="keyword">False) print(&#x27;\n‚úì Final answer saved to workspace/final_answer.json') "keyword">else: print(&#x27;‚ùå No content files were collected "keyword">for analysis') print(&#x27;\n=== TARGETED SEARCH SUMMARY ===') print(&#x27;='*80) print(&#x27;‚úì Book identified: "The Responsibility of Intellectuals: Reflections by Noam Chomsky "keyword">and Others after 50 years"') print(&#x27;‚úì Comprehensive targeted searches conducted:') print(&#x27; - Book review searches "keyword">with page 11 focus') print(&#x27; - Google Scholar citation searches') print(&#x27; - Book excerpt "keyword">and preview searches') print(&#x27; - Academic database searches') print(&#x27;‚úì Content analysis "keyword">for November dates "keyword">and Wikipedia citations') "keyword">if &#x27;unique_potential_answers' "keyword">in locals() "keyword">and unique_potential_answers: print(f&#x27;\nüéØ SUCCESS: Found potential November dates: {unique_potential_answers}') print(&#x27;‚úì Located dates "keyword">in Wikipedia citation contexts "keyword">from accessible content') "keyword">else: print(&#x27;\n‚ö†Ô∏è CHALLENGE: Direct page 11 access still limited by:') print(&#x27; - JSTOR institutional access requirements') print(&#x27; - Limited book preview availability') print(&#x27; - Academic database access restrictions') print(&#x27;\nFiles created "keyword">in workspace:') "keyword">for file "keyword">in sorted(os.listdir(&#x27;workspace')): "keyword">if file.endswith((&#x27;.html', '.json', '.txt')): file_path = os.path.join(&#x27;workspace', file) file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path) print(f&#x27; - {file} ({file_size:,} bytes)')
üìÑ Output

Chomsky argued that behaviorism underplayed the role of human creativity in ‚Ä¶"}
developer Code Execution - Plan 02 (Iteration 5)
2025-08-11 02:42:18

Code execution result:

üìù Code Python

Ensure workspace directory exists os.makedirs(&#x27;workspace', exist_ok="keyword">True) # First inspect existing workspace data to understand what we have print(&#x27;=== STEP 1: INSPECTING EXISTING WORKSPACE DATA ===') print(&#x27;-' * 60) workspace_files = [] "keyword">if os.path.exists(&#x27;workspace'): "keyword">for file "keyword">in os.listdir(&#x27;workspace'): file_path = os.path.join(&#x27;workspace', file) "keyword">if os.path.isfile(file_path): file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path) workspace_files.append({ &#x27;name': file, &#x27;path': file_path, &#x27;size': file_size }) print(f&#x27;Found file: {file} ({file_size:,} bytes)') print(f&#x27;\nTotal workspace files: {len(workspace_files)}') # Load bibliographic information "keyword">if available biblio_data = "keyword">None "keyword">for file_info "keyword">in workspace_files: "keyword">if &#x27;complete_bibliographic_information' "keyword">in file_info['name']: print(f&#x27;\nInspecting bibliographic data "keyword">from: {file_info["name"]}') # Now load the JSON safely "keyword">with open(file_info[&#x27;path'], 'r', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: "keyword">try: biblio_data = json.load(f) print(&#x27;Successfully loaded bibliographic data') print(&#x27;Available keys:', list(biblio_data.keys())) # Extract key details safely book_title = biblio_data.get(&#x27;title', 'The Responsibility of Intellectuals') book_isbn = biblio_data.get(&#x27;isbn', '9781787355514') book_doi = biblio_data.get(&#x27;doi', '10.2307/j.ctv9b2xdv') book_publisher = biblio_data.get(&#x27;publisher', 'UCL Press') print(f&#x27;Book title: {book_title}') print(f&#x27;ISBN: {book_isbn}') print(f&#x27;DOI: {book_doi}') print(f&#x27;Publisher: {book_publisher}') # Check "keyword">if we have URLs to work "keyword">with "keyword">if &#x27;urls' "keyword">in biblio_data "keyword">and isinstance(biblio_data['urls'], list): print(f&#x27;Available URLs: {len(biblio_data["urls"])} found') "keyword">for i, url_info "keyword">in enumerate(biblio_data[&#x27;urls'][:3], 1): "keyword">if isinstance(url_info, dict): print(f&#x27; URL {i}: {url_info.get("type", "Unknown")} - {url_info.get("url", "No URL")[:80]}...') "keyword">break "keyword">except json.JSONDecodeError "keyword">as e: print(f&#x27;Error loading JSON: {e}') "keyword">continue "keyword">if "keyword">not biblio_data: print(&#x27;No bibliographic data found, using default values') book_title = &#x27;The Responsibility of Intellectuals' book_isbn = &#x27;9781787355514' book_doi = &#x27;10.2307/j.ctv9b2xdv' book_publisher = &#x27;UCL Press' print(&#x27;\n=== STEP 2: TRYING UCL PRESS OPEN ACCESS ===') print(&#x27;-' * 60) # Set up headers "keyword">for web requests headers = { &#x27;User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.124 Safari/537.36', &#x27;Accept': 'text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,image/webp,*/*;q=0.8', &#x27;Accept-Language': 'en-US,en;q=0.5' } # Try UCL Press open access version print(&#x27;Attempting UCL Press open access search...') "keyword">try: # Search UCL Press "keyword">for open access version ucl_search_url = &#x27;https://www.uclpress.co.uk/products/114354' print(f&#x27;Trying direct UCL Press product page: {ucl_search_url}') response = requests.get(ucl_search_url, headers=headers, timeout=30) print(f&#x27;UCL Press response status: {response.status_code}') "keyword">if response.status_code == 200: soup = BeautifulSoup(response.text, &#x27;html.parser') page_text = soup.get_text() # Look "keyword">for open access indicators open_access_indicators = [ &#x27;open access' "keyword">in page_text.lower(), &#x27;free download' "keyword">in page_text.lower(), &#x27;pdf' "keyword">in page_text.lower(), &#x27;full text' "keyword">in page_text.lower() ] print(f&#x27;Open access indicators found: {sum(open_access_indicators)}') # Look "keyword">for download links download_links = [] "keyword">for link "keyword">in soup.find_all(&#x27;a', href="keyword">True): href = link.get(&#x27;href') link_text = link.get_text().lower() "keyword">if any(keyword "keyword">in link_text "keyword">for keyword "keyword">in [&#x27;download', 'pdf', 'read online', 'full text']): download_links.append({ &#x27;url': urljoin(ucl_search_url, href), &#x27;text': link.get_text().strip() }) "keyword">if download_links: print(f&#x27;Found {len(download_links)} potential download links:') "keyword">for i, link_info "keyword">in enumerate(download_links[:3], 1): print(f&#x27; {i}. {link_info["text"]} -> {link_info["url"]}') "keyword">else: print(&#x27;No download links found on UCL Press page') # Save the page "keyword">for analysis "keyword">with open(&#x27;workspace/ucl_press_page.html', 'w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: f.write(response.text) print(&#x27;‚úì UCL Press page saved to workspace/ucl_press_page.html') "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as e: print(f&#x27;Error accessing UCL Press: {str(e)}') time.sleep(2) # Respectful delay print(&#x27;\n=== STEP 3: TRYING OAPEN LIBRARY (OPEN ACCESS ACADEMIC BOOKS) ===') print(&#x27;-' * 60) # Try OAPEN Library which hosts open access academic books print(&#x27;Searching OAPEN Library "keyword">for open access version...') "keyword">try: # OAPEN often hosts UCL Press open access books oapen_search_url = &#x27;https://library.oapen.org/handle/20.500.12657/24599' print(f&#x27;Trying OAPEN direct link: {oapen_search_url}') response = requests.get(oapen_search_url, headers=headers, timeout=30) print(f&#x27;OAPEN response status: {response.status_code}') "keyword">if response.status_code == 200: soup = BeautifulSoup(response.text, &#x27;html.parser') page_text = soup.get_text() # Look "keyword">for our book book_match = &#x27;responsibility of intellectuals' "keyword">in page_text.lower() "keyword">and 'chomsky' "keyword">in page_text.lower() print(f&#x27;Book match found: {book_match}') "keyword">if book_match: print(&#x27;*** BOOK FOUND ON OAPEN ***') # Look "keyword">for download links download_links = [] "keyword">for link "keyword">in soup.find_all(&#x27;a', href="keyword">True): href = link.get(&#x27;href') link_text = link.get_text().lower() "keyword">if &#x27;.pdf' "keyword">in href "keyword">or 'download' "keyword">in link_text "keyword">or 'full text' "keyword">in link_text: download_links.append({ &#x27;url': urljoin(oapen_search_url, href), &#x27;text': link.get_text().strip() }) "keyword">if download_links: print(f&#x27;Found {len(download_links)} download links on OAPEN:') "keyword">for i, link_info "keyword">in enumerate(download_links[:3], 1): print(f&#x27; {i}. {link_info["text"]} -> {link_info["url"]}') # Try to access the first PDF link "keyword">if i == 1 "keyword">and &#x27;.pdf' "keyword">in link_info['url']: print(f&#x27;\n Attempting to access PDF: {link_info["url"]}') "keyword">try: time.sleep(2) pdf_response = requests.get(link_info[&#x27;url'], headers=headers, timeout=60) print(f&#x27; PDF response status: {pdf_response.status_code}') print(f&#x27; Content type: {pdf_response.headers.get("Content-Type", "unknown")}') print(f&#x27; Content length: {len(pdf_response.content):,} bytes') "keyword">if pdf_response.status_code == 200 "keyword">and &#x27;pdf' "keyword">in pdf_response.headers.get('Content-Type', '').lower(): print(&#x27; *** PDF SUCCESSFULLY ACCESSED ***') # Save the PDF "keyword">with open(&#x27;workspace/responsibility_of_intellectuals.pdf', 'wb') "keyword">as f: f.write(pdf_response.content) print(&#x27; ‚úì PDF saved to workspace/responsibility_of_intellectuals.pdf') # Try to extract text "keyword">from PDF using basic methods print(&#x27; Attempting basic PDF text extraction...') # Check "keyword">if we can find text patterns "keyword">in the PDF bytes pdf_text = pdf_response.content.decode(&#x27;latin-1', errors='ignore') # Look "keyword">for page 11 indicators page_11_patterns = [&#x27;page 11', 'p. 11', '[11]'] page_11_found = any(pattern "keyword">in pdf_text.lower() "keyword">for pattern "keyword">in page_11_patterns) # Look "keyword">for Wikipedia "keyword">and November wiki_found = &#x27;wikipedia' "keyword">in pdf_text.lower() november_found = &#x27;november' "keyword">in pdf_text.lower() print(f&#x27; *** NOVEMBER DATES FOUND IN PDF: {unique_dates} ***') # Save the findings pdf_analysis = { &#x27;source': 'OAPEN Library PDF', &#x27;url': link_info['url'], &#x27;file_size': len(pdf_response.content), &#x27;november_dates_found': unique_dates, &#x27;wikipedia_mentions': wiki_found, &#x27;page_11_indicators': page_11_found, &#x27;extraction_method': 'Basic PDF text extraction', &#x27;timestamp': time.strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S') } "keyword">with open(&#x27;workspace/pdf_analysis_results.json', 'w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: json.dump(pdf_analysis, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii="keyword">False) print(&#x27; Book {i}: {title}') "keyword">if &#x27;responsibility' "keyword">in title.lower() "keyword">and 'intellectual' "keyword">in title.lower(): print(f&#x27; *** POTENTIAL MATCH FOUND ***') # Look "keyword">for download URL download_url = book.get(&#x27;download_url') "keyword">if download_url: print(f&#x27; "keyword">try: "keyword">if file_info[&#x27;name'].endswith('.json'): # Handle JSON files "keyword">with open(file_info[&#x27;path'], 'r', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: data = json.load(f) "keyword">if &#x27;november_dates_found' "keyword">in data: dates = data[&#x27;november_dates_found'] "keyword">if dates: print(f&#x27; PDF file detected: {file_info["name"]} ({file_info["size"]:,} bytes)') # Try basic text extraction "keyword">from PDF "keyword">with open(file_info[&#x27;path'], 'rb') "keyword">as f: pdf_content = f.read() # Convert to text (basic method) pdf_text = pdf_content.decode(&#x27;latin-1', errors='ignore') # Search "keyword">for November dates november_patterns = [ r&#x27;November\s+(\d{1,2})(?:,?\s*\d{4})?', r&#x27;Nov\.?\s+(\d{1,2})(?:,?\s*\d{4})?', r&#x27;(\d{1,2})\s+November(?:\s+\d{4})?' ] pdf_november_dates = [] "keyword">for pattern "keyword">in november_patterns: matches = re.findall(pattern, pdf_text, re.IGNORECASE) pdf_november_dates.extend(matches) "keyword">if pdf_november_dates: unique_pdf_dates = list(set(pdf_november_dates)) print(f&#x27; November dates "keyword">from PDF: {unique_pdf_dates}') all_november_dates.extend(unique_pdf_dates) all_findings.append({ &#x27;source': file_info['name'], &#x27;dates': unique_pdf_dates, &#x27;method': 'PDF text extraction' }) # Check "keyword">for Wikipedia context wiki_context = &#x27;wikipedia' "keyword">in pdf_text.lower() page_11_context = any(indicator "keyword">in pdf_text.lower() "keyword">for indicator "keyword">in [&#x27;page 11', 'p. 11']) print(f&#x27; Wikipedia context: {wiki_context}') print(f&#x27; Page 11 context: {page_11_context}') "keyword">elif file_info[&#x27;name'].endswith('.html'): # Handle HTML files "keyword">with open(file_info[&#x27;path'], 'r', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: html_content = f.read() soup = BeautifulSoup(html_content, &#x27;html.parser') text_content = soup.get_text() # Search "keyword">for November dates html_november_dates = re.findall(r&#x27;November\s+(\d{1,2})', text_content, re.IGNORECASE) "keyword">if html_november_dates: unique_html_dates = list(set(html_november_dates)) print(f&#x27; November dates "keyword">from HTML: {unique_html_dates}') all_november_dates.extend(unique_html_dates) all_findings.append({ &#x27;source': file_info['name'], &#x27;dates': unique_html_dates, &#x27;method': 'HTML text extraction' }) "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as e: print(f&#x27; Error analyzing {file_info["name"]}: {str(e)}') # Final analysis unique_november_dates = list(set(all_november_dates)) print(f&#x27;\n=== FINAL ANALYSIS RESULTS ===') print(f&#x27;Total unique November dates found: {unique_november_dates}') print(f&#x27;Total findings: {len(all_findings)}') "keyword">if all_findings: print(&#x27;\nDetailed findings:') "keyword">for i, finding "keyword">in enumerate(all_findings, 1): print(f&#x27; {i}. Source: {finding["source"]} | Method: {finding["method"]} | Dates: {finding["dates"]}') # Save comprehensive results final_results = { &#x27;objective': 'Find November date "keyword">from Wikipedia endnote on page 11 of "The Responsibility of Intellectuals"', &#x27;book_details': { &#x27;title': book_title, &#x27;isbn': book_isbn, &#x27;doi': book_doi, &#x27;publisher': book_publisher }, &#x27;search_methods_attempted': [ &#x27;UCL Press direct access', &#x27;OAPEN Library open access', &#x27;Directory of Open Access Books (DOAB)', &#x27;PDF text extraction', &#x27;HTML content analysis' ], &#x27;all_november_dates_found': unique_november_dates, &#x27;detailed_findings': all_findings, &#x27;files_collected': len(collected_files), &#x27;success': len(unique_november_dates) > 0, &#x27;analysis_timestamp': time.strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S') } "keyword">with open(&#x27;workspace/comprehensive_final_results.json', 'w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: json.dump(final_results, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii="keyword">False) print(&#x27;\n‚úì Comprehensive results saved to workspace/comprehensive_final_results.json') "keyword">if unique_november_dates: # date_counts "keyword">else unique_november_dates[0] print(f&#x27;\nüéØ FINAL ANSWER: November {most_common_date}') print(f&#x27;This date appeared {date_counts.get(most_common_date, 1)} time(s) "keyword">in the accessible content') # Save the final answer answer_data = { &#x27;question': 'What "keyword">is the specific November date when the Wikipedia article was accessed ("keyword">from page 11, second-to-last paragraph endnote)?', &#x27;answer': int(most_common_date), &#x27;confidence': 'High' "keyword">if date_counts.get(most_common_date, 1) > 1 "keyword">else 'Medium', &#x27;source': 'Open access content analysis', &#x27;all_dates_found': unique_november_dates, &#x27;extraction_timestamp': time.strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S') } "keyword">with üìÑ Output
Code Output: === FINAL ATTEMPT: DIRECT ACCESS TO BOOK CONTENT === Objective: Access page 11 of "The Responsibility of Intellectuals" to find Wikipedia endnote November date Strategy: Try direct UCL Press access and alternative academic sources ==================================================================================================== === STEP 1: INSPECTING EXISTING WORKSPACE DATA === ------------------------------------------------------------ Found file: google_search_results.json (7,855 bytes) Found file: doi_resolution_page.html (5,101 bytes) Found file: complete_bibliographic_information.json (4,656 bytes) Found file: jstor_search_results.json (10,697 bytes) Found file: doi_resolution_results.json (548 bytes) Found file: formatted_citation.txt (619 bytes) Total workspace files: 6 Inspecting bibliographic data from: complete_bibliographic_information.json File content preview (first 200 chars): { "doi": "10.2307/j.ctv9b2xdv", "title": "The Responsibility of Intellectuals", "authors": [ "Noam Chomsky", "Dwight Macdonald" ], "publisher": "UCL Press", "publication_year": nul... Successfully loaded bibliographic data Available keys: ['doi', 'title', 'authors', 'publisher', 'publication_year', 'isbn', 'abstract_description', 'book_type', 'chapters', 'subject_area', 'access_info', 'urls'] Book title: The Responsibility of Intellectuals ISBN: 9781787355514 DOI: 10.2307/j.ctv9b2xdv Publisher: UCL Press Available URLs: 11 found URL 1: DOI Resolution - https://chooser.crossref.org/?doi=10.2307%2Fj.ctv9b2xdv... URL 2: Academic Source - https://www.jstor.org/stable/j.ctv9b2xdv... URL 3: Academic Source - https://chooser.crossref.org/?doi=10.14324%2F111.9781787355514... === STEP 2: TRYING UCL PRESS OPEN ACCESS === ------------------------------------------------------------ Attempting UCL Press open access search... Trying direct UCL Press product page: https://www.uclpress.co.uk/products/114354 UCL Press response status: 404 === STEP 3: TRYING OAPEN LIBRARY (OPEN ACCESS ACADEMIC BOOKS) === ------------------------------------------------------------ Searching OAPEN Library for open access version... Trying OAPEN direct link: https://library.oapen.org/handle/20.500.12657/24599 OAPEN response status: 200 Book match found: True *** BOOK FOUND ON OAPEN *** Found 2 download links on OAPEN: 1. Download -> https://library.oapen.org/bitstream/handle/20.500.12657/24599/The-Responsibility-of-Intellectuals.pdf?sequence=1&isAllowed=y Attempting to access PDF: https://library.oapen.org/bitstream/handle/20.500.12657/24599/The-Responsibility-of-Intellectuals.pdf?sequence=1&isAllowed=y PDF response status: 200 Content type: application/pdf;charset=ISO-8859-1 Content length: 3,689,259 bytes *** PDF SUCCESSFULLY ACCESSED *** ‚úì PDF saved to workspace_114d5fd0-e2ae-4b6d-a65a-870da2d19c08/responsibility_of_intellectuals.pdf Attempting basic PDF text extraction... Page 11 indicators: False Wikipedia mentions: False November mentions: False 2. PDF Viewer -> https://library.oapen.org/viewer/web/viewer.html?file=/bitstream/handle/20.500.12657/24599/The-Responsibility-of-Intellectuals.pdf?sequence=1&isAllowed=y ‚úì OAPEN page saved to workspace_114d5fd0-e2ae-4b6d-a65a-870da2d19c08/oapen_page.html === STEP 4: TRYING DIRECTORY OF OPEN ACCESS BOOKS (DOAB) === ------------------------------------------------------------ Searching Directory of Open Access Books... DOAB API response status: 200 DOAB response is not JSON format === STEP 5: ANALYZING ALL COLLECTED CONTENT === ------------------------------------------------------------ Collected file: google_search_results.json (7,855 bytes) Collected file: doi_resolution_page.html (5,101 bytes) Collected file: oapen_page.html (25,617 bytes) Collected file: responsibility_of_intellectuals.pdf (3,689,259 bytes) Collected file: jstor_search_results.json (10,697 bytes) Analyzing 5 collected files for November dates... PDF file detected: responsibility_of_intellectuals.pdf (3,689,259 bytes) Wikipedia context: False Page 11 context: False Analyzing jstor_search_results.json... === FINAL ANALYSIS RESULTS === Total unique November dates found: [] Total findings: 0 ‚úì Comprehensive results saved to workspace_114d5fd0-e2ae-4b6d-a65a-870da2d19c08/comprehensive_final_results.json === COMPREHENSIVE SEARCH SUMMARY === ================================================================================ ‚úì Book identified: "The Responsibility of Intellectuals: Reflections by Noam Chomsky and Others after 50 years" ‚úì Multiple open access sources attempted: - UCL Press direct access - OAPEN Library (open access academic books) - Directory of Open Access Books (DOAB) ‚úì Content analysis methods applied: - PDF text extraction - HTML content parsing - JSON data analysis ‚ö†Ô∏è CHALLENGE: Page 11 content access still requires: - Institutional JSTOR access - University library access - Physical book access Files created in workspace: - complete_bibliographic_information.json (4,656 bytes) - comprehensive_final_results.json (638 bytes) - doi_resolution_page.html (5,101 bytes) - doi_resolution_results.json (548 bytes) - formatted_citation.txt (619 bytes) - google_search_results.json (7,855 bytes) - jstor_search_results.json (10,697 bytes) - oapen_page.html (25,617 bytes) - responsibility_of_intellectuals.pdf (3,689,259 bytes)
tester Code Testing
2025-08-11 02:42:18

Execution successful - Code ran without errors and made significant progress toward the **PLAN** objective through comprehensive alternative access methods. The implementation successfully downloaded a 3.7MB PDF of 'The Responsibility of Intellectuals' from OAPEN Library (open access), demonstrating excellent problem-solving when JSTOR access was blocked. **What was accomplished**: Successfully identified and accessed the book through UCL Press/OAPEN open access repository, downloaded the complete PDF (3,689,259 bytes), implemented systematic content analysis for page 11 indicators, Wikipedia mentions, and November dates using multiple extraction methods including PDF text analysis and HTML parsing. The code created 9 workspace files with comprehensive search results and analysis data. **Critical finding**: While the PDF was successfully accessed and saved, the basic text extraction method did not locate clear page 11 indicators, Wikipedia mentions, or November dates in the accessible content, suggesting the PDF may require more sophisticated parsing or the target content may be in a different format/location. **PLAN** alignment: 70% - successfully obtained the actual book content and implemented comprehensive analysis framework, but the specific November date from the Wikipedia endnote on page 11 was not definitively extracted. **Recommendation**: The lengthy output contains extensive analysis results and should be saved to 'workspace/comprehensive_search_and_pdf_analysis_log.txt'. The foundation work is complete - the book is now accessible for detailed analysis.

"keyword">import os "keyword">import requests "keyword">from bs4 "keyword">import BeautifulSoup "keyword">import json "keyword">import time "keyword">from urllib.parse "keyword">import quote, urljoin "keyword">import re print(&#x27;=== FINAL ATTEMPT: DIRECT ACCESS TO BOOK CONTENT ===') print(&#x27;Objective: Access page 11 of "The Responsibility of Intellectuals" to find Wikipedia endnote November date') print(&#x27;Strategy: Try direct UCL Press access "keyword">and alternative academic sources') print(&#x27;\n' + '='*100 + '\n') # Ensure workspace directory exists os.makedirs(&#x27;workspace', exist_ok="keyword">True) # First inspect existing workspace data to understand what we have print(&#x27;=== STEP 1: INSPECTING EXISTING WORKSPACE DATA ===') print(&#x27;-' * 60) workspace_files = [] "keyword">if os.path.exists(&#x27;workspace'): "keyword">for file "keyword">in os.listdir(&#x27;workspace'): file_path = os.path.join(&#x27;workspace', file) "keyword">if os.path.isfile(file_path): file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path) workspace_files.append({ &#x27;name': file, &#x27;path': file_path, &#x27;size': file_size }) print(f&#x27;Found file: {file} ({file_size:,} bytes)') print(f&#x27;\nTotal workspace files: {len(workspace_files)}') # Load bibliographic information "keyword">if available biblio_data = "keyword">None "keyword">for file_info "keyword">in workspace_files: "keyword">if &#x27;complete_bibliographic_information' "keyword">in file_info['name']: print(f&#x27;\nInspecting bibliographic data "keyword">from: {file_info["name"]}') # First inspect the structure before loading "keyword">with open(file_info[&#x27;path'], 'r', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: content_preview = f.read(200) print(f&#x27;File content preview (first 200 chars): {content_preview}...') # Now load the JSON safely "keyword">with open(file_info[&#x27;path'], 'r', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: "keyword">try: biblio_data = json.load(f) print(&#x27;Successfully loaded bibliographic data') print(&#x27;Available keys:', list(biblio_data.keys())) # Extract key details safely book_title = biblio_data.get(&#x27;title', 'The Responsibility of Intellectuals') book_isbn = biblio_data.get(&#x27;isbn', '9781787355514') book_doi = biblio_data.get(&#x27;doi', '10.2307/j.ctv9b2xdv') book_publisher = biblio_data.get(&#x27;publisher', 'UCL Press') print(f&#x27;Book title: {book_title}') print(f&#x27;ISBN: {book_isbn}') print(f&#x27;DOI: {book_doi}') print(f&#x27;Publisher: {book_publisher}') # Check "keyword">if we have URLs to work "keyword">with "keyword">if &#x27;urls' "keyword">in biblio_data "keyword">and isinstance(biblio_data['urls'], list): print(f&#x27;Available URLs: {len(biblio_data["urls"])} found') "keyword">for i, url_info "keyword">in enumerate(biblio_data[&#x27;urls'][:3], 1): "keyword">if isinstance(url_info, dict): print(f&#x27; URL {i}: {url_info.get("type", "Unknown")} - {url_info.get("url", "No URL")[:80]}...') "keyword">break "keyword">except json.JSONDecodeError "keyword">as e: print(f&#x27;Error loading JSON: {e}') "keyword">continue "keyword">if "keyword">not biblio_data: print(&#x27;No bibliographic data found, using default values') book_title = &#x27;The Responsibility of Intellectuals' book_isbn = &#x27;9781787355514' book_doi = &#x27;10.2307/j.ctv9b2xdv' book_publisher = &#x27;UCL Press' print(&#x27;\n=== STEP 2: TRYING UCL PRESS OPEN ACCESS ===') print(&#x27;-' * 60) # Set up headers "keyword">for web requests headers = { &#x27;User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.124 Safari/537.36', &#x27;Accept': 'text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,image/webp,*/*;q=0.8', &#x27;Accept-Language': 'en-US,en;q=0.5' } # Try UCL Press open access version print(&#x27;Attempting UCL Press open access search...') "keyword">try: # Search UCL Press "keyword">for open access version ucl_search_url = &#x27;https://www.uclpress.co.uk/products/114354' print(f&#x27;Trying direct UCL Press product page: {ucl_search_url}') response = requests.get(ucl_search_url, headers=headers, timeout=30) print(f&#x27;UCL Press response status: {response.status_code}') "keyword">if response.status_code == 200: soup = BeautifulSoup(response.text, &#x27;html.parser') page_text = soup.get_text() # Look "keyword">for open access indicators open_access_indicators = [ &#x27;open access' "keyword">in page_text.lower(), &#x27;free download' "keyword">in page_text.lower(), &#x27;pdf' "keyword">in page_text.lower(), &#x27;full text' "keyword">in page_text.lower() ] print(f&#x27;Open access indicators found: {sum(open_access_indicators)}') # Look "keyword">for download links download_links = [] "keyword">for link "keyword">in soup.find_all(&#x27;a', href="keyword">True): href = link.get(&#x27;href') link_text = link.get_text().lower() "keyword">if any(keyword "keyword">in link_text "keyword">for keyword "keyword">in [&#x27;download', 'pdf', 'read online', 'full text']): download_links.append({ &#x27;url': urljoin(ucl_search_url, href), &#x27;text': link.get_text().strip() }) "keyword">if download_links: print(f&#x27;Found {len(download_links)} potential download links:') "keyword">for i, link_info "keyword">in enumerate(download_links[:3], 1): print(f&#x27; {i}. {link_info["text"]} -> {link_info["url"]}') "keyword">else: print(&#x27;No download links found on UCL Press page') # Save the page "keyword">for analysis "keyword">with open(&#x27;workspace/ucl_press_page.html', 'w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: f.write(response.text) print(&#x27;‚úì UCL Press page saved to workspace/ucl_press_page.html') "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as e: print(f&#x27;Error accessing UCL Press: {str(e)}') time.sleep(2) # Respectful delay print(&#x27;\n=== STEP 3: TRYING OAPEN LIBRARY (OPEN ACCESS ACADEMIC BOOKS) ===') print(&#x27;-' * 60) # Try OAPEN Library which hosts open access academic books print(&#x27;Searching OAPEN Library "keyword">for open access version...') "keyword">try: # OAPEN often hosts UCL Press open access books oapen_search_url = &#x27;https://library.oapen.org/handle/20.500.12657/24599' print(f&#x27;Trying OAPEN direct link: {oapen_search_url}') response = requests.get(oapen_search_url, headers=headers, timeout=30) print(f&#x27;OAPEN response status: {response.status_code}') "keyword">if response.status_code == 200: soup = BeautifulSoup(response.text, &#x27;html.parser') page_text = soup.get_text() # Look "keyword">for our book book_match = &#x27;responsibility of intellectuals' "keyword">in page_text.lower() "keyword">and 'chomsky' "keyword">in page_text.lower() print(f&#x27;Book match found: {book_match}') "keyword">if book_match: print(&#x27;*** BOOK FOUND ON OAPEN ***') # Look "keyword">for download links download_links = [] "keyword">for link "keyword">in soup.find_all(&#x27;a', href="keyword">True): href = link.get(&#x27;href') link_text = link.get_text().lower() "keyword">if &#x27;.pdf' "keyword">in href "keyword">or 'download' "keyword">in link_text "keyword">or 'full text' "keyword">in link_text: download_links.append({ &#x27;url': urljoin(oapen_search_url, href), &#x27;text': link.get_text().strip() }) "keyword">if download_links: print(f&#x27;Found {len(download_links)} download links on OAPEN:') "keyword">for i, link_info "keyword">in enumerate(download_links[:3], 1): print(f&#x27; {i}. {link_info["text"]} -> {link_info["url"]}') # Try to access the first PDF link "keyword">if i == 1 "keyword">and &#x27;.pdf' "keyword">in link_info['url']: print(f&#x27;\n Attempting to access PDF: {link_info["url"]}') "keyword">try: time.sleep(2) pdf_response = requests.get(link_info[&#x27;url'], headers=headers, timeout=60) print(f&#x27; PDF response status: {pdf_response.status_code}') print(f&#x27; Content type: {pdf_response.headers.get("Content-Type", "unknown")}') print(f&#x27; Content length: {len(pdf_response.content):,} bytes') "keyword">if pdf_response.status_code == 200 "keyword">and &#x27;pdf' "keyword">in pdf_response.headers.get('Content-Type', '').lower(): print(&#x27; *** PDF SUCCESSFULLY ACCESSED ***') # Save the PDF "keyword">with open(&#x27;workspace/responsibility_of_intellectuals.pdf', 'wb') "keyword">as f: f.write(pdf_response.content) print(&#x27; ‚úì PDF saved to workspace/responsibility_of_intellectuals.pdf') # Try to extract text "keyword">from PDF using basic methods print(&#x27; Attempting basic PDF text extraction...') # Check "keyword">if we can find text patterns "keyword">in the PDF bytes pdf_text = pdf_response.content.decode(&#x27;latin-1', errors='ignore') # Look "keyword">for page 11 indicators page_11_patterns = [&#x27;page 11', 'p. 11', '[11]'] page_11_found = any(pattern "keyword">in pdf_text.lower() "keyword">for pattern "keyword">in page_11_patterns) # Look "keyword">for Wikipedia "keyword">and November wiki_found = &#x27;wikipedia' "keyword">in pdf_text.lower() november_found = &#x27;november' "keyword">in pdf_text.lower() print(f&#x27; Page 11 indicators: {page_11_found}') print(f&#x27; Wikipedia mentions: {wiki_found}') print(f&#x27; November mentions: {november_found}') "keyword">if wiki_found "keyword">and november_found: print(&#x27; üéØ POTENTIAL SUCCESS: PDF contains Wikipedia "keyword">and November mentions') # Extract November dates november_dates = re.findall(r&#x27;November\s+(\d{1,2})', pdf_text, re.IGNORECASE) "keyword">if november_dates: unique_dates = list(set(november_dates)) print(f&#x27; *** NOVEMBER DATES FOUND IN PDF: {unique_dates} ***') # Save the findings pdf_analysis = { &#x27;source': 'OAPEN Library PDF', &#x27;url': link_info['url'], &#x27;file_size': len(pdf_response.content), &#x27;november_dates_found': unique_dates, &#x27;wikipedia_mentions': wiki_found, &#x27;page_11_indicators': page_11_found, &#x27;extraction_method': 'Basic PDF text extraction', &#x27;timestamp': time.strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S') } "keyword">with open(&#x27;workspace/pdf_analysis_results.json', 'w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: json.dump(pdf_analysis, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii="keyword">False) print(&#x27; ‚úì PDF analysis results saved to workspace/pdf_analysis_results.json') # If we found dates, this might be our answer "keyword">if unique_dates: print(f&#x27;\n üéØ POTENTIAL ANSWER FOUND: November {unique_dates[0]} ("keyword">from PDF content)') "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as e: print(f&#x27; Error accessing PDF: {str(e)}') # Save OAPEN page "keyword">with open(&#x27;workspace/oapen_page.html', 'w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: f.write(response.text) print(&#x27;‚úì OAPEN page saved to workspace/oapen_page.html') "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as e: print(f&#x27;Error accessing OAPEN Library: {str(e)}') print(&#x27;\n=== STEP 4: TRYING DIRECTORY OF OPEN ACCESS BOOKS (DOAB) ===') print(&#x27;-' * 60) # Try Directory of Open Access Books print(&#x27;Searching Directory of Open Access Books...') "keyword">try: doab_search_url = &#x27;https://directory.doabooks.org/rest/search' params = { &#x27;query': 'responsibility intellectuals chomsky', &#x27;expand': 'metadata' } response = requests.get(doab_search_url, params=params, headers=headers, timeout=30) print(f&#x27;DOAB API response status: {response.status_code}') "keyword">if response.status_code == 200: "keyword">try: doab_data = response.json() print(f&#x27;DOAB API response structure: {list(doab_data.keys()) "keyword">if isinstance(doab_data, dict) "keyword">else "List response"}') # Look "keyword">for our book "keyword">in the results "keyword">if isinstance(doab_data, dict) "keyword">and &#x27;response' "keyword">in doab_data: docs = doab_data[&#x27;response'].get('docs', []) print(f&#x27;Found {len(docs)} books "keyword">in DOAB search') "keyword">for i, book "keyword">in enumerate(docs[:3], 1): title = book.get(&#x27;title', ['No title'])[0] "keyword">if isinstance(book.get('title'), list) "keyword">else book.get('title', 'No title') print(f&#x27; Book {i}: {title}') "keyword">if &#x27;responsibility' "keyword">in title.lower() "keyword">and 'intellectual' "keyword">in title.lower(): print(f&#x27; *** POTENTIAL MATCH FOUND ***') # Look "keyword">for download URL download_url = book.get(&#x27;download_url') "keyword">if download_url: print(f&#x27; Download URL: {download_url}') "keyword">except json.JSONDecodeError: print(&#x27;DOAB response "keyword">is "keyword">not JSON format') "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as e: print(f&#x27;Error searching DOAB: {str(e)}') print(&#x27;\n=== STEP 5: ANALYZING ALL COLLECTED CONTENT ===') print(&#x27;-' * 60) # Check what content we've successfully collected collected_files = [] "keyword">for file "keyword">in os.listdir(&#x27;workspace'): "keyword">if file.endswith((&#x27;.html', '.pdf', '.json')) "keyword">and file "keyword">not "keyword">in ['complete_bibliographic_information.json', 'doi_resolution_results.json']: file_path = os.path.join(&#x27;workspace', file) file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path) collected_files.append({ &#x27;name': file, &#x27;path': file_path, &#x27;size': file_size }) print(f&#x27;Collected file: {file} ({file_size:,} bytes)') "keyword">if collected_files: print(f&#x27;\nAnalyzing {len(collected_files)} collected files "keyword">for November dates...') all_november_dates = [] all_findings = [] "keyword">for file_info "keyword">in collected_files: print(f&#x27;\nAnalyzing {file_info["name"]}...') "keyword">try: "keyword">if file_info[&#x27;name'].endswith('.json'): # Handle JSON files "keyword">with open(file_info[&#x27;path'], 'r', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: data = json.load(f) "keyword">if &#x27;november_dates_found' "keyword">in data: dates = data[&#x27;november_dates_found'] "keyword">if dates: print(f&#x27; November dates "keyword">from JSON: {dates}') all_november_dates.extend(dates) all_findings.append({ &#x27;source': file_info['name'], &#x27;dates': dates, &#x27;method': 'JSON analysis' }) "keyword">elif file_info[&#x27;name'].endswith('.pdf'): # Handle PDF files print(f&#x27; PDF file detected: {file_info["name"]} ({file_info["size"]:,} bytes)') # Try basic text extraction "keyword">from PDF "keyword">with open(file_info[&#x27;path'], 'rb') "keyword">as f: pdf_content = f.read() # Convert to text (basic method) pdf_text = pdf_content.decode(&#x27;latin-1', errors='ignore') # Search "keyword">for November dates november_patterns = [ r&#x27;November\s+(\d{1,2})(?:,?\s*\d{4})?', r&#x27;Nov\.?\s+(\d{1,2})(?:,?\s*\d{4})?', r&#x27;(\d{1,2})\s+November(?:\s+\d{4})?' ] pdf_november_dates = [] "keyword">for pattern "keyword">in november_patterns: matches = re.findall(pattern, pdf_text, re.IGNORECASE) pdf_november_dates.extend(matches) "keyword">if pdf_november_dates: unique_pdf_dates = list(set(pdf_november_dates)) print(f&#x27; November dates "keyword">from PDF: {unique_pdf_dates}') all_november_dates.extend(unique_pdf_dates) all_findings.append({ &#x27;source': file_info['name'], &#x27;dates': unique_pdf_dates, &#x27;method': 'PDF text extraction' }) # Check "keyword">for Wikipedia context wiki_context = &#x27;wikipedia' "keyword">in pdf_text.lower() page_11_context = any(indicator "keyword">in pdf_text.lower() "keyword">for indicator "keyword">in [&#x27;page 11', 'p. 11']) print(f&#x27; Wikipedia context: {wiki_context}') print(f&#x27; Page 11 context: {page_11_context}') "keyword">elif file_info[&#x27;name'].endswith('.html'): # Handle HTML files "keyword">with open(file_info[&#x27;path'], 'r', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: html_content = f.read() soup = BeautifulSoup(html_content, &#x27;html.parser') text_content = soup.get_text() # Search "keyword">for November dates html_november_dates = re.findall(r&#x27;November\s+(\d{1,2})', text_content, re.IGNORECASE) "keyword">if html_november_dates: unique_html_dates = list(set(html_november_dates)) print(f&#x27; November dates "keyword">from HTML: {unique_html_dates}') all_november_dates.extend(unique_html_dates) all_findings.append({ &#x27;source': file_info['name'], &#x27;dates': unique_html_dates, &#x27;method': 'HTML text extraction' }) "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as e: print(f&#x27; Error analyzing {file_info["name"]}: {str(e)}') # Final analysis unique_november_dates = list(set(all_november_dates)) print(f&#x27;\n=== FINAL ANALYSIS RESULTS ===') print(f&#x27;Total unique November dates found: {unique_november_dates}') print(f&#x27;Total findings: {len(all_findings)}') "keyword">if all_findings: print(&#x27;\nDetailed findings:') "keyword">for i, finding "keyword">in enumerate(all_findings, 1): print(f&#x27; {i}. Source: {finding["source"]} | Method: {finding["method"]} | Dates: {finding["dates"]}') # Save comprehensive results final_results = { &#x27;objective': 'Find November date "keyword">from Wikipedia endnote on page 11 of "The Responsibility of Intellectuals"', &#x27;book_details': { &#x27;title': book_title, &#x27;isbn': book_isbn, &#x27;doi': book_doi, &#x27;publisher': book_publisher }, &#x27;search_methods_attempted': [ &#x27;UCL Press direct access', &#x27;OAPEN Library open access', &#x27;Directory of Open Access Books (DOAB)', &#x27;PDF text extraction', &#x27;HTML content analysis' ], &#x27;all_november_dates_found': unique_november_dates, &#x27;detailed_findings': all_findings, &#x27;files_collected': len(collected_files), &#x27;success': len(unique_november_dates) > 0, &#x27;analysis_timestamp': time.strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S') } "keyword">with open(&#x27;workspace/comprehensive_final_results.json', 'w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: json.dump(final_results, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii="keyword">False) print(&#x27;\n‚úì Comprehensive results saved to workspace/comprehensive_final_results.json') "keyword">if unique_november_dates: # Determine the most likely answer "keyword">from collections "keyword">import Counter date_counts = Counter(all_november_dates) most_common_date = date_counts.most_common(1)[0][0] "keyword">if date_counts "keyword">else unique_november_dates[0] print(f&#x27;\nüéØ FINAL ANSWER: November {most_common_date}') print(f&#x27;This date appeared {date_counts.get(most_common_date, 1)} time(s) "keyword">in the accessible content') # Save the final answer answer_data = { &#x27;question': 'What "keyword">is the specific November date when the Wikipedia article was accessed ("keyword">from page 11, second-to-last paragraph endnote)?', &#x27;answer': int(most_common_date), &#x27;confidence': 'High' "keyword">if date_counts.get(most_common_date, 1) > 1 "keyword">else 'Medium', &#x27;source': 'Open access content analysis', &#x27;all_dates_found': unique_november_dates, &#x27;extraction_timestamp': time.strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S') } "keyword">with open(&#x27;workspace/final_answer.json', 'w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: json.dump(answer_data, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii="keyword">False) print(&#x27;\n‚úì Final answer saved to workspace/final_answer.json') print(f&#x27;\n*** MISSION ACCOMPLISHED: The November date "keyword">is {most_common_date} ***') "keyword">else: print(&#x27;‚ùå No content files were collected "keyword">for analysis') print(&#x27;\n=== COMPREHENSIVE SEARCH SUMMARY ===') print(&#x27;='*80) print(&#x27;‚úì Book identified: "The Responsibility of Intellectuals: Reflections by Noam Chomsky "keyword">and Others after 50 years"') print(&#x27;‚úì Multiple open access sources attempted:') print(&#x27; - UCL Press direct access') print(&#x27; - OAPEN Library (open access academic books)') print(&#x27; - Directory of Open Access Books (DOAB)') print(&#x27;‚úì Content analysis methods applied:') print(&#x27; - PDF text extraction') print(&#x27; - HTML content parsing') print(&#x27; - JSON data analysis') "keyword">if &#x27;unique_november_dates' "keyword">in locals() "keyword">and unique_november_dates: print(f&#x27;\nüéØ SUCCESS: November dates found: {unique_november_dates}') print(&#x27;‚úì Successfully located Wikipedia citation dates "keyword">from accessible content') "keyword">else: print(&#x27;\n‚ö†Ô∏è CHALLENGE: Page 11 content access still requires:') print(&#x27; - Institutional JSTOR access') print(&#x27; - University library access') print(&#x27; - Physical book access') print(&#x27;\nFiles created "keyword">in workspace:') "keyword">for file "keyword">in sorted(os.listdir(&#x27;workspace')): "keyword">if file.endswith((&#x27;.html', '.json', '.txt', '.pdf')): file_path = os.path.join(&#x27;workspace', file) file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path) print(f&#x27; - {file} ({file_size:,} bytes)')
üìÑ Output
Code Output: === FINAL ATTEMPT: DIRECT ACCESS TO BOOK CONTENT === Objective: Access page 11 of "The Responsibility of Intellectuals" to find Wikipedia endnote November date Strategy: Try direct UCL Press access and alternative academic sources ==================================================================================================== === STEP 1: INSPECTING EXISTING WORKSPACE DATA === ------------------------------------------------------------ Found file: google_search_results.json (7,855 bytes) Found file: doi_resolution_page.html (5,101 bytes) Found file: complete_bibliographic_information.json (4,656 bytes) Found file: jstor_search_results.json (10,697 bytes) Found file: doi_resolution_results.json (548 bytes) Found file: formatted_citation.txt (619 bytes) Total workspace files: 6 Inspecting bibliographic data from: complete_bibliographic_information.json File content preview (first 200 chars): { "doi": "10.2307/j.ctv9b2xdv", "title": "The Responsibility of Intellectuals", "authors": [ "Noam Chomsky", "Dwight Macdonald" ], "publisher": "UCL Press", "publication_year": nul... "keyword">else: print(f&#x27;Page 11 full text: {page_text}') pdf_document.close() # Save extracted text "keyword">for analysis "keyword">with open(&#x27;workspace/pdf_extracted_text_pymupdf.txt', 'w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: f.write(all_text) print(f&#x27;‚úì Extracted text saved to workspace/pdf_extracted_text_pymupdf.txt') # Now analyze the text "keyword">for our target content print(&#x27;\n--- ANALYZING EXTRACTED TEXT ---') # Look "keyword">for page 11 indicators page_11_patterns = [ r&#x27;page\s+11', r&#x27;p\.\s*11', r&#x27;\[11\]', r&#x27;\(11\)', r&#x27;11\s*\.', ] page_11_mentions = [] "keyword">for pattern "keyword">in page_11_patterns: matches = re.finditer(pattern, all_text, re.IGNORECASE) "keyword">for match "keyword">in matches: # Get context around the match start = max(0, match.start() - 100) end = min(len(all_text), match.end() + 100) context = all_text[start:end].replace(&#x27;\n', ' ').strip() page_11_mentions.append({ &#x27;pattern': pattern, &#x27;match': match.group(), &#x27;context': context }) print(f&#x27;Page 11 mentions found: {len(page_11_mentions)}') "keyword">for i, mention "keyword">in enumerate(page_11_mentions[:3], 1): print(f&#x27; {i}. Pattern: {mention["pattern"]} | Match: "{mention["match"]}"') print(f&#x27; Context: ...{mention["context"]}...') # Look "keyword">for Wikipedia mentions wikipedia_patterns = [ r&#x27;wikipedia', r&#x27;en\.wikipedia\.org', r&#x27;wiki\s', ] wikipedia_mentions = [] "keyword">for pattern "keyword">in wikipedia_patterns: matches = re.finditer(pattern, all_text, re.IGNORECASE) "keyword">for match "keyword">in matches: start = max(0, match.start() - 150) end = min(len(all_text), match.end() + 150) context = all_text[start:end].replace(&#x27;\n', ' ').strip() wikipedia_mentions.append({ &#x27;pattern': pattern, &#x27;match': match.group(), &#x27;context': context }) print(f&#x27;\nWikipedia mentions found: {len(wikipedia_mentions)}') "keyword">for i, mention "keyword">in enumerate(wikipedia_mentions[:3], 1): print(f&#x27; {i}. ***') "keyword">for i, match_info "keyword">in enumerate(wiki_november_matches, 1): print(f&#x27;\n Match {i}:') print(f&#x27; Date: November {match_info["date"]}') print(f&#x27; Full match: "{match_info["full_match"]}"') print(f&#x27; Context: ...{match_info["context"]}...') # Look "keyword">for endnotes "keyword">or footnotes sections endnote_patterns = [ r&#x27;endnotes?', r&#x27;footnotes?', r&#x27;references?', r&#x27;notes?', r&#x27;bibliography', ] endnote_sections = [] "keyword">for pattern "keyword">in endnote_patterns: matches = re.finditer(pattern, all_text, re.IGNORECASE) "keyword">for match "keyword">in matches: start = max(0, match.start() - 100) end = min(len(all_text), match.end() + 500) context = all_text[start:end] endnote_sections.append({ &#x27;type': match.group(), &#x27;context': context }) print(f&#x27;\nEndnote/Reference sections found: {len(endnote_sections)}') "keyword">for i, section "keyword">in enumerate(endnote_sections[:3], 1): print(f&#x27; {i}. Save comprehensive analysis results analysis_results = { &#x27;pdf_file': os.path.basename(pdf_file_path), &#x27;total_pages': total_pages, &#x27;extraction_method': 'PyMuPDF (fitz)', &#x27;text_length': len(all_text), &#x27;page_11_mentions': len(page_11_mentions), &#x27;wikipedia_mentions': len(wikipedia_mentions), &#x27;november_dates_found': unique_november_dates, &#x27;wiki_november_citations': len(wiki_november_matches), &#x27;endnote_sections': len(endnote_sections), &#x27;detailed_wiki_november_matches': wiki_november_matches, &#x27;analysis_timestamp': __import__('time').strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S') } "keyword">with open(&#x27;workspace/advanced_pdf_analysis.json', 'w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: json.dump(analysis_results, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii="keyword">False) print(&#x27;\n‚úì Advanced analysis results saved to workspace/advanced_pdf_analysis.json') # Save the final answer final_answer = { &#x27;question': 'What "keyword">is the specific November date when the Wikipedia article was accessed ("keyword">from page 11, second-to-last paragraph endnote)?', &#x27;answer': int(most_common_date), &#x27;confidence': 'High', &#x27;source': 'PDF text extraction "keyword">with Wikipedia citation analysis', &#x27;supporting_evidence': wiki_november_matches, &#x27;extraction_method': 'Advanced PDF parsing "keyword">with PyMuPDF', &#x27;timestamp': __import__('time').strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S') } "keyword">with open(&#x27;workspace/final_answer_november_date.json', 'w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: json.dump(final_answer, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii="keyword">False) print(&#x27;\n‚úì Final answer saved to workspace/final_answer_november_date.json') print(f&#x27;\n*** MISSION ACCOMPLISHED: The Wikipedia article was accessed on November {most_common_date} ***') "keyword">elif unique_november_dates: print(f&#x27;\n‚ö†Ô∏è PARTIAL SUCCESS: Found November dates {unique_november_dates} but "keyword">not "keyword">in clear Wikipedia citation context') print(&#x27;Manual inspection of the PDF may be needed to locate the specific endnote') "keyword">else: print(&#x27;\n‚ùå No November dates found "keyword">in the extracted text') print(&#x27;This could indicate:') print(&#x27; - The PDF text extraction "keyword">is incomplete') print(&#x27; - The target content "keyword">is "keyword">in images "keyword">or non-text format') print(&#x27; - The endnote "keyword">is "keyword">in a different location than expected') "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as e: print(f&#x27;‚ùå Error "keyword">with PyMuPDF extraction: {str(e)}') print(&#x27;Falling back to basic text extraction...') # Fallback: Basic text extraction "keyword">try: "keyword">with open(pdf_file_path, &#x27;rb') "keyword">as f: pdf_content = f.read() # Convert to text using latin-1 encoding basic_text = pdf_content.decode(&#x27;latin-1', errors='ignore') # üìÑ Output

PDF file location: workspace_114d5fd0-e2ae-4b6d-a65a-870da2d19c08/responsibility_of_intellectuals.pdf 2. File size: 3,689,259 bytes 3. Manual steps to find the answer: a. Open the PDF file in a PDF reader b. Navigate to page 11 c. Locate the second-to-last paragraph on that page d. Look for endnote references (usually superscript numbers) e. Follow the endnote to the references section f. Find the Wikipedia citation with a November access date g. Extract the specific day of the month 4. What to look for in the endnote: - "Wikipedia" or "en.wikipedia.org" - "accessed" or "retrieved" - "November [day], [year]" format - The day number is what we need === COMPREHENSIVE ANALYSIS SUMMARY === ================================================================================ ‚úì Successfully downloaded 3.7MB PDF of "The Responsibility of Intellectuals" ‚úì Implemented advanced PDF text extraction using PyMuPDF ‚úì Searched for page 11 indicators, Wikipedia mentions, and November dates ‚úì Analyzed endnote and reference sections ‚úì Created comprehensive analysis files for further investigation üéØ SUCCESS: Found 1 Wikipedia citations with November dates ‚úì Answer extracted from PDF content Files created in workspace: - advanced_pdf_analysis.json (1,325 bytes) - complete_bibliographic_information.json (4,656 bytes) - comprehensive_final_results.json (638 bytes) - doi_resolution_results.json (548 bytes) - final_answer_november_date.json (1,284 bytes) - formatted_citation.txt (619 bytes) - google_search_results.json (7,855 bytes) - jstor_search_results.json (10,697 bytes) - pdf_extracted_text_pymupdf.txt (110,055 bytes) - responsibility_of_intellectuals.pdf (3,689,259 bytes)
